instruction: What is the subject of this tender document?
output: The tender is for the Realization of Control Unit for Human Metabolic Simulator [1].

instruction: Which Indian government entity is responsible for issuing this tender?
output: The tender is issued by the Government of India, Department of Space, Human Space Flight Centre (HSFC) BENGALURU [1, 2].

instruction: What are the mandatory requirements for vendors concerning the pre-bid meeting?
output: Participation in the Pre-bid meeting is mandatory, and offers from vendors who have not participated shall be considered invalid [1, 3].

instruction: What is the tender number and the date it was published?
output: The Tender No. is HSFC/Group-D/HS202300000401, and the Tender Publish Date is 20-01-2023 13:30 [2].

instruction: What are the Bid Submission Due Date and the Bid Opening Date?
output: The Bid Submission Due Date is 10-02-2023 10:00, and the Bid Opening Date is 10-02-2023 10:01 [3].

instruction: Which specific categories of vendors are permitted to participate in this tender?
output: Only Class-I and Class-II Local suppliers as per the Make in India Policy are eligible to participate [4].

instruction: Are foreign vendors allowed to submit quotations for this tender?
output: No, foreign vendors are not permitted to participate, and quotations directly from Foreign OEMs or agents quoting on their behalf are not allowed [4].

instruction: Does the Purchase Preference policy for MSEs apply to procurement under the Gaganyaan Programme?
output: No, the Product/Price Preference applicable as per the guidelines of the Government of India for MSEs and other agencies shall not be applicable for procurement under the Gaganyaan Programme [5].

instruction: Are MSEs exempted from providing Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) and Performance Security?
output: MSEs are exempted from EMD upon producing a valid Udayam Certificate, but Performance Security is mandatory for MSEs for Goods and Services [5, 6].

instruction: What are the consequences if a Tenderer is found ineligible after the opening of the tenders?
output: The tender shall become invalid ipso facto, and costs of the tender document and processing fees shall not be refunded [7].

instruction: What action will HSFC take regarding bids deemed to employ predatory pricing?
output: Predatory Pricing will not be accepted, and such bids quoting unreasonably low prices that do not meet the Basic Cost of input are liable to be ignored or rejected [8, 9].

instruction: How will HSFC notify prospective Tenderers about modifications to the bidding document prior to the submission deadline?
output: The amendment will be notified in writing or by fax or e-mail to prospective Tenderers or uploaded online on the website [10].

instruction: What is the policy regarding the submission of tenders via manual methods like postal mail or fax?
output: HSFC will not be responsible for non-receipt of tenders due to postal delays, and manual, postal, courier, e-mail, or fax offers will not be considered unless specifically called for [11-13].

instruction: What must be done if samples are called for by the Purchaser?
output: Samples, if called for, should be submitted free of charge by the Tenderers, and HSFC shall not be responsible for any loss or damages thereof [14].

instruction: What must be indicated in the offer regarding the weight of the items?
output: The Approximate Net and Gross weight of the items offered shall be indicated in the offer, and dimensional details should also be included if available [15].

instruction: What period of validity is required for the quotation?
output: The quotation should be valid for a minimum period of 120 days from the date of opening of the Tender [13, 16].

instruction: What happens if a Tenderer attempts to change their offer after submitting it online?
output: Once the offer is submitted through online mode by the Tenderer, he will not be able to provide/submit a revised offer or make any alteration or change to the offer or any terms contained therein [17].

instruction: In a Two-Part Tender, what details must be covered in the Technical Bid (Part-1)?
output: Part-1 must cover Delivery Terms, Delivery Period, Payment Terms (without mentioning the price or amount), acceptance obligation, Validity of the Offer, Warranty/Guarantee, Liquidated Damages, and technical literature/catalogues [18].

instruction: What is the requirement for sellers providing Goods and Services to Central Government Organisations concerning registration?
output: It shall be mandatory for sellers to be registered on GeM and obtain a Unique GeM Seller ID at the time of placement of Order/Acceptance of contract [19].

instruction: Based on the Make in India policy, what is the required local content percentage for a Class-I Local Supplier?
output: The local content must be Equal to or more than 50% for a Class-I Local Supplier [20].

instruction: What is defined as the Margin of purchase preference?
output: The margin of purchase preference means the maximum extent (up to 20%) to which the price quoted by the Class-I local supplier can be above the L1 (lowest technically accepted tender) landed cost [21, 22].

instruction: If the lowest bidder (L1) is not a Class-I local supplier for divisible goods, how is the order quantity split?
output: 50% of the order quantity shall be awarded to L1, and the lowest Class-I local supplier will be invited to match the L1 price for the remaining 50% quantity, provided their price falls within the 20% margin of purchase preference [21, 22].

instruction: What happens if the lowest eligible Class-I local supplier refuses to match the L1 price for the remaining quantity?
output: The next higher Class-I local supplier within the margin of purchase preference shall be invited to match the L1 price, and if none agree, 100% quantity shall be ordered on the original L1 bidder [23].

instruction: Under the Make in India policy, what is the exemption limit for small purchases?
output: Procurements where the estimated value to be procured is less than Rs. 5 lakhs shall be exempt from the Public Procurement (Preference to Make in India) Order [24].

instruction: What self-certification is required from local suppliers regarding local content?
output: The Class-I & II local supplier should provide a Self-Certification along with the technical offer indicating that the item meets the minimum local content and provide the percentage of local content along with details of the location(s) where value addition is made [25].

instruction: If a complaint is filed against a vendor for false declaration of local content, what is the complaint fee structure?
output: The complainant must pay a fee of Rs. 2 Lakhs or 1% of the locally manufactured items being procured (up to a maximum of Rs. 5 Lakhs), whichever is higher [26].

instruction: What is the definition of 'Contract' within this tender document?
output: The Contract shall mean the documents forming the tender, the offer, the award of tender, and the formal agreement executed between the Purchaser and the Contractor, including conditions, specifications, designs, drawings, and instructions [27, 28].

instruction: When is the date of start of the Contract reckoned from?
output: The date of start of Contract shall be reckoned from the date of issue of Letter of Award [29].

instruction: Who represents the Purchaser (President of India) in this contract?
output: The Purchaser shall mean The President of India represented by its Director or Sr Head/Head, Purchase and Stores, Human Space Flight Centre (HSFC) Bengaluru or his successors or assigns [30].

instruction: What type of prices will be considered by the Purchaser?
output: Tenders offering Fixed Prices will be considered; however, quotations with prices subject to adjustment based on specific variation formulas may be considered if insisted upon by the Tenderer [31].

instruction: What special GST rate is HSFC, Bengaluru eligible to pay?
output: HSFC, Bengaluru is eligible for 5% GST (CGST @ 2.5% and SGST @ 2.5% for intrastate, or IGST @ 5% for interstate) for goods being procured for Launch Vehicles, Satellites and Payloads [32-34].

instruction: What document will HSFC provide to the contractor to facilitate customs duty exemption on imported items?
output: The necessary Customs Duty Concessional Certification (CDCC) shall be provided by HSFC/Respective identified ISRO Centres/Units, as HSFC is partially exempted from Customs Duty [35, 36].

instruction: What security must the successful Tenderer furnish towards the cost of Free Issue Materials (FIM)?
output: The successful Tenderers shall furnish a Bank Guarantee (BG) towards the cost of Free Issue Materials, which must be kept valid till the supply and acceptance of the final product [37, 38].

instruction: What is the standard payment period after the receipt and acceptance of stores?
output: Normally, payment will be made for the accepted Stores within 30 days from the date of Receipt and Acceptance of the Material at Human Space Flight Centre (HSFC) [39, 40].

instruction: What percentage of the contract value is required for the irrevocable interest-free Performance Security?
output: The Contractor shall execute an irrevocable interest-free Performance Security for 3% of the Contract value [41, 42].

instruction: For how long must the Performance Security Bank Guarantee be valid?
output: The Bank Guarantee must be valid for the entire contract period and an additional period of 60 days beyond the date of completion of all contractual obligations, including Warranty obligations [42, 43].

instruction: Who bears the cost of bank charges for payments inside India and outside India?
output: All Bank Charges inside India shall be borne by the Purchaser, while all Bank Charges outside India shall be borne by the Contractor [39, 40].

instruction: Who is the Ultimate Consignee specified in the contract?
output: The Ultimate Consignee is the Purchase & Stores Officer (Stores), Human Space Flight Centre, ISRO HQ Campus, Anthariksh Bhavan, New BEL Road Bengaluru-560 094 or any other ISRO Centers/Units as specified in Purchase Order [44].

instruction: What should the contractor do if any part of the Stores is damaged or lost during transit?
output: The replacement of such Stores shall be effected by the Contractor within a reasonable time to avoid unnecessary delay in the intended usage of the Stores [45].

instruction: What are the actions the Purchaser can take if the supplied stores are found to be defective?
output: The Purchaser shall either reject the Stores or request the Contractor to repair, rectify, or replace the same at their own cost. If the Contractor fails to do so, the Purchaser may repair/replace the defective Stores and recover the extra cost, or terminate the Contract for default [46, 47].

instruction: List two examples of force majeure circumstances that may excuse non-performance.
output: Force majeure circumstances include, but are not restricted to, flood, fire, earthquake, civil commotion, sabotage, explosion, strike, lock out, freight embargo, acts of the Government, or acts of God [48].

instruction: What is the maximum limit for Liquidated Damages the Purchaser can recover for delayed delivery?
output: The total Liquidated Damages shall not exceed Ten percent (10 percent) of the Contract price of the unit or units so delayed [49].

instruction: If erection or installation of software is the Contractor's responsibility and they fail to perform, what right does the Purchaser have?
output: The Purchaser shall have the right to get the Erection and Installation of the Software done through any source/agency of their choice, and the Contractor shall be liable to bear any additional expenditure incurred [50].

instruction: Under what conditions can the Purchaser terminate the contract by giving 30 days prior notice?
output: Termination can occur due to repeated non-performance, failure to deliver the final product within the stipulated schedule, failure to comply with quality requirements, or if the Contractor becomes bankrupt or otherwise insolvent [51, 52].

instruction: What is the limitation of liability for the Contractor stated in the contract?
output: The Contractor's total liability to the Purchaser, whether in Contract, shall not exceed the total amount paid to the Contractor under the Contract [53].

instruction: What three main components form the hybrid Data Line Protector (DLP) circuit?
output: The DLP circuit is a hybrid combination of a Gas Discharge Tube (GDT), a Series Resistor, and a TVS Diode / Transzorb (Back-toâ€“Back Zener Diode) connected in a Pi- fashion [1].

instruction: Explain the sequential protection mechanism of the DLP circuit during a voltage surge.
output: When a surge exceeds the Transzorb's breakdown voltage, the Transzorb conducts, limiting the voltage across the end equipment. This current flow causes the voltage across the GDT to raise until it starts conducting, routing all surge current safely to ground [1, 2].

instruction: What is the primary function of the Transzorb in the protection circuit?
output: The Transzorb has a lesser response time and limits the voltage across the end equipment to its rated clamp voltage to prevent the surge from causing damage [2].

instruction: What activities constitute the scope of supply for the DLP Cards procurement?
output: The supply consists of procurement of specified brand DLP Cards, design of suitable PCB circuits, implementation of circuit boards with suitable connector arrangement, and carrying out satisfactory tests before supplying the boards along with test reports [2, 3].

instruction: How many DLP channels are required per board, and what type of monitoring must be provided?
output: Each DLP board must have 12 Channels, and must include Parallel Monitoring Provision for all 12 Channels [3].

instruction: Describe the required connector interfaces for the DLP board.
output: The board requires 2 connectors, which must be 25 pin Male D-sub Connectors with 90 Degree Bend [3].

instruction: What are the required DC Breakdown Voltage and number of terminals for the GDT component?
output: The GDT must have a DC Breakdown Voltage of 150 V +/- 20 % and be a 2 Terminal Device [4].

instruction: List the specified brands for the Gas Discharge Tube (GDT).
output: The specified brands for the GDT are SIEMENS, EPCOS, and BOURNS [4].

instruction: What are the Peak Pulse power capability and polarity requirements for the Tranzorbs?
output: The Tranzorbs must have a Peak Pulse power capability of 1500 Watts with a 10/1000µs wave form (repetitive rate 0.01%), and they must be Bidirectional Devices [4].

instruction: What is the required Power Dissipation and which standards must the Tranzorbs meet?
output: The Tranzorbs must have a Power Dissipation of 6.5W and conform to JEDEC and AEC â€“ Q101 standards [5].

instruction: What are the wattage and composition specifications for the required Resistors?
output: The resistors must be Wire Wound Resistors, 5.0 Watt, Ceramic, with Axial leads [6].

instruction: Specify the resistor value required for use with the 45V, 60V, or 100V TRANZORBs.
output: A 5.0 Ω Â± 5% resistor is specified for use with the 45V, 60V, or 100V TRANZORBs [6].

instruction: What material and thickness are required for the PCB boards?
output: The PCB must be a very high quality, double sided board made of Glass Epoxy Hema FR-4 with a 1.6 mm thickness [6, 7].

instruction: What are the required dimensions and masking specifications for the PCB?
output: The PCB dimensions are 210 mm x 115 mm (with a tolerance of +/-10 %), and both sides must be 'Green Masked' with high quality Lacquer for Protection [7, 8].

instruction: How are the ground connections handled on the PCB panel plate?
output: All Ground connection must be extended to a banana socket fitted onto the panel plate [9].

output: The bidder must submit the compliance statement and product details/catalogue with the quotation [10]. After placement of order, the bidder must submit the PCB layout and track design drawing for department approval before fabrication [10].

output: The bidder shall submit one sample of PCB along with components details for approval, and must also submit the Quality Plan for Testing and Qualification of the items [10].

output: PCB drawings and details of GTP / QAP submission are required within 2 weeks after P.O. for clearance. Sample board delivery is within 10 weeks from the Department clearance date, and the final delivery is within 6 weeks from the sample board clearance [11, 12].

output: PDI shall be carried out by the Department Engineers on all the items at the Suppliersâ€™ works. The Supplier must provide all necessary Test facilities, test equipment, and instruments for qualification testing during inspection [12].

instruction: What are the details of the Pre-Bid Date, Time, and Venue?
output: The Pre-Bid Date and Time is 19-06-2024 12:00:00, and the Pre-Bid Venue is LRDE, Bengaluru. [9]

instruction: What minimum local content is required for qualifying as a Class 1 Local Supplier?
output: Minimum 50% Local Content is required for qualifying as Class 1 Local Supplier. [9]

instruction: What minimum local content is required for qualifying as a Class 2 Local Supplier?
output: Minimum 20% Local Content is required for qualifying as Class 2 Local Supplier. [9]

instruction: What is the required delivery period in days?
output: The required Delivery Days are 180. [10]

instruction: What right does the Purchaser reserve regarding quantity changes at the time of contract placement (Option Clause)?
output: The Purchaser reserves the right to increase or decrease the quantity to be ordered up to 25 percent of bid quantity at the time of placement of contract, and also reserves the right to increase the ordered quantity by up to 25% of the contracted quantity during the currency of the contract at the contracted rates. [11]

instruction: What is the requirement for the bidder regarding Functional Service Centres in case of carry-in warranty?
output: Bidder/OEM must have a Functional Service Centre in the State of each Consignee's Location in case of carry-in warranty. If a service center is not already there, the successful bidder / OEM shall have to establish one within 30 days of award of contract. [12]

instruction: What is the minimum average annual financial turnover criteria for the bidder?
output: The minimum average annual financial turnover of the bidder during the last three years, ending on 31st March of the previous financial year, should be as indicated in the bid document. [13]

instruction: What documents must the bidder submit for Vendor Code Creation?
output: The bidder shall submit: a. Copy of PAN Card, b. Copy of GSTIN, c. Copy of Cancelled Cheque, and d. Copy of EFT Mandate duly certified by Bank. [14]

instruction: What specific meaning is attached to the quantity '1 set' in the context of this bid?
output: 1 set = 1 Job. [14]

instruction: What is the minimum requirement for telephone support for service?
output: BIDDER/OEM must have Dedicated/toll Free Telephone No. for Service Support. [15]

instruction: What is the specified warranty period for the supplied products?
output: The Warranty period of the supplied products shall be 1 years from the date of final acceptance of goods or after completion of installation, commissioning & testing of goods (if included in the scope of supply), at consignee location. [15]

instruction: What is the specific experience criteria stated in Buyer Added Bid Specific Term 11?
output: The Bidder or its OEM {themselves or through reseller(s)} should have regularly, manufactured and supplied same or similar Category Products to any Central / State Govt Organization / PSU / Public Listed Company for 3 years before the bid opening date. [16]

instruction: What kind of proof is considered valid for meeting the experience criteria?
output: Any one of the following documents may be considered as valid proof: Contract copy along with Invoice(s) with self-certification; Execution certificate by client with contract value; or Any other document in support of contract execution like Third Party Inspection release note, etc. [17]

instruction: What ISO certification must the bidder or the OEM have?
output: The bidder or the OEM of the offered products must have ISO 9001 certification. [18]

instruction: What is the financial requirement regarding the OEM's Net Worth?
output: Net Worth of the OEM should be positive as per the last audited financial statement. [18]

instruction: What happens if a bidder incorporates a clause against the MSME policy or Preference to Make in India Policy?
output: If any clause(s) is / are incorporated by the Buyer regarding incorporating any clause against the MSME policy and Preference to Make in India Policy, the bid and resultant contracts shall be treated as null and void and such bids may be cancelled by GeM. [19]

instruction: How quickly must a seller raise a representation against additional clauses after bid publication?
output: The seller must raise their representation against additional clauses within 4 days of bid publication on GeM. [20]

instruction: What is the Tender Number, the issuing organization, and the Bid Due Date and Time for this procurement?
output: The Tender No is SM/OS/RC/8480MIS/39/40/25/2 [1-10], issued by the Rotary Wing Research & Design Centre, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) [1-8]. The Due Date for submission is 19-11-2025, 23:00 Hrs [1-3, 5-8].

instruction: What is the mandatory method for submitting the technical and price bids, and what happens if a hard copy is submitted?
output: Bidders must submit their proposals (Price bid and Technical bid) online at HALs e-procurement portal (http://eproc.hal-india.co.in) [1, 8]. Tenders not submitted through the e-procurement portal will not be considered and will be rejected (No Hard copies of Technical and Price bid should be submitted) [1, 11].

instruction: What are the four main deliverable milestones (D1 to D5) for the IMRH work package?
output: The four main milestones are M1-1 REQUIREMENT CAPTURING (D1) [12], M2-1 LAYOUT AND ANALYSIS (D2&D3) [12], M3-1 DETAIL DESIGN AND DWG (D4) [2], and M4-1 ENGINEERING CHANGE MANAGEMENT (D5) [2].

instruction: What is the mandatory financial distribution requirement for the Engineering Change Management (D5) item and how is commercial evaluation conducted?
output: The Vendor has to quote a mandatory 29% of the total work package cost for the Engineering Change Management item (Sl. No. 4 for IMRH [13] and Sl. No. 8 for DBMRH [14, 15]). Commercial evaluation will be done on a package basis (Sl. No. 1 to 4 is one package for IMRH, and Sl. No. 5 to 8 is the other package for DBMRH) [3, 5, 13, 16].

instruction: What is the total project duration, and what is the estimated total volume of drawings expected?
output: The delivery or project time line is **52 months** from the date of acceptance of PO (T0) [17, 18]. Approximately **14000 drawings** are expected to be released in the total duration of 52 months for *each* package (IMRH and DBMRH) [3, 19].

instruction: What amount of Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) is required, and in what forms is it acceptable?
output: EMD needs to be submitted for **Rs. 2 lac** along with the bid [20]. EMD shall be acceptable in the form of DD/Bankers Cheque/Pay order/Bank Guarantee (including e-Bank Guarantee) [21].

instruction: What are the two most crucial vendor qualification criteria regarding experience and financial turnover?
output: The Engineering Service Provider should have a minimum **Seven years of experience** in Airframe Design and Analysis of Fixed wing or Rotary wing Aircraft [22]. Additionally, the Bidder shall have an **average turnover of Rs. 200 Crore** for each of the last three financial years ending on 31st March 2024 [23].

instruction: What are the key restrictions regarding work location and Intellectual Property Rights (IPR)?
output: The vendor must execute the work within **HAL premises at Bangalore** [17, 24]. The Design Intellectual Property (IP) of the work carried out as part of this work package will be **exclusively with HAL only** [25-27].

instruction: What quality target (First Time Right) is set for FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) and Part and assembly models and drawings (D4)?
output: The desirable quality target for FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) is **> 98%** [28, 29], and for Part and assembly models and drawings (D4) it is **> 95%** [28-30].

instruction: List four software tools provided by HAL for execution and state the rule regarding external electronic gadgets.
output: HAL will provide software tools including Teamcenter 12.4 & above, NX 1926 & above, Hyper-works, and MSC Patran [31-33]. The Engineering Service Provider is **not permitted to bring and use any laptops/PCs/or any other electronic gadgets** inside the HAL work premises [26, 34].

instruction: What is the official title and classification of this technical document?
output: The document is titled 'Technical Requirements for Providing Engineering Services for Airframe Design and Analysis of IMRH' [1], and its classification is **RESTRICTED** [1].

instruction: What is the mission of the IMRH project undertaken by HAL RWRDC?
output: The Indian Multi Role Helicopter (IMRH) is a prestigious program of Design and Development of a **13-ton weight class** helicopter [2], envisaged to meet the Qualitative Requirements of the Indian Airforce [2].

instruction: List the five main structural sections of the IMRH airframe.
output: The airframe consists of: 1) Front Fuselage [3], 2) Center Fuselage [3], 3) Tail Boom and empennage [3], 4) Weapon Stub Wing [3], and 5) Cowlings & Firewalls [3].

instruction: What is the estimated volume of work in drawings for the IMRH design phase, and what percentage of that effort is expected for Engineering Change Management (D5)?
output: The anticipated work involved is approximately **10000 drawings** during the Design phase [4]. The Engineering Change Management phase (D5) effort is estimated to be **40% of the design phase effort** [4].

instruction: What is the primary objective of the 3D CAD Layout for interference and integration Check (D2)?
output: The purpose of the D2 Layout is for checking the assembly clearances between the parts, parts and fasteners, and Airframe and other LRUs [5]. This layout will also be used for **planning the Jig Design and subsequent manufacturing activities** [6].

instruction: What are the required First Time Right (FTR) quality targets for FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) and Part and assembly models and drawings (D4)?
output: The desirable quality target for FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) is **> 98%** [7]. For Part and assembly models and drawings (D4), the target is **> 95%** [7].

instruction: What is the total time duration allocated for the completion of the Detail Layout and Analysis (D2+D3) and the Detailed CAD Models + MBD + DWG (D4) milestones, starting from T1?
output: Milestone 2 (D2+D3) is scheduled for **T1 + 8 months** (=T2) [8], and Milestone 3 (D4) is scheduled for **T2 + 12 months** (=T3) [8], meaning the D2/D3 and D4 phases combined are scheduled for 20 months following the Requirement Capture phase (T1).

instruction: List two software tools HAL will provide, one for PLM/System Modelling and one for CAE Solvers.
output: HAL will provide **Teamcenter 12.4 & above** for PLM, System Modelling, Requirement Mapping [9] and solvers such as **MSC NASTRAN, HyperWorks (Optistruct), LS-DYNA, and Abaqus** [10].

instruction: What are the two key restrictions regarding the physical work location and the use of external electronic devices?
output: The work package must be executed **within HAL premises at Bangalore** [11]. The Service Provider is **not permitted to bring and use any laptops/PCs / or any other electronic gadgets** [12], including smart phones, smart watches, and USB storage devices [13], inside the HAL work premises.

instruction: What is the preferred employee ratio of Junior level to Middle level, and Middle level to Senior level Designers/Analysts?
output: The Engineering Service Provider shall maintain a proper employee ratio of Junior level to Middle level (Preferably **10:1**) and Middle level to Senior level (Preferably **5:1**) [14].

instruction: What are the structural requirements for the engine hot section in the Centre Fuselage?
output: The hot section around the engine is to be constructed using **Titanium alloy** to meet the fire-resistant requirements of DEFSTAN / FAR-29 amdt. 59 / CS-29 and other applicable standards [15].

instruction: What must the Engineering Service Provider do to receive ID cards and authorization to work at HAL?
output: Police verification should be undertaken for the vendor engineers selected for the HAL Project and must be submitted to RWRDC, HAL [16]. Additionally, the vendor staff must sign the **IT security undertaking** [13] and the vendor must sign a **Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)** [17].

instruction: What is the procedure for acceptance of the design deliverables?
output: The deliverable is deemed complete only after the **Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)** accepts the same [18]. Design work is ultimately approved by the Design committee nominated by HAL Management [19].

instruction: What must be included in the preparation of the Detailed 3D CAD Models (D4) regarding drawing standards and documentation?
output: The D4 deliverable must include Parametric 3D CAD Models in metric units [20], **Model Based Dimensioning (MBD)** as per MIL-STD-31000 (Latest Issue) [21], and a **Bill of Material (Material Schedule)** created in RWRDC template [21].

instruction: What is the organization responsible for issuing this technical document and its classification?
output: The document is issued by the **Rotary Wing Research and Design Centre (RWRDC), Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)**, Bangalore. The document classification is **RESTRICTED** [1].

instruction: What is the main objective and weight class of the Deck Based Multi Role Helicopter (DBMRH) program?
output: The DBMRH is a prestigious program for the Design and Development of a **12.5-ton weight class** helicopter, primarily envisaged to meet the Qualitative Requirements of the **Indian Navy** [2].

instruction: What are the five main structural sections that constitute the DBMRH airframe?
output: The DBMRH airframe consists of five main sections: 1) Front Fuselage, 2) Center Fuselage, 3) Tail Boom and empennage, 4) Weapon Suspension System, and 5) Cowlings & Firewalls [3, 4].

instruction: What are the minimum required cabin dimensions (Length x width x height) for the Center Fuselage, and how many troops should it accommodate?
output: The cabin dimensions should be at least **5.5m x 2.0m x 1.6m** (Length x width x height), and it should be able to accommodate **36 troops** [5].

instruction: What critical structural feature is required for the Tail Boom to meet stowage constraints?
output: The Tail Boom should have a **folding mechanism** (either manual or automatic) for meeting the stowage requirements from the Indian Navy [6]. The Tail Boom will be in two segments: stationary and movable [7].

instruction: What is the estimated volume of drawings required during the Design phase, and what percentage effort is anticipated for Engineering Change Management (D5)?
output: The anticipated work involved is approximately **10000 drawings** during the Design phase. The effort anticipated during the Engineering Change Management phase (D5) is **40% of the design phase effort** [8, 9].

instruction: What is the required calendar life and the instantaneous load factor clearance for the helicopter structure?
output: The helicopter should be in service for a Calendar life of **30 years or more** [10]. It should be cleared for operations up to instantaneous load factors of **+2 'g' and -0.5'g'** for defined All Up Weight (AUW) at sea level at cruise speed [10].

instruction: What material must be used for the engine hot section of the Centre Fuselage and why?
output: The hot section around the engine is to be constructed using **Titanium alloy** to meet the fire resistance requirements of DEFSTAN / FAR-29 amdt. 59 /CS-29 and other applicable standards [11].

instruction: What is the mandatory design standard for Model Based Dimensioning (MBD) in the deliverables?
output: Creation of Model Based Dimensioning (MBD) in the detail design parts and assemblies must be done as per **MIL-STD-31000 (Latest Issue)** [12, 13].

instruction: List four software tools provided by HAL for FEA Solvers.
output: HAL will provide FEA Solvers including **MSC NASTRAN, HyperWorks (Optistruct), LS-DYNA, and Abaqus** [14].

instruction: What are the required First Time Right (FTR) quality targets for 3D Design Layouts (D2) and FE Modeling and Analysis (D3)?
output: The desirable quality target for 3D Design Layouts (D2) is **> 85%**. For FE Modeling and Analysis (D3), the target is **> 98%** [15].

instruction: Where must the work package be executed, and what are the rules regarding data ownership and external electronic gadgets?
output: The work package must be executed **within HAL premises** [16]. The **Design Intellectual Property** of work carried out will be **exclusively with HAL only** [17]. The Service Provider is **not permitted to bring and use any laptops/PCs / or any other electronic gadgets** inside the HAL work premises [18, 19].

instruction: What are the required experience levels for Junior and Senior Designers/Analysts, and what is the preferred ratio between Middle and Senior staff?
output: Junior Designers/Analysts shall have a minimum **2 years** of experience, and Senior Designers/Analysts shall have a minimum **10 years** of experience [20]. The preferred employee ratio of Middle level to Senior level is **5:1** [20].

instruction: What is the scheduled duration for the entire project, measured from the Purchase Order (T0) date?
output: The schedule for milestones D1, D2+D3, D4, and D5 combined is: T0 + 2 + 8 + 12 + 30 months, totaling **52 months** from the placement of the Purchase Order (T0) [21, 22].

instruction: Which committee's acceptance is mandatory for deliverables, and who is the ultimate approving authority for the final design data?
output: The deliverable is deemed complete only after the **Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)** accepts the same [23]. However, the Design committee nominated by **HAL Management** will be the approving authority for the final design data [24].

instruction: Which company serves as the Buyer in the Integrity Pact, and what is its registered office address?
output: The Buyer is Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. (HAL), having its registered office at 15/1, Cubbon Road, Bangalore  560 001, India. [1]

instruction: According to the Integrity Pact, who monitors the tender process and contract execution?
output: The Buyer (HAL) has appointed **Independent External Monitor(s) (IEMs)** in consultation with the Central Vigilance Commission, who will monitor the tender process and the execution of the contract. [2, 3]

instruction: What specific action is prohibited for Bidder(s)/Seller(s) regarding competition in the tendering process?
output: The Bidder(s)/Seller(s) will not enter into any undisclosed agreement or understanding with other Bidder(s)/Seller(s) regarding prices, specifications, or any other actions to restrict competitiveness or to introduce **cartelization** in the bidding process. [4, 5]

instruction: If a Bidder is a Joint Venture (JV), who is required to sign the Integrity Pact, and who is responsible for adherence?
output: All the Partners of the Joint Venture must sign the Integrity Pact. The Bidder(s)/Seller(s) shall be held responsible for any violation/breach of the provisions of the IP by any one or more of its Partners. [6, 7]

instruction: What are the two specific interest rates used to calculate refunds for agency commission payments made by breaching vendors (Indian and Foreign)?
output: For foreign vendors, the rate is 2% per annum above the **Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR)**. For Indian vendors, the rate is the Marginal Cost of Funds-based Lending Rate (MCLR) of State Bank of India plus **2% per annum**. [8-10]

instruction: What is the consequence if the Bidder makes an incorrect statement regarding previous transgressions?
output: The Bidder(s)/Seller(s) can be disqualified from the tender process or the contract, if already awarded, can be terminated for such reason without any liability whatsoever on the Buyer. [11, 12]

instruction: What is the duration of the Standalone Integrity Pact (IP) for an unsuccessful Bidder(s)/Seller(s)?
output: The Standalone Integrity Pact expires for all unsuccessful Bidder(s)/Seller(s) within **6 months** from the date of placement of order / finalization of contract against this tender. [13]

instruction: What is the maximum time allowed for the Independent External Monitor(s) to submit their report of enquiry to CMD, HAL?
output: The report of enquiry shall be submitted to CMD, HAL as far as possible within 2 weeks, but **not more than 30 days**. [14, 15]

instruction: What is the primary difference in scope between the Standalone Integrity Pact and the Omnibus Integrity Pact?
output: The Omnibus Integrity Pact covers **all tenders / contract / agreements / Purchase Order etc.** between the Bidder(s)/Seller(s) and Buyer within its ambit, unlike the Standalone IP which applies to a single tender. [16]

instruction: What are the six scheduled payment milestones for the Detail Design & DWG (D4) phase, expressed as a percentage of D4 cost?
output: The D4 phase is split into four 25% payments (4th, 5th, 6th, and 7th Payments). [17, 18]

instruction: After completion of D4, what percentage of the total drawing number released is considered for the Engineering Change Management (D5) phase?
output: The number of drawings considered for D5 is **40% of the total number of drawing** released after completion of D4. [19]

instruction: In the Payment Plan (Enclosure XII), what is the final deliverable and corresponding payment milestone (14th Payment)?
output: The 14th Payment (40% of D5) is due upon **Completion of SOP and other deliverables** as mentioned in the technical requirement (Enclosure V and VI) at the end of **52 months**. [20]

instruction: What are the two primary purposes of the Performance Bank Guarantee (PBG) provided by the Vendor to HAL?
output: The PBG is required for: 1) The due fulfillment of the terms and conditions during the agreed time period, and 2) **Satisfactory performance of the items supplied to HAL during the warranty period**. [19]

instruction: What is the minimum required claim period for a Bank Guarantee after its specified validity date?
output: The claim period for a Bank Guarantee must be **not less than 1 year** from the date of expiry of the validity period of the BG. [21]

instruction: What specific helicopter program is mentioned as the Purpose of the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)?
output: The purpose of the NDA is for exploratory discussions concerning a possible collaboration relating to the supply of goods/services for **ALH (ADVANCED LIGHT HELICOPTER)**. [22]

instruction: For how long must the Receiving Party protect and keep the Proprietary Information in strict confidence under the NDA?
output: The obligation lasts for a period of **ten (10) years** from the effective date of the Agreement. [23]

instruction: What degree of care must the Receiving Party use to protect Proprietary Information?
output: The Receiving Party must use the same degree of precaution and safeguards as it uses to protect its own Proprietary Information of like importance, but in no case any less than **reasonable care**. [24]

instruction: What is the governing law and the venue for arbitration under the NDA?
output: The Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the **laws of India**. The venue of arbitration will be **Bangalore**. [25, 26]

instruction: What documents must the Bidder submit for Commercial Compliance, according to the Checklist (Enclosure XIII)?
output: The bidder must submit the Commercial Compliance (Encl III), **Non-Disclosure Agreement, Integrity Pact**, and **Earnest Money Deposit (EMD)**. [27]

instruction: What critical action must the Receiving Party take before making a disclosure of Proprietary Information required by a court or government order?
output: The Receiving Party must promptly and to the extent possible before making such disclosure **notify the Disclosing Party** of such order/demand and provide reasonable assistance to prevent the disclosure. [28]

instruction: What is the primary difference in scope between the Standalone Integrity Pact and the Omnibus Integrity Pact?
output: The Omnibus Integrity Pact covers **all tenders / contract / agreements / Purchase Order etc.** between the Bidder(s)/Seller(s) and Buyer within its ambit, unlike the Standalone IP which applies to a single tender. [16]

instruction: What are the six scheduled payment milestones for the Detail Design & DWG (D4) phase, expressed as a percentage of D4 cost?
output: The D4 phase is split into four 25% payments (4th, 5th, 6th, and 7th Payments). [17, 18]

instruction: After completion of D4, what percentage of the total drawing number released is considered for the Engineering Change Management (D5) phase?
output: The number of drawings considered for D5 is **40% of the total number of drawing** released after completion of D4. [19]

instruction: In the Payment Plan (Enclosure XII), what is the final deliverable and corresponding payment milestone (14th Payment)?
output: The 14th Payment (40% of D5) is due upon **Completion of SOP and other deliverables** as mentioned in the technical requirement (Enclosure V and VI) at the end of **52 months**. [20]

instruction: What are the two primary purposes of the Performance Bank Guarantee (PBG) provided by the Vendor to HAL?
output: The PBG is required for: 1) The due fulfillment of the terms and conditions during the agreed time period, and 2) **Satisfactory performance of the items supplied to HAL during the warranty period**. [19]

instruction: What is the minimum required claim period for a Bank Guarantee after its specified validity date?
output: The claim period for a Bank Guarantee must be **not less than 1 year** from the date of expiry of the validity period of the BG. [21]

instruction: What specific helicopter program is mentioned as the Purpose of the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)?
output: The purpose of the NDA is for exploratory discussions concerning a possible collaboration relating to the supply of goods/services for **ALH (ADVANCED LIGHT HELICOPTER)**. [22]

instruction: For how long must the Receiving Party protect and keep the Proprietary Information in strict confidence under the NDA?
output: The obligation lasts for a period of **ten (10) years** from the effective date of the Agreement. [23]

instruction: What degree of care must the Receiving Party use to protect Proprietary Information?
output: The Receiving Party must use the same degree of precaution and safeguards as it uses to protect its own Proprietary Information of like importance, but in no case any less than **reasonable care**. [24]

instruction: What is the governing law and the venue for arbitration under the NDA?
output: The Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the **laws of India**. The venue of arbitration will be **Bangalore**. [25, 26]

instruction: What documents must the Bidder submit for Commercial Compliance, according to the Checklist (Enclosure XIII)?
output: The bidder must submit the Commercial Compliance (Encl III), **Non-Disclosure Agreement, Integrity Pact**, and **Earnest Money Deposit (EMD)**. [27]

instruction: What critical action must the Receiving Party take before making a disclosure of Proprietary Information required by a court or government order?
output: The Receiving Party must promptly and to the extent possible before making such disclosure **notify the Disclosing Party** of such order/demand and provide reasonable assistance to prevent the disclosure. [28]

instruction: What is the organization, ministry, and specific category of the item being procured in this GeM bid?

output: The Reverse Charge Mechanism (**RCM**) is applicable, and ITC available to the buyer is **100%** on GST and 100% on GST Cess.

instruction: What specific action must sellers take regarding GST submission where RCM is applicable, and what rate is the buyer liable to pay?
output: Sellers will be forced to put **Zero GST** and GST cess in their bids. The Buyer will have the liability of paying the GST to the government on the specified rate of **18%**.

instruction: What are the minimum local content requirements for qualifying as Class 1 and Class 2 Local Suppliers for this service?
output: Minimum **50%** Local Content is required for qualifying as a Class 1 local supplier, and **20%** Local Content is required for qualifying as a Class 2 Local Supplier.

instruction: What entities are excluded from receiving MSE purchase preference benefits for services?
output: Traders are excluded from the purview of Public Procurement Policy for Micro and Small Enterprises and are **not eligible for any purchase preference**.

instruction: List two scenarios where the technically qualified Highest Quoting bidder (H-1) would still be allowed to participate in the Reverse Auction.
output: H-1 will be allowed to participate in RA if: i. If number of technically qualified bidders are only **2 or 3**. ii. If L-1 is non-MII and H-1 is eligible MII, and H-1 price is coming within price band of **20%** of Non-MII L-1. (An equivalent rule exists for MSE within 15%.)

instruction: List four documents the bidder must submit for Vendor Code Creation.
output: The bidder shall submit: a. Copy of **PAN Card**. b. Copy of **GSTIN**. c. Copy of **Cancelled Cheque**. d. Copy of **EFT Mandate** duly certified by Bank.

instruction: What is the mandatory compliance requirement for bidders from countries sharing a land border with India?
output: Any bidder from a country which shares a land border with India will be eligible to bid only if the bidder is **registered with the Competent Authority**. False declaration and non-compliance of this would be a ground for **immediate termination of the contract**.

instruction: What critical financial status must the bidder declare in their undertaking?
output: The bidder should not be under liquidation, court receivership or similar proceedings, and should **not be bankrupt**. The Bidder must upload an undertaking to this effect.

instruction: What is the policy regarding documents uploaded by bidders during the clarification stage?
output: Documents submitted as part of a clarification or representation during the tender/bid process will be **displayed to other participated bidders after log in**.

instruction: List five actions related to bidding that could render the bid and resultant contract null and void by GeM.
output: The bid may be cancelled if: 1. The definition of Class I and Class II suppliers is not in line with the extant Order [1]. 2. Seeking EMD submission in contravention to exemption provided to sellers under GeM GTC [1]. 3. Publishing Custom / BOQ bids for items where regular GeM categories are available (without necessary bunching) [1]. 4. Mentioning specific **Brand or Make or Model** or Manufacturer or Dealer name [1]. 5. **Seeking sample with bid** or approval of samples during bid evaluation process (unless trials are explicitly allowed) [2]. 6. Reference of conditions published on any external site or reference to external documents/clauses [3].

instruction: What is the organization, ministry, and specific category of the equipment being procured in this bid?
output: The organization is **Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)**, under the Ministry Of Defence, Department Of Defence Production. The item category is **Supply and commissioning hand held portable self-positioning non-contact 3D scanner system** [1, 2].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date/Time, the Bid Opening Date/Time, and the required Bid Offer Validity?
output: The Bid End Date/Time is **04-12-2025 13:00:00**, the Bid Opening Date/Time is **04-12-2025 13:30:00**, and the offer validity must be **180 Days** [1].

instruction: What is the total quantity being procured, and what is the required delivery time in days?
output: The total quantity is **1** set [1, 3]. The required delivery time is **56 days** [4].

instruction: What is the status of exemptions for Years of Experience and Turnover for MSMEs and Startups?
output: No exemption for Years of Experience and Turnover is granted for either **MSME** or **Startup** bidders [5].

instruction: What is the required ePBG Percentage and the required duration in months, and who is the beneficiary?
output: The ePBG Percentage is **5.00%**, and the required duration is **29 Months** [6]. The beneficiary is **AGM(Fin) Ardc, Bangalore**, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited [7].

instruction: What is the mandatory rule regarding price submission in the technical bid, and what happens if this rule is violated?
output: Bidders must ensure that **no pricing aspect is indicated in the technical bid** even in the form of PDF, else the offer will get **summarily rejected** [8].

instruction: What is the mandatory compliance requirement for bidders from countries sharing a land border with India?
output: Any bidder from a country which shares a land border with India will be eligible to bid only if the bidder is **registered with the Competent Authority** [9]. False declaration and non-compliance of this would be a ground for immediate termination of the contract [9].

instruction: What are the minimum local content requirements for qualifying as Class 1 and Class 2 Local Suppliers?
output: Minimum **50%** Local Content is required for qualifying as a Class 1 local supplier, and **20%** Local Content is required for qualifying as a Class 2 Local Supplier [3].

instruction: What is the maximum price band percentage for MII Purchase Preference and the maximum percentage of bid quantity for MII preference?
output: Purchase Preference to MII sellers is available up to a price within **L1 + 20%** [7]. The Maximum Percentage of Bid quantity for MII purchase preference is **100%** [10].

instruction: What is the maximum price band percentage for MSE Purchase Preference and the maximum percentage of bid quantity for MSE preference?
output: Purchase Preference to MSE OEMs is available up to a price within **L1 + 15%** [11]. The Maximum Percentage of Bid quantity for MSE purchase preference is **100%** [11].

instruction: What are the required Warranty period, the AMC duration post-warranty, and the frequency of AMC charges?
output: The Warranty of the required product is **2 Year** [12]. The Annual Maintenance Charges (AMC) Duration (Post Warranty) is **3 Year**, with a **Quarterly** frequency [12].

instruction: What is the mandated percentage range for quoting AMC charges relative to the cost of equipment?
output: The AMC charges shall be offered within a range of **3 to 25%** of the cost of equipment [13].

instruction: What is the policy regarding Performance Bank Guarantee (PBG) calculation and submission during the AMC period?
output: The initial PBG shall be based only on the cost of product/equipment [13]. A new PBG applicable for AMC (2.5% on the total contract value including AMC Charges) must be submitted **at the start of the AMC** and must remain valid till completion of AMC period plus one year [13, 14].

instruction: In the Reverse Auction, what is the qualification rule, and in which three cases will the Highest Quoting bidder (H-1) still be allowed to participate?
output: The RA Qualification Rule is **H1-Highest Priced Bid Elimination** [15, 16]. H-1 will be allowed to participate if: i. The number of technically qualified bidders are only **2 or 3** [16]. ii. If L-1 is non-MSE and H-1 is eligible MSE and H-1 price is coming within the price band of **15%** of Non-MSE L-1 [16]. iii. If L-1 is non-MII and H-1 is eligible MII and H-1 price is coming within the price band of **20%** of Non-MII L-1 [16].

instruction: What documents must the Seller submit for Vendor Code Creation?
output: The seller shall submit: a. Copy of **PAN Card**. b. Copy of **GSTIN**. c. Copy of **Cancelled Cheque**. d. Copy of **EFT Mandate** duly certified by Bank [17].

instruction: What are the restrictions on the return of faulty Hard Disks of Servers/Desktop Computers/Laptops against warranty replacement?
output: As per the Buyer organizations Security Policy, Faulty Hard Disk of Servers/Desktop Computers/Laptops etc. **will not be returned back** to the OEM/supplier against warranty replacement [18].

instruction: What is the minimum required original delivery period for the additional delivery time calculation under the Option Clause?
output: If the original delivery period is less than **30 days**, the additional time granted equals the original delivery period [18].

instruction: What must the bidder upload regarding malicious code?
output: The seller should upload a certificate certifying that the Hardware and Software being offered does not contain **Embedded Malicious code** that would inhibit the function, cause physical damage, or tap information [19].

instruction: What is the procedure if a seller has an objection or grievance against the additional clauses provided in the bid?
output: The seller can raise their representation against the same by using the **Representation window** provided in the bid details field in the Seller dashboard after logging in as a seller **within 4 days of bid publication** on GeM [20].

instruction: What is the organization issuing this Expression of Interest (EoI) and what is the reference number and date?
output: The EoI is issued by **U.R. Rao Satellite Centre [URSC]** of the Indian Space Research Organization [ISRO] under the Department of Space, Government of India. The Reference Number is URSC/PUR/H/EOI/ISCP 2024062422, dated 18.12.2024 [1, 2].

instruction: What is the main objective of the IMPP development, and what is the target output power for the high voltage power bus?
output: The main objective is the **Realisation of Integrated Modular Power Packages (IMPP) for 100V Bus** [1, 3]. This is necessary to meet the growing demand of high-power satellites, requiring a power bus capable of handling output power of **10-20 kW** [4, 5].

instruction: How many Engineering Model (EM) hardware sets are expected for delivery, and what is the minimum expectation for the vendor's background?
output: URSC is looking for the delivery of **3 sets of Engineering Model (EM) hardware** [3, 6]. Vendors must have a strong engineering, design, and analysis background [6, 7].

instruction: What are the dimensions and weight targets for the 10kW IMPP unit, and how must the design accommodate scalability?
output: The 10kW realization is planned with a weight of around **40kgs** and an approximate dimension of **570x380x320 mm** [8]. The design should be **scalable to meet output power of 20kW** with an approximate weight of around **60kg** and a dimension of **800x380x320mm** [8, 9].

instruction: What are the three main phases of work for the realization of the 100V IMPP?
output: The realization is divided into three phases: 1. **Configuration phase** (starts after PO and NDA signed); 2. **Design and Analysis phase**; 3. **Realization and testing phase** [10, 11].

instruction: What mandatory design review clearances must the vendor obtain from URSC before proceeding past the Configuration and Design phases?
output: The vendor must hold a joint **Baseline Design Review (BDR)** after initial design finalization to obtain clearance from URSC [10, 12]. Subsequently, a joint **Detailed Design Review (DDR)** must be held after analysis to obtain clearance to proceed further, as DDR clearance is a mandatory requirement [11, 13, 14].

instruction: List four mandatory analyses the vendor must perform during the Design and Analysis phase.
output: The vendor shall initiate analyses including: **Signal integrity (SI) analysis**, **Power integrity (PI) analysis**, **PCB and package level thermal analysis** (conduction and radiation modes), **Mechanical analysis** (structural/vibration/Modal analysis), **Reliability assessment** (FMECA, FTA, WCCA, De-rating), and **EMI/EMC analysis** [13-16].

instruction: What is the required experience for the vendor regarding mechanical housing design and analysis for power modules?
output: The vendor must have experience in the design and analysis of mechanical housing for high power (at least **1kW per module**) [17].

instruction: List two mandatory facility requirements related to manufacturing and two related to testing, for vendor selection.
output: Mandatory facilities include: **SMT (Surface Mount Technology) facility** [18] and **Environmental test Facility** (Hot and cold, Thermal vacuum) [18]. The organization must also have an **ESD safe laboratory** of minimum space **>100 square meter** [19] and experience in conducting **EMI-EMC tests** as per MIL-STD 461C/E/F/G [19].

instruction: What is the deadline for submitting clarification requests and participation details for the Pre-EoI Meeting, and when is the meeting scheduled?
output: The deadline for submission of clarification/queries & participation details is **31st December 2024; 16:00 Hrs. IST** [20]. The Pre-EOI meeting is scheduled for **2nd January 2025** (Thursday), from **10:00 to 17:00 Hrs. IST** [20, 21].

instruction: What is the total number of representatives allowed per bidder for the Pre-EoI meeting, and what document must they carry?
output: Member Representatives shall be limited to a maximum of **two (2)** per bidder/company/organisation [22]. Representatives shall carry an **Authorization Letter** for attending the meeting [22].

instruction: What is the mandatory condition regarding participation in the EoI for proceeding to the tendering phase?
output: Participation in EoI is **mandatory** to consider the vendor(s) further in the tendering phase [23, 24]. The indenting process will be initiated in a Limited tender mode only among the qualified vendors whose EoI is found satisfactory [25].

instruction: What action will URSC take if companies are found to have indulged in corrupt or fraudulent practices?
output: Companies/Firms found to have indulged in any corrupt or fraudulent practices will be **debarred from taking part in the Tendering process** and their EOI document will not be taken up for consideration [26, 27].

instruction: What are the two components of a Power Module (PM), and what power does it handle during eclipse and sunlight?
output: A Power Module (PM) consists of a **Battery Discharge Regulator (BDR) and Shuntswitch** [28, 29]. The PM handles **1.25kW** during eclipse and **2kW** (approx.) during sunlight [29, 30].

instruction: What is the function and power handling capacity of the Battery Charge Regulator (BCR)?
output: The Battery Charge Regulator (BCR) is a non-isolated buck (step-down) DC-DC converter designed to charge a lower voltage Li-Ion battery directly from the **100V BUS** [31]. It is capable of handling **1000W** of power with a maximum dissipation of **40W** [31].

instruction: What component is used for external communication for the Core Power Electronics (CPE) packages?
output: For external communication, **1553B protocol** shall be used [32]. The vendor must also have experience in **MIL-STD-1553 based designs** [33].

instruction: What is the primary function of the Domestic Regulator (DomReg), and what is its maximum output power capacity?
output: The Domestic Regulator Module consists of two DC-DC converters (main & redundant) that provide output voltages capable of supporting all power electronics circuits [34]. The Max. Output Power per Dom-regulator is **85W** [34].

instruction: What mandatory technical documentation standard must the PCB design and fabrication follow?
output: PCB design and fabrication must be carried out as per **ISRO-PAX-301** [35]. The design guidelines for generation of PCBs should follow **SAC/SRA/GEN/GDL/CKT-SCH/1.0** [36].

instruction: What are the primary responsibilities of the vendor regarding components, and whose role is it to clear procured components?
output: The vendor is responsible for **Components Procurement** and **EEE Components Storage and Handling** [37]. The **Electrical design clearance** during BDR, DDR, and **Clearance of Procured Components for use** is the responsibility of URSC [37].

instruction: What is the required certification for the ATE software engineer, and what must the overall system software be compatible with?
output: The vendor should have at least one software engineer with a **Lab-VIEW CLD or CLAD certificate** [38]. The overall system software must be compatible with the **existing software present with URSC, Bangalore** [39].

instruction: What are the six scheduled payment milestones for the Detail Design & DWG (D4) phase, expressed as a percentage of D4 cost?
output: I do not have access to the detailed payment schedule (Enclosure XII) in this new source to answer that query.

instruction: What is the organization, ministry, and total quantity being procured in this NAS Blind Rivets bid?
output: The organization is **Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)**, under the Ministry Of Defence, Department Of Defence Production [1]. The total quantity procured is **260000** [1].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date and Time, the Bid Opening Date and Time, and the required Bid Offer Validity?
output: The Bid End Date/Time is **03-12-2025 13:00:00** [1]. The Bid Opening Date/Time is **03-12-2025 13:30:00** [1]. The offer validity must be **120 Days** [1].

instruction: What is the primary product category being purchased, and what is the BOQ title?
output: The primary product category is **NAS 1919 C04-S02** [2, 3]. The BOQ title is **SUPPLY OF AIRCRAFT STANDARD NAS BLIND RIVETS** [4].

instruction: What is the policy regarding EMD and ePBG for this bid?
output: EMD Detail and ePBG Detail are **Not Required** [5].

instruction: What is the minimum local content required to qualify as a Class 1 and Class 2 Local Supplier?
output: Minimum **50%** Local Content is required for qualifying as a Class 1 local supplier, and **20%** Local Content is required for qualifying as a Class 2 Local Supplier [6-40].

instruction: What exemptions are provided for Years of Experience and Turnover for MSMEs and Startups?
output: No exemption for Years of Experience and Turnover is granted for either **MSME** or **Startup** bidders [4].

instruction: What is the evaluation method, and how will contract award determination (L1) be handled?
output: The Evaluation Method is **Item wise evaluation** [5]. The contract will be awarded **schedulewise** and the determination of L1 will be done separately for each schedule [41].

instruction: What is the maximum quantity of NAS 1921 C04-S03 and the required delivery period?
output: The quantity for NAS 1921 C04-S03 is **40000** [19, 42]. The delivery period required is **270 days** [7, 9-40, 43-45].

instruction: What is the price band and maximum percentage of bid quantity preference for MII sellers?
output: Purchase Preference to MII sellers is available up to a price within **L1 + 20%** [46]. The Maximum Percentage of Bid quantity for MII purchase preference is **50%** [46].

instruction: What is the price band and maximum percentage of bid quantity preference for MSE OEMs?
output: Purchase Preference to MSE OEMs is available up to a price within **L1 + 15%** [47]. The Maximum Percentage of Bid quantity for MSE purchase preference is **25%** [47].

instruction: What is the primary restriction on suppliers regarding MII compliance?
output: Only **Class-I and Class-II Local suppliers** as per MII order dated 4.6.2020 will be eligible to bid. Non - Local suppliers as per MII order dated 04.06.2020 are **not eligible to participate** [48].

instruction: What is the policy regarding traders and MSE purchase preference?
output: Traders are excluded from the purview of Public Procurement Policy for Micro and Small Enterprises and hence resellers offering products manufactured by some other OEM are **not eligible for any purchase preference** [49].

instruction: Is Reverse Auction enabled, what is the qualification rule, and what is the minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension?
output: Bid to RA is enabled [3]. The RA Qualification Rule is **H1-Highest Priced Bid Elimination** [3]. The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **1** [3].

instruction: What is the required action concerning the Integrity Pact?
output: Buyer Organization specific **Integrity Pact** shall have to be complied by all bidders [50]. Bidders shall have to upload scanned copy of signed integrity pact as per Buyer organizations policy along with bid, and send the original to the buyer address before the due date [50, 51].

instruction: What is the mandatory compliance requirement for bidders from countries sharing a land border with India?
output: Any bidder from a country which shares a land border with India will be eligible to bid only if the bidder is **registered with the Competent Authority** [52]. Non-compliance of this would be a ground for **immediate termination of the contract** [52].

instruction: What specific rule must bidders follow regarding pricing information in the technical bid?
output: Bidders must ensure that **no pricing aspect is indicated in the technical bid** even in the form of PDF, else the offer will get **summarily rejected** [51].

instruction: What is the duration allowed for technical clarification during evaluation?
output: The Time allowed for Technical Clarifications during technical evaluation is **7 Days** [5].

instruction: List four reasons why the Buyer (HAL) may terminate the Contract, as per Generic clause 8.
output: The Buyer may terminate the Contract if: i) The Seller fails to comply with any material term of the Contract [53]. ii) The Seller informs Buyer of its inability to deliver the Material(s) within the stipulated Delivery Period [53]. iii) The Seller fails to deliver the Material(s) or replace/rectify any rejected or defective Material(s) promptly [53]. iv) The Seller becomes **bankrupt or goes into liquidation** [53].

instruction: List the four documents required from the seller for Vendor Code Creation.

instruction: What is the total maximum percentage the Purchaser can increase or decrease the ordered quantity under the OPTION CLAUSE?
output: The Purchaser reserves the right to increase or decrease the quantity to be ordered up to **50 percent** of bid quantity at the time of placement of contract [54].

instruction: How is additional delivery time calculated if the Option Clause is exercised?
output: The additional delivery time shall be (Increased quantity  Original quantity)  Original delivery period (in days), subject to a minimum of **30 days** [54]. If the original delivery period is less than 30 days, the additional time equals the original delivery period [54].

instruction: What critical information must the seller ensure is correct on the Invoice?
output: Supplier shall ensure that the Invoice is raised in the name of **Consignee with GSTIN of Consignee only** [55].

instruction: What is the mandatory certification standard the vendor must ensure for equipment and installation guidelines?
output: The vendor / supplier/contractor shall ensure requirements with respect to **ISO 45001:2018 standard g uidelines clause A 8.1.4** [56].

output: The bid and resultant contracts shall be treated as null and void and may be cancelled by GeM if the Buyer is **Seeking sample with bid or approval of samples during bid evaluation process** (unless trials are explicitly allowed in attached categories) [57, 58].
