instruction: What is the maximum quantity of NAS 1921 C04-S03 and the required delivery period?
output: The quantity for NAS 1921 C04-S03 is **40000** [19, 42]. The delivery period required is **270 days** [7, 9-40, 43-45].

instruction: What is the price band and maximum percentage of bid quantity preference for MII sellers?
output: Purchase Preference to MII sellers is available up to a price within **L1 + 20%** [46]. The Maximum Percentage of Bid quantity for MII purchase preference is **50%** [46].

instruction: What is the price band and maximum percentage of bid quantity preference for MSE OEMs?
output: Purchase Preference to MSE OEMs is available up to a price within **L1 + 15%** [47]. The Maximum Percentage of Bid quantity for MSE purchase preference is **25%** [47].

instruction: What is the primary restriction on suppliers regarding MII compliance?
output: Only **Class-I and Class-II Local suppliers** as per MII order dated 4.6.2020 will be eligible to bid. Non - Local suppliers as per MII order dated 04.06.2020 are **not eligible to participate** [48].

instruction: What is the policy regarding traders and MSE purchase preference?
output: Traders are excluded from the purview of Public Procurement Policy for Micro and Small Enterprises and hence resellers offering products manufactured by some other OEM are **not eligible for any purchase preference** [49].

instruction: Is Reverse Auction enabled, what is the qualification rule, and what is the minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension?
output: Bid to RA is enabled [3]. The RA Qualification Rule is **H1-Highest Priced Bid Elimination** [3]. The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **1** [3].

instruction: What is the required action concerning the Integrity Pact?
output: Buyer Organization specific **Integrity Pact** shall have to be complied by all bidders [50]. Bidders shall have to upload scanned copy of signed integrity pact as per Buyer organizations policy along with bid, and send the original to the buyer address before the due date [50, 51].

instruction: What is the mandatory compliance requirement for bidders from countries sharing a land border with India?
output: Any bidder from a country which shares a land border with India will be eligible to bid only if the bidder is **registered with the Competent Authority** [52]. Non-compliance of this would be a ground for **immediate termination of the contract** [52].

instruction: What specific rule must bidders follow regarding pricing information in the technical bid?
output: Bidders must ensure that **no pricing aspect is indicated in the technical bid** even in the form of PDF, else the offer will get **summarily rejected** [51].

instruction: What is the duration allowed for technical clarification during evaluation?
output: The Time allowed for Technical Clarifications during technical evaluation is **7 Days** [5].

instruction: List four reasons why the Buyer (HAL) may terminate the Contract, as per Generic clause 8.
output: The Buyer may terminate the Contract if: i) The Seller fails to comply with any material term of the Contract [53]. ii) The Seller informs Buyer of its inability to deliver the Material(s) within the stipulated Delivery Period [53]. iii) The Seller fails to deliver the Material(s) or replace/rectify any rejected or defective Material(s) promptly [53]. iv) The Seller becomes **bankrupt or goes into liquidation** [53].

instruction: List the four documents required from the seller for Vendor Code Creation.
output: The seller must submit: a. Copy of **PAN Card** [54]. b. Copy of **GSTIN** [54]. c. Copy of **Cancelled Cheque** [54]. d. Copy of **EFT Mandate** duly certified by Bank [54].

instruction: What is the total maximum percentage the Purchaser can increase or decrease the ordered quantity under the OPTION CLAUSE?
output: The Purchaser reserves the right to increase or decrease the quantity to be ordered up to **50 percent** of bid quantity at the time of placement of contract [54].

instruction: How is additional delivery time calculated if the Option Clause is exercised?
output: The additional delivery time shall be (Increased quantity  Original quantity)  Original delivery period (in days), subject to a minimum of **30 days** [54]. If the original delivery period is less than 30 days, the additional time equals the original delivery period [54].

instruction: What critical information must the seller ensure is correct on the Invoice?
output: Supplier shall ensure that the Invoice is raised in the name of **Consignee with GSTIN of Consignee only** [55].

instruction: What is the mandatory certification standard the vendor must ensure for equipment and installation guidelines?
output: The vendor / supplier/contractor shall ensure requirements with respect to **ISO 45001:2018 standard g uidelines clause A 8.1.4** [56].

instruction: Under what condition regarding samples may a bid be cancelled by GeM?
output: The bid and resultant contracts shall be treated as null and void and may be cancelled by GeM if the Buyer is **Seeking sample with bid or approval of samples during bid evaluation process** (unless trials are explicitly allowed in attached categories) [57, 58].

instruction: What is the policy regarding documents uploaded by bidders during the clarification stage?
output: Documents submitted as part of a clarification or representation during the tender/bid process will be **displayed to other participated bidders after log in** [59].

instruction: What is the Tender Notice number, the issuing organization, and the date of the tender notice?
output: The Tender Notice number is **NCP/44/25-26**. It is issued by **Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), Facilities Management Division, Bangalore**, dated **09.10.2025** [1-4].

instruction: What is the subject of the tender and the Estimated Value and Completion Period for the work?
output: The tender is for 'Carrying out Civil, Electrical and IT related Works pertaining to Up-gradation of Fire Station Building at ARDC Division, HAL [DC]  [Including Electrical Works]' [1, 2]. The Estimated Value is **Rs. 47.20 Lakhs** [3, 4], and the Completion Period is **05 Months** [3, 4].

instruction: What is the Last Date of Online Submission of Tender and the Date of Opening of Tender?
output: The Last Date of Online Submission of Tender is **30.10.2025 Up to 12.30 Hrs** [3, 4]. The Date of Opening of Tender is **30.10.2025 at 12.31 Hrs** [3, 4].

instruction: What are the two components of the Essential / Prequalification Criteria regarding financial standing?
output: The criteria are: 1) **Annual Turnover**: Average annual turnover during the last 3 years, ending March 31.03.2024, should be at least **30%** of the estimated amount put to tender [1, 2]. 2) **EMD**: Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) must be deposited as specified against each work [1, 2]. The amount of EMD is **Rs. 94,400/-** [3, 4].

instruction: What documents must be uploaded to support the Annual Turnover criterion?
output: The profit & loss statement duly certified by Chartered Accountant with UDIN shall be considered for evaluation of turnover for the respective financial year [1, 2].

instruction: How must the EMD be submitted, and what must be sent to HAL before the due date?
output: EMD can be submitted as Demand Draft / Bankers cheque / Pay Order drawn in favour of 'Hindustan Aeronautics Limited [Bangalore]' [1, 2]. The **scanned image** of the EMD must be uploaded online along with the tenders, and the **original** EMD must be submitted to the address mentioned before so as to reach latest by 12.30 Hrs on the last date of submission [1, 2].

instruction: What is the required value and validity period for the Latest Solvency Certificate?
output: The Latest Solvency Certificate must be issued within **12 Months from the Final Date of Tender Submission** [3, 4]. The required Solvency amount is **Rs. 18.88 Lakhs** [3, 4].

instruction: What is the tentative date for the tender documents to be available on the e-Procurement Portal?
output: The tentative date for the tender documents to be available on the e-Procurement Portal is **09.10.2025** [3, 4].

instruction: What is the risk if a bidder/tenderer does not meet the Prequalification Criteria (PQ criteria)?
output: Offers of bidders who do not meet the following PQ criteria will be **rejected** [1, 2].

instruction: What is the process for technical scrutiny and price bid opening regarding PQ criteria?
output: The offers of bidders/tenderers will be considered as technically qualified only if they meet the following Prequalification Criteria. After price bid evaluation, the successful bidder (Lowest offer i.e. L-1) has to submit the **original documents for verification** [1, 2].

instruction: List four mandatory documents concerning the legal structure of the firm that must be uploaded with the tender.
output: Required documents include: (i) Constitution and legal status along with attested copies of Deeds / Articles and Memorandum of Association, etc. (ii) Power of Attorney in case of Pvt. Limited / Limited companies. (iii) Registration with HAL / Other organization if any. (iv) Copy of PAN card issued by Income tax authority [5, 6].

instruction: List two mandatory financial documents that must be uploaded with the tender.
output: Required financial documents include: (v) Income Tax Returns for last Three years. (vi) Balance sheet for the last Three years [5, 6].

instruction: What is HAL's policy regarding errors or omissions committed before the tender opening?
output: Manual or mechanical errors committed before uploading or during the process of uploading the Document shall belong to be duly accepted by the Tenderer. The Tenderer shall not have claim whatsoever in this regard [1, 2].

instruction: What is the consequence if the contract is awarded and the contractor later defaults or provides false representations in the requisite documents?
output: Contractors/agencies are subject to be **disqualified**, even though they meet the Pre-qualifying criteria, if they make misleading or false representations in the required documents, statements and attachments, or have a record of poor performance, abandonment, or financial failures [5, 6].

instruction: What specific action must tenderers/bidders take regarding ESI and PF payments?
output: The Tenderers / Bidders have to comply with the provisions of ESI & PF act. They are required to Indemnify HAL for any liabilities arising on account of ESI & PF act as per the proforma at Tender Document before starting the work [5, 6].

instruction: What documents can be called upon only on the basis of the recommendations of the HAL committee / TEC after submission of the tender?
output: Documents that were to be submitted at the time of tender opening can only be called upon if they were missed. Examples include: Solvency certificate in the PQ form / Checklist, and supporting documents in proof of qualification. New documents will not be asked for to qualify the bidder [7, 8].

instruction: What is the procedure if HAL wants to seek confirmation/clarification from the issuer agency of the supporting documents?
output: HAL reserves the right to seek confirmation/clarification from the issuer agency, on the supporting documents submitted by the bidder [7, 8].

instruction: What is the policy regarding corrigendum/amendment hosting and separate advertisements?
output: Corrigendum / addendum / amendments / clarification, etc., with respect to works, if any, shall be hosted in **HAL e-portal**. Interested bidders / agencies are advised to visit HAL e-portal regularly as **no separate information / advertisement shall be published in the newspaper** in this regard, including any postponement of tender opening date [7, 8].

instruction: What is the process for technical clarification requested by HAL during evaluation?
output: HAL may, at their discretion, ask the bidder for clarifications on the bid. The request for clarification shall be given in writing by registered / speed post / email, asking the tenderer to respond by a specified date [5, 6].

instruction: What is HALs policy regarding late receipt of the tender after the last date for receipt of submission?
output: The tender/documents duly filled & uploaded within the last date of submission as mentioned in the tender notice will be considered. The last date for receipt will not be extended under any circumstances, unless otherwise declared a holiday for HAL [5, 6].

Who is the company identified as the potential supplier, and what are the two items being enquired for in BEL RFx 7000569182?

instruction: How is the Least bidder (L1) determined for BEL RFx 7000569182, and what happens if prices are tied?
output: L1 shall be arrived at by considering the **least Consolidated cost of all the items enquired**. Only bidders submitting responses for **all the items** will be considered during price comparison [5]. If more than one bid is found with the same price, **least lead-time** shall be taken as the criteria [9].

instruction: When is the Integrity Pact mandatory for HAL indigenous tenders?
output: The Integrity Pact is mandatory if the estimated order value **exceeding Rs 5 Crores** [10]. Bidders for BEL RFx 7000569182 must sign the Integrity Pact if the bid value is **Rs. Three Crores (INR Thirty Million) or above** [5].

instruction: What delivery basis is preferred for pricing in HAL indigenous tenders, and what is assumed if the bidder does not specify quantity limitations?
output: Price quoted should be on a **F.O.R. Destination basis**, for delivery at HAL Stores inclusive of all charges including transit insurance [11]. Unless otherwise mentioned, it is assumed that the rates hold good even when **lesser quantities** than those enquired of are ordered [12].

instruction: What are the two mandatory submissions that must be included in the original form within the technical bid in a two-bid system?
output: The technical bid should include **EMD in original form** and the **Integrity Pact (if applicable)** [13]. Technical bid without EMD in original form will be rejected [13, 14].

instruction: What is the consequence if a bidder submits only one bid with both rates and technical details combined?
output: Submitting only one bid with rates and technical details as a single bid will be **rejected** [15]. Bid received with technical bid and commercial bid in open condition inside one envelope will also be **rejected** [13].

instruction: What is the minimum required shelf life confirmation for general stores and rubber items?
output: In the event of an order, only **newly manufactured stores with the maximum possible shelf-life** at the time of dispatch must be offered [16]. In respect of rubber items such as seals, the item should **not have been manufactured earlier than 6 months of dispatch** [16].

instruction: How is commercial evaluation handled if the lowest bidder (L-1) cannot supply the full quantity required?
output: If the lowest bidder has not offered the full quantity, HAL reserves the right to source the balance quantity from **other bidders on L1 price** [17]. To have parallel source of supply, the order may be split to 2 or 3 sources subject to other bidders agreeing for L-1 price [17].

instruction: For development orders where HAL provides technical assistance, where do the Intellectual Proprietary Rights (IPR) rest?
output: In the development orders, where technical inputs/assistance is provided to the vendors, the **Intellectual Proprietary Rights (IPR) will rest with HAL** [18].

instruction: What DRDO laboratory is inviting the EOI for the Low Frequency Bow Mounted Sonar (LFBMS)?
output: The EOI is invited by **Naval Physical and Oceanographic Laboratory (NPOL), Kochi**, a Research and Development Laboratory under DRDO, MoD [19, 20].

instruction: What is the required minimum experience (in years) and minimum value (in Rupees) for a successful supply order involving installation on a Naval platform, as per NPOL qualification criteria?
output: The industry partner must have a minimum **10 years of experience** in manufacturing, integration and testing of Defence systems onboard ship/submarine platforms [21]. The partner must have successfully completed at least one supply order valued at **over Rs. 50 Crores** within the last 7 years, involving the installation of weapons or sensors onto a naval platform [22, 23].

instruction: What is the total contract period for the Lead System Integrator of LFBMS, and where do the Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) rest?
output: The contract period is **36 Months** [24]. All **Intellectual Property Rights shall be with NPOL, DRDO** [25].

instruction: What mandatory software certifications are required for the Industry Partner responding to the NPOL LFBMS EOI?
output: The Industry partner shall possess valid **ISO 9001:2015/AS9100D/ equivalent or better** and valid **CMMI Level 3+ certification** for software engineering practices at the time of bidding [26].

instruction: What DRDO laboratory is inviting the EOI for the Infrared Signature Prediction Software for Warships, and what is the EOI Submission End Date?
output: The EOI is invited by **Naval Science & Technological Laboratory (NSTL), DRDO** [27, 28]. The EOI Submission End Date is **13.10.2025 (14:00 Hrs.)** [29].

instruction: What are the IPR arrangements for the Infrared Signature Prediction Software?
output: The **Intellectual Property Rights (IP) Rights** of the software will be **jointly with Industry partner and NSTL, DRDO** [29]. DRDO shall have the march-in rights to use the IP for its own use in the interest of the Govt. of India without any restrictions [29].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum average annual turnover required for the NSTL EOI?
output: The average annual turnover during the last 3 years, ending 31st March of the previous financial year, should be at least **Rs 15 Crores** [30].

instruction: What are the target weight class helicopters for the Oil Cooling System RFI issued by HAL RWRDC, and what is the RFI Due Date?
output: The target helicopters are the **14 ton AUW class Indian Multi Role Helicopter (IMRH)** and the **12.5 ton AUW class Deck Based Multi Role Helicopter (DBMRH)** [31]. The RFI Due Date is **20th August 2025, 1400 Hrs IST** [31].

instruction: What restrictions apply to agents/middlemen in the HAL RWRDC RFI process, and whose responsibility is subcontracting?
output: **No involvement of Agents or Middlemen** in India or abroad in any capacity what-so-ever is permitted at any stage [32]. If the vendor uses experienced partners, the **responsibility will be with the first / principle vendor** [33].

instruction: What is the maximum engine power range specified as a technical parameter for the HLS-GSR-16 Radar?
output: The maximum engine power (per antenna) specified is **16 W** [34]. The maximum power consumption is **< 300 W** [35].

instruction: What are the detection ranges for a moving vehicle and a standard UAV (0.02 m RCS) for the HLS-GSR-16 Radar?
output: Vehicle detection (2.0-5.0 m) is **20-25 Km**. Standard UAV detection (0.02 m RCS) is **5.0 Km** [34].

instruction: What is the required MTBF and waterproof rating for the HLS-GSR-16 Radar system?
output: The Radar system MTBF is at least **20,000 hours** [36, 37]. The system is waterproof according to **IP67** [35, 38].

instruction: What are the critical dates for the HAL Helicopter Division RFQ for Electrical Connectors (H/IMM/HELI/ALH-BPC-211/2025)?
output: The Due Date is **13th Nov 2025 closing time is 2300 hrs** of Indian Standard Time [39]. Tenders shall be opened on **14th Nov 2025 after 7.00 hrs** of Indian Standard Time [40].

instruction: What is the penalty for non-acceptance of HAL's 10% Liquidated Damages (LD) clause during the commercial evaluation of the Electrical Connectors RFQ?
output: In case a bidder opts not to accept this clause, the commercial evaluation will attract a **loading factor (max. 10%) on the quoted unit price** [41, 42]. This loading factor corresponds to the extent of LD cost not agreed to [42].

instruction: What specific certification is mandatory for indigenous manufacturers supplying airborne cables and connectors to HAL?
output: RCMAs Airworthiness Certification in the form of **Provisional Clearance (PC) or Letter of Type Approval (LoTA)** is mandatory for use of airborne cables and connectors produced by indigenous manufacturers and must be uploaded with the bid [43].

instruction: What percentage of the required quantity can HAL reject an offer for, and what percentage of quantity increase/decrease is covered by the Option Clause (LPSC Tenders)?
output: Offers quoting a quantity less than **70%** of the required quantity are liable for rejection by HAL [42]. LPSC reserves the right to increase/decrease the Ordered Quantity by up to **25%** at any time (though this is not applicable for Development Orders) [44, 45].

instruction: What are the two components of the Purchase Preference Policy (PPP) implemented by HAL?
output: The Purchase Preference is applicable for **Class-I Local Manufacturers** (PPP - Make In India) as well as for **Micro and Small Enterprises (MSE)** [46].

instruction: What is the maximum quantity preference offered to MSEs, and within what price band must they fall to be eligible?
output: MSEs will be considered for ordering **25%** of tendered quantity subject to matching the L-1 price [47]. Their quoted price must fall within the purchase preference margin, which is **L-1 plus 15%** [47].

instruction: What specific action can HAL take against a bidder who makes a false declaration regarding local content?
output: Any false declarations made will be in breach of the code of integrity, for which a bidder or its successor will become ineligible / be debarred from purchase preference for further tenders / pending tenders for the next two years [48]. Additionally, a penalty of up to **2% value of each order** will be deducted on such defaulted bidders after order placement [48].

instruction: What is the maximum duration and percentage of value for HAL's Repeat Order Clause?
output: HAL reserves the right to place repeat orders within **12 months** from the date of last supply [49]. The quantity and total value of such repeat order shall **not exceed the value of the original Purchase Order** [49].

instruction: What is the subject of the EOI issued by HAL LCA Tejas Division, and what is the delivery timeline expected per aircraft?
output: The subject is the Embodiment of **Software Defined Radio (SDR) Modification on LCA Aircraft** [50]. The delivery plan for compliance of MOD by the vendor is **15 days per aircraft** from allotment of aircraft by IAF [51].

instruction: What is the material and kit policy for the LCA SDR modification work?
output: **All the material and Modification kits required would be provided by HAL/IAF** [52]. Execution of work as per technology is to be carried out by the vendor on the allotted aircraft [52].

instruction: What two key security protocols must vendor personnel comply with at IAF bases/HAL premises?
output: Prior to the start of work, a **police verification certificate is to be submitted** by the supplier for all personnel [53]. **Mobile phones are not allowed** within the factory premises/IAF bases [54].

instruction: What DRDO laboratory is conducting the software development contract for IEWS and MIMAS, and what mandatory certification standard must the software follow?
output: The contract is for the Centre for Air Borne Systems (**CABS**), one of the major DRDO Labs [55, 56]. The standard for software certification should be followed as per **DO-178C Level C** as specified by CEMILAC [57].

instruction: What are the two major milestones (M1 and M2) and their corresponding payment percentages for the CABS software development contract?
output: Milestone 1 is due at **T0 + 4 Months** and accounts for **50% of the Total Cost**. Milestone 2 is due at **T0 + up to 06 Apr 2026** and accounts for the remaining **50% of the Total Cost** [58, 59].

instruction: What are the software development environment requirements for the IEWS software?
output: The environment includes: Operating system **Windows / Ubuntu** (latest version); Programming languages **C/C++, Python**; Framework **Qt**; GIS **QGIS**; and Database **PostgreSQL** [60, 61].

instruction: What is the purpose of the MIMAS subsystem?
output: The MIMAS subsystem manages communication between the subsystems and IEWS, and is responsible for time synchronization, health management, mission monitoring, sensor deployment and **air to ground data transfer via datalink subsystem** [62, 63].

instruction: What is the Prequalification Criteria (PQC) for the BHEL Accumulator tender regarding experience and quality certification?
output: Any bidder who has earlier supplied **Aerospace grade material (Accumulators) to any of the units of BHEL or Defence PSUs or Defence Govt. Organizations in India in last 5 years** are eligible [64]. The bidder should be **AS9100 compliant** at the time of the tender enquiry [64].

instruction: What are the required burst pressure and minimum MTBF for the Accumulator (BHEL)?
output: The Burst pressure for the accumulator shell must be **19 bar** [65]. The MTBF is required to be **3000 hours** [66].

instruction: What three tests must be conducted as part of the COTS screening for the Accumulator PCB components?
output: The tests are: **High Temperature Storage Test** (+85C for 24 hours) [67], **Thermal Shock Test** (-40C to +85C for 10 cycles) [68], and **Burn-in Test** (48 hours in power ON condition at maximum rated operating temperature) [69, 70].

instruction: What are the EMD, Bid Submission Due Date, and Bid Opening Date for the LPSC VD-05 Radiators tender (LPSC/LVF/LP202500088101)?
output: EMD details are **NA** [71]. Bid Submission Due Date is **01-08-2025 12:00**. Bid Opening Date is **01-08-2025 12:05** [72].

instruction: What is the maximum Liquidated Damages (LD) percentage applicable for delays in LPSC tenders?
output: LD is 0.5% per week, subject to a maximum of **5%** of the order value for the delayed period [73]. However, in case of inordinate delays (more than 25% of the total completion period), LD shall be applicable subject to a maximum of **10%** [73, 74].

instruction: What percentage of the contract value is required for the Performance Bank Guarantee (PBG) in LPSC tenders, and when must it be submitted?
output: The Contractor shall furnish a Bank Guarantee for an amount equivalent to **3% of the value of the Contract** [75, 76]. It must be submitted along with **first shipment documents** [75, 76] and must be valid till the end of the warranty period plus 60 days [75, 76].

instruction: What is the warranty period required for stores supplied to LPSC?
output: The warranty period is **twelve months** after acceptance of the stores [77-79], or for a minimum period of **TWO YEARS** for THCS components [80].

instruction: What must vendors from a country sharing a land border with India submit for LPSC tenders?
output: Vendors or Agents of a Vendor from a country sharing a border with India shall submit a **copy of valid registration made with the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Government of India** along with the tender mandatorily [81-83].

instruction: What are the Delivery Place and Payment Term for indigenous supplies in LPSC tenders?
output: The Delivery Term preferred for indigenous supplies is **Ex-Works / FOR LPSC, VALIAMALA** [84, 85]. Payment term is **100% payment through RTGS within 30 days of receipt and acceptance** of the item at LPSC site against submission of PBG [86, 87].

instruction: What are the Bid Submission and Opening Dates for the LPSC Gaganyaan mission tender (LP202500102201)?
output: Bid Submission Due Date is **29-10-2025 12:00**. Bid Opening Date is **29-10-2025 12:05** [88].

instruction: What happens if a bidder makes a false declaration regarding local content in LPSC tenders?
output: A false declaration will be in breach of the Code of Integrity, for which a bidder or its successors can be **debarred for up to two years** as per Rule 151 (iii) of the General Financial Rules [89, 90].

instruction: What is the policy regarding agency commission payments to Indian Agents for foreign suppliers in LPSC tenders?
output: Agency Commission included in the price and payable to the Indian Agent shall be paid directly to the Indian Agents by the Purchaser in equivalent Indian Rupees after the Customs Clearance, receipt, installation & commissioning, and acceptance of the goods/equipment [91, 92].

instruction: Who issued the Tender Notice NK/FW/CAP-1631/2025-26, and what were the amended submission and opening dates for it?
output: The amendment was issued by the **Senior Manager (Civil) / ATA, Aircraft Overhaul Division, Nasik** [93]. The new Last date of online submission of Tender is **07.11.2025 up to 13.00 Hrs**, and the Date of opening of tender is **07.11.2025 At 13.30 Hrs** [94].

instruction: What organization is procuring the Lead System Integrator (LSI) role for the Low Frequency Bow Mounted Sonar (LFBMS) and under which Ministry?
output: The procurement is by **Naval Physical and Oceanographic Laboratory (NPOL), Kochi**, a Research and Development Laboratory under **DRDO, MoD** [19].

instruction: What are the required certifications regarding Quality Management Systems for the NPOL LFBMS LSI partner?
output: The Industry Partner shall possess valid **ISO 9001:2015/AS9100D/ equivalent or better** and valid **CMMI Level 3+ certification** for software engineering practices [26].

instruction: What specific components must the NPOL LSI firm develop for the prototype system under the current LFBMS project activity?
output: The firm must develop: 1) Underwater Junction Box and Cables [95], 2) Array Structure [95], 3) Display Console & Processing System [95], 4) Workstation Console & Processing System [95], and 5) Portable Control Console & Processing System [95].

instruction: What documents must the tenderer upload to support the Annual Turnover criterion for the HAL Fire Station Civil Works (NCP/44/25-26)?
output: The tenderer must upload the **Profit & loss statement duly certified by chartered accountant with UDIN** [96].

instruction: What mandatory legal and financial documents must be uploaded by bidders for the HAL Civil Works tenders (NCP/44/25-26)?
output: Required documents include: Constitution and legal status; Power of Attorney (if applicable); Copy of **PAN card**; **Income Tax Returns** for last Three years; and **Balance sheet** for the last Three years [97, 98].

instruction: What percentage of the estimated value must the Latest Solvency Certificate cover for the HAL Civil Works NCP/74/25-26 (Lift Elevator)?

instruction: What are the requirements for the bid document when dealing with alternative item supply in HAL tenders?
output: In case a bidder is quoting for an alternative part number, it should be confirmed that the offered part is **fully interchangeable** with the required part. Applicable descriptive literature/catalogue may be enclosed by the bidder with the offer (at least two copies) [16].

instruction: Who is the Tender Inviting Authority for the Tamdoli Fee Plaza bid (NHAI), and what is the Annual Potential Collection (APC) in Rupees?
output: The Tender Inviting Authority is **Sh. Mudit Garg, GM(CO)** [101]. The APC per annum is **Rs. 2.86 Crore** [101-103].

instruction: What is the policy regarding additional performance security for low rated cases in MCD tenders?
output: In all low rated cases (below 25% of justification), **performance security @10% of the amount put to tender** shall be deducted/withheld from the first running bill of the agency [104]. This is **in addition** to the irrevocable Performance Guarantee of 5% of the tendered amount [104, 105].

instruction: What is the subject and contract number of the amendment dated 06.11.2025 issued by HAL?
output: The subject is 'Carrying out Civil Electrical and IT related Works pertaining to Up-Gradation of Fire Station Building at ARDC Division HAL DC Including Electrical Works' [1-4]. The Contract No. is **HAL/FMD/C-62/25-26** [1-4].

instruction: What were the original and final opening dates for Contract HAL/FMD/C-62/25-26 as per the amendments of 30.10.2025 and 06.11.2025?

instruction: Who is the identified company and what two items are being procured under BEL RFx 7000569182?

instruction: What are the start and end dates for the submission period for BEL RFx 7000569182?
What rule determines the L1 bidder for the BEL RFx, and what is the tie-breaker criteria?
output: L1 shall be arrived at by considering the **least Consolidated cost of all the items enquired** [8]. If more than one bid is found with the same price, the **least lead-time** shall be taken as the criteria [9].

instruction: When is the Integrity Pact mandatory for the BEL RFx, and what is the requirement for bidders responding to the EOI?

instruction: What is HAL's preferred delivery basis for indigenous tenders, and what is the minimum required quotation validity period?

instruction: What is the policy regarding quoting prices for partial quantities?

instruction: What are the specific shelf-life requirements for newly manufactured stores and rubber items?

instruction: Under the two-bid system, what mandatory original documents must the technical bid include to avoid rejection?

instruction: What is the consequence if the bidder submits only one bid combining rates and technical details?
output: Submitting only one bid with rates and technical details as a single bid will be **rejected** [16]. Bid received with technical bid and commercial bid in open condition inside one envelope will also be rejected [14].

instruction: What is the maximum percentage of Liquidated Damages (LD) HAL reserves the right to collect for delivery delays?
output: HAL reserves the right to collect a sum of 0.5% per week of delay or part thereof, subject to a maximum ceiling of **10%** as claim towards liquidated damages on the undelivered part of the order [17].

instruction: What are the two primary penalties HAL can impose if the contractor violates the Bribes and Gifts clause?
output: In addition to any criminal liability, HAL can subject the contractor to the **cancellation of this and all other contracts with HAL** [18], and to the **payment of any loss or damage resulting from any such cancellation** [18].

instruction: Where do the Intellectual Proprietary Rights (IPR) rest for development orders where HAL provides technical assistance?
output: In the development orders, where technical inputs/assistance is provided to the vendors, the **Intellectual Proprietary Rights (IPR) will rest with HAL** [19].

instruction: What are the new submission and opening dates for the HAL Nasik Tender NK/FW/CAP-1631/2025-26, as per the amendment?

The partner must also have successfully completed at least one supply order valued at **over Rs. 50 Crores** within the last 7 years, involving the installation of weapons or sensors onto a naval platform [23].

output: The Industry Partner shall possess valid **ISO 9001:2015/AS9100D/ equivalent or better** [24] and valid **CMMI Level 3+ certification** for software engineering practices [24].

instruction: What must an Industry Partner do if they propose to outsource required facilities or functions for the LFBMS project?

instruction: What is the required confidentiality period for the NDA relating to the NSTL software development?

instruction: What exceptions allow the Receiving Party to disclose confidential information under the NSTL NDA?
output: No obligation is imposed if the information is or becomes **available to the public through no breach of this Agreement** [30], or if it is disclosed pursuant to **governmental or judicial order requirement** [30].

instruction: What is the frequency band and type of the HLS-GSR-16 Radar, and what is its maximum transmit power per antenna?

instruction: What are the physical safety rules regarding the HLS-GSR-16 Radar antenna?
output: The human body safety distance is **50 meter** from the Radar antenna [36]. Also, the Radar unit and modules are light-weight, designed so each module can be lifted and handled by a single person (per regulations) [37].

instruction: What specific components and their corresponding makes are requested in the LPSC THCS tender?
output: The tender requires: Coolant pump (Make: **Cascon, 100-B1O-R1E**) [83], Electro Mechanical condensate pump with connectors (Make: **Parker, v016-51**) [83], and Axial fan (Make: **LMB, 00-85001770-001**) [84].

instruction: What is the Annual Potential Collection (APC) and Bid Due Date for the NHAI Tamdoli Fee Plaza?
output: The APC per annum is **Rs. 2.86 Crore** [85-87]. The Bid Due Date is **13.11.2025 (11:00 Hrs.)** [85, 87].

instruction: What mandatory additional security applies to low rated cases (below 25% of justification) in MCD tenders?
output: An **additional performance security @10% of the amount put to tender** shall be deducted/withheld from the first running bill [88], in addition to the irrevocable Performance Guarantee of 5% [88, 89].

instruction: What is the crucial first step a vendor must perform on the HAL e-procurement portal to upload documents and avoid disqualification?
output: The vendor must click **'Click here to Attach the General Documents'** to upload all documents. This is the **important and first step to be performed to avoid disqualification** [90, 91].

instruction: What happens after the bidder enters EMD details and uploads the scanned EMD regarding the systems status signal?
output: When the user finishes the filling and uploading of scanned BG/DD, the 'Red Color' will automatically turn to a **'Black Color'**, which reflects that the user is two steps ahead for the submission [90, 91].

instruction: What is HAL's policy on intellectual property rights for imported items quoted by foreign bidders?
output: In case an imported item is quoted by a bidder, HAL reserves the right to avail **Custom duty exemption** [10]. To avail the exemption, HAL will provide a Custom duty exemption certificate (if applicable) [10].

instruction: What is the minimum experience required for the Engineering Service Provider in Airframe Design and Analysis?
output: The Engineering Service Provider should have minimum **Seven years of experience** in Airframe Design and Analysis of Fixed wing or Rotary wing Aircraft with proven examples of capability and projects in Aero-structure  Design, Drafting, MBD, Analysis and Simulations (Stress, Dynamics, F&DT, Thermal, CFD, Loads, and Dynamics etc.) [1].

instruction: What calculation methodology is used to arrive at the total price quoted for comparison purposes in commercial evaluation?
output: The summation of the Present Values of prices, calculated using the standard **DCF (Discounted Cash Flow) technique**, will be taken as the total price quoted for comparison of quotes (Not for placement of Order) [2-4]. Such prices after levelling will be compared to determine L-1, L-2, etc. [3, 4].

instruction: How is the discounting rate derived for determining comparative prices during commercial evaluation?
output: The discounting rate (%) will be derived from **State Bank of Indias Benchmark Prime Lending Rate (BPLR)** at the beginning of the commercial bid opening month. The discounting factor will be equal to **75% of BPLR** [3].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum percentage that the vendor must quote for the Engineering Change Management item (D5) for both IMRH and DBMRH packages?
output: For Sl. No. 4 (IMRH) and Sl. No. 8 (DBMRH), the Vendor has to quote a **mandatory 29%** of the total work package cost [5, 6]. This quotation must be proportionate to the estimated effort [7].

instruction: What are the estimated percentage distributions of effort for the five phases (D1 to D5) for the IMRH work package?
output: The percentage distributions of estimated effort for IMRH are: D1: **0.9%**; D2: **11.5%**; D3: **26.2%**; D4: **32.8%**; D5: **28.6%** [8].

instruction: What are the desirable First Time Right (FTR) quality targets for FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) and Technical content of stress and dynamics reports (D3) for DBMRH?
output: The desirable FTR quality target for both FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) and Technical content of stress and dynamics reports (D3) is **> 98%** [9].

instruction: What essential methodologies must the Deliverable D1 (Preliminary Analysis and Methodology Documents) include for both IMRH and DBMRH?
output: D1 documents must include the **Methodology of FE modelling for stress analysis of full airframe and detailed airframe modules** [10, 11] and the **Methodology of Drawing and Model making** [10, 12]. For DBMRH, D1 also requires methodology for **Static, Fatigue, Crash and Damage Analysis Methodology and analysis documentations** [12, 13].

instruction: How is the complexity level of 3D CAD Layouts (D2) for IMRH estimated in terms of percentage distribution?
output: The complexity level of CAD Layouts (D2) is envisaged in the order of **20% (Simple), 60% (Medium), and 20% (Complex)** [14].

instruction: What are the target completion timelines (Milestones 1, 2, and 3) from the Purchase Order date (T0) for the Front Fuselage module under the IMRH work package?
output: Milestone 1 (D1) is targeted at **T0 + 2 months**. Milestone 2 (D2+D3) is targeted at **T0 + 10 months**. Milestone 3 (D4) is targeted at **T0 + 22 months** [15].

instruction: What consequence is applied if a bidder rejects HALs stipulated Liquidated Damages (LD) clause for the IMRH/DBMRH tender?
output: In the event of delay in delivery, liquidated damages will be payable / deducted from Invoice equal to **0.5% for every week** or part thereof, subject to a maximum of **five percent (5%)** of the delayed Supplies & Services [8].

instruction: What is HALs policy regarding the deduction of Income Tax for payments made to the vendor?
output: HAL would be **deducting at source applicable Income Tax as per Government of India Rules** applicable at the time of making payments (Generally on the amounts towards Services like training, technical assistance offered by the vendor and license fees). The tax has to be borne by the recipient of the Income [16].

instruction: For the URSC IMPP EoI, what specific circuit-level analyses are required for reliability assessment?
output: Required circuit-level analyses include: **Failure Mode Effect and Criticality Analysis (FMECA)**, **Worst Case Circuit Analysis (WCCA)**, **Monte-carlo analysis**, **Sensitivity analysis (SA)**, and **De-rating analysis (DA)** [17].

instruction: For the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software EOI, what is the required delivery schedule for the Deliverables?
output: Deliverables, including the IR Signature prediction software along with User Guides, Tutorials, and Software Manuals, must be provided within a delivery schedule of **30 months** [18].

instruction: What is the mandatory compliance regarding bidders from countries sharing a land border with India in LPSC tenders?
output: Vendors or Agents of a Vendor from a country sharing a border with India shall submit a copy of valid **registration made with the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)**, Government of India along with the tender **mandatorily**, without which the offer will be treated as invalid [19-21].

instruction: Under GeM RA rules, under what condition will the Highest Quoting bidder (H-1) be allowed to participate in RA, even if L-1 is a non-MII supplier?
output: H-1 will be allowed to participate in RA if L-1 is non-MII and H-1 is eligible MII, provided the H-1 price is coming within the price band of **20% of Non-MII L-1** [22-25].

instruction: What is the mandatory quality certification standard required for the BHEL Accumulator bidder?
output: The bidder should be **AS9100 compliant** at the time of the tender enquiry [26].

instruction: What is the specific purpose of the NDA format (Enclosure X) provided by HAL for this RFQ?
output: The purpose of the NDA is for exploratory discussions concerning a possible collaboration relating to the supply of goods/services for **ALH (ADVANCED LIGHT HELICOPTER)** [27].

instruction: For HAL Civil Works tenders (NCP/58/25-26), what financial documents covering the last three years must be uploaded?
output: The bidder must upload: (v) **Income Tax Returns for last Three years**; (vi) **Balance sheet for the last Three years** [28, 29].

instruction: What specific components comprise the structural airframe sections of the IMRH and DBMRH that are subject to design and analysis?
output: The airframe consists of: Front Fuselage, Centre Fuselage, Tail Boom & Empennage, Weapon Stub Wing (for IMRH) / Weapon Suspension System (for DBMRH), and Cowlings & Firewalls. [1-3]

instruction: What are the required reference sets that must be created for each 3D CAD geometry of a component and for each assembly CAD file?
output: For each 3D CAD geometry of a component, **'Model' and 'Solid' reference sets** must be created (containing required bodies only). For each assembly CAD file, **'Assembly', 'Model', and 'Solid' reference sets** must be created (containing required components and Parasolid bodies) for ease of assembly. [4-7]

instruction: What is the primary technical reason stated for focusing on the optimum weight distribution of the IMRH Tail Boom?
output: The optimum weight distribution of the tail boom will facilitate the **C.G. (Centre of Gravity) to be in the desired forward position** of the Helicopter. [8]

instruction: During the D2 phase, what detailed checks must be performed on fasteners within the assembly?
output: All fasteners called in the assembly are to be verified for **inter-rivet pitch, edge distances, head clearance, head placement** (outer or inner), type, material, and grip length as per the compendium provided by HAL. [9]

instruction: In the event that any bribe or gift is offered by the contractor or their agent, what are the two main consequences HAL can impose?
output: HAL can subject the contractor to the **cancellation of this and all other contracts with HAL**, and also to **payment of any loss or damage resulting from any such cancellation** [10].

instruction: What is the maximum percentage of the quoted unit price that HAL will load during commercial evaluation if a bidder rejects or partially accepts the Liquidated Damages (LD) clause?
output: The commercial evaluation will attract a **loading factor (maximum 10%)** on the quoted unit price, corresponding to the maximum LD cost or the extent of LD cost not agreed to [11, 12].

instruction: What is the mandated percentage distribution for complexity levels (Basic, Intermediate, Advanced) in FEM and FEA (D3) for Airframe Analysis?
output: The complexity level distribution for FEM and FEA is envisaged in the order of **20% (Basic), 60% (Intermediate), and 20% (Advanced)**. [13-16]

instruction: What is the specific requirement regarding the use of mirror options in 3D CAD modeling practices?
output: The use of **Assembly mirror option** for mirror part or **mirror body option is not acceptable**. Model must be made for both Left Hand (LH) and Right Hand (RH) parts separately with parameters, ensuring no connectivity between them. [4, 5, 7, 17, 18]

instruction: For the DBMRH design, what key structural provision is required for the Tail Boom and Empennage, and why?
output: The design must include structural provisions for **folding**, as the stowage dimensions are constrained by **ship hangar dimensions**. [19, 20]

instruction: What percentage of the estimated drawings finalized during D4 stage is anticipated to undergo changes during the Engineering Change Management (D5) phase for DBMRH?
output: It is estimated that an approximate **40% of drawings** that is finalised during D4 stage will undergo changes, requiring efforts for updating 3D Models, drawings, analysis, and documentations. [21]

instruction: What three types of specialized FEA Solvers are mandated by HAL for Failure and Damage Tolerance (F&DT) Analysis?
output: HAL will provide: **HyperWorks (Optistruct)**, **MSC NASTRAN (embedded Fatigue)**, **FRANC 3D**, and **NASGRO** for F&DT Analysis. [22-24]

instruction: What are the four classifications of Engineering Change Requests that the D5 phase is broadly mandated to resolve?
output: The changes are classified as resolutions for: (i) **Design Change Requests (DCR)**, (ii) **Production Queries (PQ) & Shop Queries (SQ)**, (iii) **Snags**, and (iv) **Material Substitution Requests (MSR)**. [25-28]

instruction: What types of reviews are mandated to occur weekly, monthly, and quarterly for the project?
output: Weekly reviews include **Design / Analysis Progress reviews**. Monthly reviews include **Design Technical meeting**. Quarterly reviews include **Project monitoring Team review**. [29, 30]

instruction: What specific methodology documents (D1) are required for the Dynamic Analysis component of the project?
output: The deliverables must include the **Methodology of FE modelling for Dynamic analysis of full airframe and detailed airframe modules** and **Static, Fatigue, Crash and Damage Analysis Methodology documentations**. [31-34]

instruction: What mandatory components must the technical bid include in their original form under the Two Bid System to avoid rejection in HAL indigenous tenders?
output: The technical bid must include the **EMD in original form** and the **Integrity Pact (if applicable) in original form**; technical bids without the EMD in original form will be rejected. [35, 36]

instruction: What is the required experience for Junior, Middle, and Senior level Designers/Analysts for the DBMRH project?
output: Junior Designer/Analyst shall have minimum **2 years** of experience; Middle level Designers/Analyst shall have minimum **5 years** of experience; and Senior level Designers/Analyst shall have minimum **10 years** of experience. [37]

instruction: What must the bidder upload to support their Annual Turnover claim for the HAL Civil Works tenders (NCP/74/25-26)?
output: The **Profit & Loss statement duly certified by Chartered Accountant with UDIN** shall be considered for evaluation of turnover for the respective financial year. [38, 39]

instruction: What must the bidder submit along with their offer if they are quoting for an alternative part number?
output: The bidder must confirm that the offered part is **fully interchangeable with the required part**. Applicable descriptive literature/catalogue (at least two copies) must be enclosed with the offer. [40]

instruction: What information regarding the corporate structure of the Engineering Service Provider must be furnished in the RFQ response?
output: The bidder must provide: Name of the Organization, Year of Incorporation, Type of Organization (Limited/Proprietary/etc.), whether 'Foreign Equity Participation' exists (name and percentage), and **Names of Directors of the Board/Proprietors**. [41]

instruction: What two explicit instructions must the Receiving Party follow when proprietary information is disclosed under the NSTL NDA?
output: The Receiving Party should treat it with **reasonable care** [42] and should **not discuss the confidential information disclosed by the First Party with any Third Party, within Government Organizations or outside Government Organizations** without the prior written approval of Director/First Party [42].

instruction: What are the specific noise and vibration standards that the IMRH helicopter design must conform to?
output: The noise and vibration levels of the IMRH should conform to **MIL-STD-1474E** and **ADS-27A-SP** respectively.

instruction: What are the specific noise and vibration standards that the DBMRH helicopter design must conform to?
output: The noise levels of the DBMRH should conform to **DEFSTAN 00-970 Volume 2** and the vibration levels should conform to **ISO 2631-1 & ISO 2631-5** standards.

instruction: What is the policy regarding the use of Boolean operations and the selection of material density in 3D CAD modeling?
output: The use of **Boolean operations should be avoided as much as possible**, except where unavoidable [1], [2]. Furthermore, the Engineering Service Provider must **Check for the correct material/Density** selected for modeling as per the Material specification [1], [2].

instruction: How must the CAD modeling approach handle geometry of components that will be mirrored (LH/RH parts)?
output: Wherever the drawing calls for Left Hand (LH) shown and Right Hand (RH) opposite, the model must be made for **both LH & RH parts separately with parameters** [3], [4]. Crucially, there should be **no connectivity (feature wise) between the LH & RH part** [3], [4]. The use of the Assembly mirror option or mirror body option is **not acceptable** [1], [4].

instruction: What four mandatory review types and their respective frequencies are required during the project execution phase?
output: The mandated reviews and their frequencies are: 1) Design / Analysis Progress reviews (**Once a Week**); 2) Design Technical meeting (**Need basis**); 3) Project Management Review (**Monthly**); and 4) Management review (**Quarterly**).

instruction: What specific actions must the supplier take regarding IPR and balance work in the event of contract termination by either party?
output: Upon termination, the supplier shall ensure that: 1) **IPRs are transferred to HAL** to enable HAL to proceed on the work with other suppliers; and 2) Suppliers will render **all assistance till the other suppliers fully take over the balance work** [5].

instruction: What is the penalty if the successful bidder makes a false or misleading representation in the qualification documents?
output: If a supplier is found to have provided information that is **untrue or misleading**, HAL has the right to terminate the contract with a **3 month's advance notice** [6]. Furthermore, the supplier shall be **barred from participating in future contracts for a minimum period of 2 years**, and the revocation of banning orders is subject to HAL's discretion [6].

instruction: What two explicit steps must the Engineering Service Provider follow regarding the structure and exclusion of the 'Wave linking concept' in large assemblies?
output: The **Wave linking concept is to be used for Referenced bodies** [7], [8], [9], [10]. However, the referenced bodies must be **excluded from the Reference set** for the specific purpose of reducing the file size loading time of Assemblies [7], [8], [9], [10].

instruction: List four types of electronic gadgets or devices explicitly prohibited from being brought into the HAL RWRDC premises by vendor engineers.
output: Engineers deputed by the Vendor are **not permitted to bring in any data storage or data transmitting devices**, including [11], [12]: **mobile phones** [11], [12], **WIFI devices**, **cameras**, **smart watches**, **pen drives**, **external storage devices**, **SSD devices**, **microphones**, or **card readers** [13].

instruction: What is the maximum liability limit placed on the Vendor to HAL under the Limitation of Liability clause, and what three exceptions apply to this cap?
output: The aggregate liability of the Vendor to HAL shall **not exceed the total or 100% of the Contract Price** [14]. This limitation does not apply to: 1) cases of **criminal negligence or wilful misconduct**; 2) the **cost of repairing or replacing defective equipment**; or 3) any obligation of the Vendor to indemnify HAL concerning **IPR infringement** [14].

instruction: What is the estimated percentage distribution for complexity levels (Basic, Intermediate, Advanced) in FEM and FEA (D3) for Airframe Analysis?
output: The complexity level of FEM and FEA is envisaged in the order of **20% (Basic), 60% (Intermediate), and 20% (Advanced)** [15], [16].

instruction: What specific details must be checked regarding fasteners in an assembly during the 3D CAD Layout (D2) phase?
output: All fasteners called in the assembly are to be verified for **inter-rivet pitch**, **edge distances**, **head clearance**, **head placement** (outer or inner), type, material, and grip length etc. as per the compendium provided by HAL [17], [18].

instruction: What is the consequence if the bidder makes an incorrect statement regarding previous transgressions?
output: If the Bidder(s)/Seller(s) makes an incorrect statement on previous transgressions, they can be **disqualified from the tender process** or the contract, if already awarded, can be **terminated** for such reason without any liability whatsoever on the Buyer [19].

instruction: How should the bidder address their taxes and prices in the quotation to avoid being considered 'all inclusive'?
output: The applicability of Taxes should be **explicitly indicated by the bidder** in their response either in percentage or in absolute terms. In the absence of this input, the offer would be considered **all inclusive** [20].

instruction: What are the four components comprising the Power Conditioning Unit (PCU) in the URSC IMPP design?
output: The Power Conditioning Unit (PCU) consists of the **Power Module (PM)**, **Boost Shunt Regulator (BSR)**, and **Battery Charge Regulator (BCR)** [1]. The PCU handles power module, BSR and BCR are the power conditioners [1].

instruction: What are the seven components comprising the Core Power Electronics (CPE) in the URSC IMPP design?
output: The Core Power Electronics (CPE) consists of the **Domestic Regulator**, **Bus capacitor**, **Majority Voting Logic (MVL)**, **Decoder**, **FPGA**, **Load Current Sensor (LCS)**, and **Domestic Regulator Over Voltage Protection (DROVP)** [2, 3].

instruction: What are the specific input voltage ranges for the Battery Live/Return Input and Solar Array Live/Return Input to the Power Module (PM)?
output: The input signal ranges for the PM Module are **66V  96V** for the Battery Live & Return Input, and **0V  105V** for the Solar Array Live & Return Input [4].

instruction: How is the complexity of detailed CAD models (D4) for IMRH classified, based on equivalent drawing sheet size?
output: The complexity level is classified as a percentage distribution of equivalent drawing sheet size: **A4  20%**, **A3  30%**, **A2  20%**, **A1  15%**, and **A0  15%** [5].

instruction: What mandatory components must be included in the 'Model' and 'Solid' reference sets for each 3D CAD geometry component?
output: For each 3D CAD geometry of a component, **'Model' and 'Solid' reference sets** must be created, containing **required bodies only** [6-8].

instruction: What specific NX software tool must be used to check for tiny/misaligned objects and sheet boundaries?
output: The tool **'Analysis - Examine Geometry'** must be used to check for tiny/misaligned objects, intersections/sheet boundaries/tolerances [9-11].

instruction: What is the consequence of utilizing the 'Assembly mirror option' or 'mirror body option' in 3D CAD modeling?
output: The use of the **Assembly mirror option for mirror part** or **mirror body option is not acceptable** [7, 9, 11, 12].

instruction: What is the primary technical function of the Tail Boom in the IMRH airframe?
output: The Tail boom supports the **tail gearbox**, **Intermediate gear box**, **tail drive shafts**, assembly segments, and the **horizontal stabilizer with the vertical fin** [13].

instruction: What specific tests must the vendor prepare documentation for related to Ground Test Vehicle (GTV) structural components?
output: The Engineering Service Provider must prepare **FEM, FEA and Test orders for ground test of structural components** (including Break Away Fuselage test, Tail boom test, Vertical fin Test, etc.) as per the test plan [12, 14-16].

instruction: What are the two major financial milestones (excluding D5) for the Detail Design & DWG (D4) phase payment schedule?
output: The payment schedule for D4 is split into four 25% installments: The **4th Payment** is for completion of the first 25% of drawings/reports/analysis, and the **7th Payment** is for completion of Detail Design & DWG (the final 25% of drawings/reports/analysis) [17, 18].

instruction: What is the estimated percentage of drawings finalized during D4 that are expected to undergo changes during the D5 (Engineering Change Management) phase?
output: It is estimated that an approximate **40% of drawings** that is finalised during the D4 stage will undergo changes during the D5 phase [19-22].

instruction: What is the expected man-hour deployment requirement during the initial period of the D5 phase?
output: Based on experience from previous projects, it is assumed that around **40% of peak man-hour requirement** during the D2 to D4 phase should be deployed during the initial period of the D5 phase [19-22].

instruction: What is the primary mandate for the Cowlings and Firewalls section of the IMRH airframe?
output: The Cowlings and Firewalls must be **aerodynamically designed composite-based components** [23], and the design outputs will be concurred by HAL [24].

instruction: What is the expected lifespan (calendar life) of the IMRH helicopter?
output: The helicopter should be in service for a Calendar life of **30 years or more** [25].

instruction: What specific software environment/version is required for NX and Teamcenter usage?
output: The required versions are **Teamcenter 12.4 & above** and **NX 1926 & above**, which must match the versions being used by RWRDC [26].

instruction: List the five primary FEA Solvers provided by HAL for the execution of the work package.
output: The FEA Solvers provided are **MSC NASTRAN**, **HyperWorks (Optistruct)**, **LS-DYNA**, **Abaqus**, and **MSC Adams** [26-29].

instruction: What three types of specialized F&DT Analysis tools are provided by HAL?
output: The tools for F&DT Analysis are **HyperWorks (Optistruct)**, **MSC NASTRAN (embedded Fatigue)**, **FRANC 3D**, and **NASGRO** [26-29].

instruction: What specific checks should be performed using the NX 'Edit-FeaturePlayback Option'?
output: The bidder must run the 'Edit-FeaturePlayback Option' to know the **update failure of features of the part file** [9-11, 30].

instruction: What is the mandatory certification requirement for the LSI partner regarding Quality Management Systems for the NPOL LFBMS EOI?
output: The Industry Partner shall possess valid **ISO 9001:2015/AS9100D/ equivalent or better** and valid **CMMI Level 3+ certification** for software engineering practices [31].

instruction: What component is mandatory for all fastener holes/axes alignment?
output: Each fastener hole/axis has to be **normal to surface and co-axially aligned with the adjacent parts/assembly** as per design standard practice [32, 33].

instruction: What is the requirement for the stress analysis reports concerning design standards?
output: All the stress reports and design documents are to be complied to **relevant standards (FAR/DEFSTAN etc)** in co-ordination with the Airworthiness group of RWR&DC [34-36].

instruction: What are the mandatory file formats for the Finalised FE model outputs in the D4 deliverable?
output: Finalised FE models must be provided in applicable formats, including: **Hypermesh FE Models (*.HM)**, Input data in **NASTRAN format (*.DAT / *.BDF)** and output data in **MSC NASTRAN format (*.F06, *.PCH, *.OP2, H3D)** [37-40].

instruction: What specific components are needed to process the Battery power and Solar Array power in the Power Module (PM)?
output: The battery power processing is done through a **DC-DC converter**, whereas the solar array power is processed using a **shunt regulator** [41].

instruction: What is the percentage distribution of the D4 cost allocated to the 7th Payment milestone?
output: The 7th Payment is for the completion of Detail Design & DWG (D4), accounting for **25% of D4** [18].

instruction: What action is required if the Master geometry surfaces need updates?
output: Master geometry surfaces are **not to be edited** by the vendor. In case of any higher issue release, the same **will be communicated by HAL** [42-44].

instruction: What mandatory documentation must support the simulation results related to stress analysis?
output: The simulation results must be supported by **hand calculations / industry standard analytical procedures**, as applicable [45-47].

instruction: What is the required thickness and material for the Cowlings & Firewalls section of the IMRH?
output: The Cowlings & Firewalls must be constructed using **Titanium alloy** to meet the fire-resistant requirements of **DEFSTAN / FAR-29 amdt. 59 /CS-29** [23, 45].

instruction: What is the mandatory maximum permissible velocity for moving targets detected by the HLS-GSR-16 Radar?
output: The maximum velocity for moving targets detected is **120 Km/h** (when selecting 180/sec antenna scan rate) [48].

instruction: What is the required velocity range for target detection?
output: Targets radial velocity must be between a minimal of **1.5 m/s** and a maximum of **120 Km/h** [48].

instruction: What is the minimum required man-hour deployment assumption for the D5 phase relative to the peak D2-D4 requirement?
output: It is assumed that around **40% of peak man-hour requirement** during D2 to D4 phase should be deployed during the initial period of D5 phase [19-22].

instruction: What are the four classifications of Engineering Change Requests managed during the D5 phase?
output: The requests are broadly classified as resolution for: (i) **Design Change Requests (DCR)**; (ii) **Production Queries (PQ) & Shop Queries (SQ)**; (iii) **Snags**; and (iv) **Material Substitution Requests (MSR)** [49-52].

instruction: What is the specific timeframe for the submission of the SOP (Standard Operating Procedure) for the prototype?
output: Submission of SOP along with other documents for the prototype must occur after incorporating new drawings/changes/feedbacks in **30 months** [53].

instruction: What are the delivery timelines for the five major IMRH airframe modules (Front Fuselage, Centre Fuselage, Tail Boom, Weapon Stub Wing, Cowlings & Firewalls) for Milestone 3 (D4)?
output: For all five modules, Milestone 3 (D4) is scheduled at **T2 + 12 months** [54, 55].

instruction: What is the mandatory method and document required for the creation of composite skins in 3D CAD modeling?
output: All composite skins must be created using the **Modeling module of NX for ply wise modelling** and the creation of a **ply-book** [56, 57].

instruction: What is the mandatory output format for the Weight and C.G. report?
output: The Weight & CG report with station wise weight distribution must be delivered in **Word Document (.docx) / Excel (.xlsx)** format [58-61].

instruction: What is the target accuracy in range measurement for moving targets by the HLS-GSR-16 Radar?
output: The target accuracy in range measurement for all range scales is **0.5 m** [62].

instruction: What is the required output voltage and tolerance for the Highest position sensor output of the Accumulator Hall Effect Sensor?
output: The Highest position sensor output voltage must be **4.68 V 0.4 V** [63].

instruction: What is the mandatory material for construction of the Cowlings and Firewalls for the IMRH?
output: Cowlings and Firewalls are to be **aerodynamically designed composite-based components** [23].

instruction: What specific software is provided for the FEA Pre/Post Processor in the IMRH/DBMRH work package?
output: The software provided for the FEA Pre/Post Processor is **Hyper-works** and **MSC Patran** [26-29].

instruction: What are the two major mandatory steps to be undertaken by the vendor upon the release of the Purchase Order (PO)?
output: PO acceptance must be given within **02 weeks** from the date of release of the PO. The vendor also has to take **necessary clearances as per HAL rules within 2 weeks** to start the work from the date of release of PO [53].

instruction: What specific methodology documents (D1) are required for the Static Analysis component of the project?
output: The deliverables must include the **Methodology of FE modelling for static analysis of full airframe and detailed airframe modules** [10, 11] and the **Methodology of Drawing and Model making** [10, 12]. For DBMRH, D1 also requires methodology for **Static, Fatigue, Crash and Damage Analysis Methodology and analysis documentations** [12, 13].

instruction: How is the complexity level of 3D CAD Layouts (D2) for IMRH estimated in terms of percentage distribution?
output: The complexity level of CAD Layouts (D2) is envisaged in the order of **20% (Simple), 60% (Medium), and 20% (Complex)** [14].

instruction: What are the target completion timelines (Milestones 1, 2, and 3) from the Purchase Order date (T0) for the Front Fuselage module under the IMRH work package?
output: Milestone 1 (D1) is targeted at **T0 + 2 months**. Milestone 2 (D2+D3) is targeted at **T0 + 10 months**. Milestone 3 (D4) is targeted at **T0 + 22 months** [15].

instruction: What consequence is applied if a bidder rejects HALs stipulated Liquidated Damages (LD) clause for the IMRH/DBMRH tender?
output: In the event of delay in delivery, liquidated damages will be payable / deducted from Invoice equal to **0.5% for every week** or part thereof, subject to a maximum of **five percent (5%)** of the delayed Supplies & Services [8].

instruction: What is HALs policy regarding the deduction of Income Tax for payments made to the vendor?
output: HAL would be **deducting at source applicable Income Tax as per Government of India Rules** applicable at the time of making payments (Generally at the rate of 2% plus applicable surcharge and cess) [9].

instruction: What is the mandatory Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) amount required for the IMRH/DBMRH Airframe Design RFQ?
output: The EMD required to be submitted by the participating bidder along with the bid is **Rs. 2 lac** [1].

instruction: What is the mandatory deadline for vendors to submit both the technical and commercial bids following the Pre-bid meeting for the IMRH/DBMRH RFQ?
output: **04 weeks** will be given to submit both the bids i.e. technical and commercial bids, post the pre-bid meeting [1].

instruction: What is the consequence if the vendor fails to propose a resolution within 15 days after HAL issues a Notice of intent to invoke the Risk Purchase Clause?
output: If a resolution to the issue is not proposed by the vendor within **15 days** or if the proposal is unacceptable, HAL will initiate action to Short-Close or Terminate the Order and proceed with alternative arrangements [2].

instruction: What specific costs is the defaulting vendor liable to pay HAL under the Risk Purchase Clause?
output: The vendor shall be liable to pay HAL the **difference between the price at which such alternate arrangement will be made and the price as per the original Order/Contract** for the items undelivered or delivered with non-compliances [2].

instruction: What is the timeframe provided to interested vendors to sign the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) following the Pre-bid meeting?
output: **01 week** would be given from the date of the Pre-bid meeting to sign the NDA [3].

instruction: When is the technical bid evaluated, and what is the key activity performed by HAL immediately after opening the technical bid?
output: After the due date, the technical bid will be opened. HAL will then **assess the capabilities, resources and capacities of the vendors** for the nature of work involved and shortlist vendors [1].

instruction: Who opens the commercial bid, and for which bidders is the commercial bid opening restricted?
output: The Commercial bid will be opened only for the vendors who will **qualify under the technical bid and vendor qualification criteria** by the HAL committee [1].

instruction: What is the acronym for the committee that reviews the deliverables and accepts the completion of work?
output: The committee that reviews the deliverables and accepts the completion of the work is the **Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)** [4], [5], [6], [7].

instruction: What is the rule regarding payment processing relative to the Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)?
output: The deliverable is deemed to be complete only after the **PTMC accepts the same**. Payment shall be **linked to successful completion of delivery milestones** [4], [7].

instruction: What three types of reviews are explicitly mandated for the project schedule?
output: Reviews like **Detail Design Review**, **Requirement Capture Review**, **Critical Design Review**, and **Technical Progress Reviews** shall be conducted [8], [9], [10], [11].

instruction: What specific design reviews are required to be completed before the release of part drawings?
output: The Interface Clearance arrangement Layout review should be completed before the **Critical Design Review (CDR)** to facilitate the release of part drawings after CDR [12].

instruction: What is the mandatory First Time Right (FTR) quality target for 3D Design Layouts (D2) and Part and assembly models and drawings (D4)?
output: The desirable FTR quality target for 3D Design Layouts (D2) is **> 85%** [13], [14], [15]. The FTR quality target for Part and assembly models and drawings (D4) is **> 95%** [13], [14], [15].

instruction: What is the mandatory FTR quality target for FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) and Technical content of stress and dynamics reports (D3)?
output: The desirable FTR quality target is **> 98%** for both FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) and Technical content of stress and dynamics reports (D3) [13], [14], [15].

instruction: What is the estimated complexity distribution for 3D CAD Layouts (D2) in terms of Simple, Medium, and Complex Layouts?
output: The complexity level of CAD Layouts (D2) is envisaged in the order of **20% (Simple), 60% (Medium), and 20% (Complex)** [16].

instruction: What is the estimated complexity distribution for FEM and FEA (D3) in terms of Basic, Intermediate, and Advanced Analysis?
output: The complexity level of FEM and FEA (D3) is envisaged in the order of **20% (Basic), 60% (Intermediate) and 20% (Advanced)** [17], [18].

instruction: What five modules of the IMRH airframe share the same milestone schedule (T0+2, T0+10, T0+22 months)?
output: The modules sharing the Milestone 1 (T0+2), Milestone 2 (T0+10), and Milestone 3 (T0+22) schedule are: **Front Fuselage**, **Centre Fuselage**, **Tail Boom & Empennage**, **Weapon Stub Wing**, and **Cowlings & Firewalls** [19].

instruction: What is the final milestone (Milestone 4) delivery time for all five IMRH airframe modules?
output: Milestone 4 (Engineering Change Management - D5) is scheduled for **T0 + 52 months** for all five modules [19], [20].

instruction: What are the four classifications of issues that are resolved under the Engineering Change Management (D5) phase?
output: The D5 phase handles resolution for: (i) **Design Change Requests**; (ii) **Production Queries (PQ) & Shop Queries (SQ)**; (iii) **Snags**; and (iv) **Material Substitution Requests (MSR)** [21], [22].

instruction: What file format is required for the Drawing Release Notice (DRN)?
output: The Drawing Release Notice (DRN) is a required deliverable document [23], [24]. The specified format for DRN itself is not listed, but many deliverables are in **NX (.prt)** or **Teamcenter form** [23], [24].

instruction: What format is required for the Weight and CG report with station wise weight distribution?
output: The Creation of Weight & CG report with station wise weight distribution must be submitted in **Word Document (.docx)** or **NX(.prt)** format [24], [25].

instruction: What deliverables are provided in Excel (.xlsx) format?
output: Excel (.xlsx) format is specified for documents like **Material Schedule (MS)**, **Part Attributes and Applicability info**, **Payment Status & Tracking** (Teamcenter form), and **Tolerance Stack up Analysis reports** [23], [24].

instruction: What specific materials and process standards are pending finalization until the D1 phase is complete?
output: The detailed list for the following standards will be finalized during the D1 Phase (Preliminary Analysis and Methodology Documents): **Material properties**, **Heat Treatment**, **Surface Treatment**, **Airframe environmental protection requirements**, and **Composite Manufacturing processes** [26], [27].

instruction: What is the total duration of the contract period for the Lead System Integrator (LSI) of the Low Frequency Bow Mounted Sonar (LFBMS)?
output: The contract period for Lead System Integrator of LFBMS is **36 Months** [28].

instruction: Where do the Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) rest for the LFBMS project being managed by NPOL?
output: All **Intellectual Property Rights shall be with NPOL, DRDO** [29].

instruction: What are the EOI Submission End Date and Opening Date for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software for Warships?
output: The EOI Submission End Date is **13.10.2025 (14:00 Hrs.)**. The EOI Opening Date is **14.10.2025 (14:00 Hrs.)** [30].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum average annual turnover required for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software EOI?
output: The average annual turnover during the last 3 years, ending 31st March of the previous financial year, should be at least **Rs 15 Crores** [31], [32].

instruction: What is the IPR arrangement for the Infrared Signature Prediction Software (NSTL)?
output: The Intellectual Property (IP) Rights of the software will be **jointly with Industry partner and NSTL, DRDO** [30], [33]. DRDO retains the march-in rights to use the IP for its own use [30], [33].

instruction: What is the confidentiality period specified in the Non-Disclosure Agreement for the NSTL EOI?
output: The confidentiality period is for the term of the Agreement and **Ten (10) years thereafter** [34], [35].

instruction: What material and condition must be used for the fabrication of the Dummy LRU mockups for SOF testing?
output: The mockups should be manufactured using **Aluminium Alloy 6061 T6 Condition** [36], [37]. Hard points must use **SS421 martensitic stainless steel** [36], [37].

instruction: What is the total completion period for the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: The job should be completed within **05 months** from the placement of the supply order [36], [37].

instruction: What are the acceptance criteria for the Dummy LRUs?
output: The Basis of acceptance and Acceptance criteria of the item being procured are the **SOF Test Report and Delivery of Items** [38], [39].

instruction: What are the specific parameters for the Random Vibration test (MIL-STD-810 F SEC 514.5) for the Dummy LRUs?
output: The test requires a Frequency sweep during resonance search at **0.5g from 5 Hz to 2000 Hz**. The duration is **15 min per axis** [40], [41].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum average annual turnover and experience required for the Custom Bid for Services - HILS Test Facility (GeM/2025/B/6013766)?
output: The Minimum Average Annual Turnover is **169 Lakh(s)** and **3 Years** of Past Experience is Required for the same/similar service [42].

instruction: What organization is procuring the Design Development Installation And Commissioning of HILS Test Facility?
output: The organization is the **Office Of Dg (aero)** under the Department Of Defence Research & Development [43].

instruction: Where is the mandatory Pre-Bid meeting being held for the HILS Test Facility tender?
