output: The Pre-Bid meeting is scheduled for 10-01-2025 10:00:00 at **ADE, Bangalore** [44].

instruction: What is the primary item category for the GeM bid GEM/2025/B/6263867 issued by BEL?
output: The primary product category is **CABLE ASSY DB9 TO D38999 26WB-35PIN - 3M** [45].

instruction: What is the required delivery time (in days) for the five cable assembly schedules in BEL GeM bid GEM/2025/B/6263867?
output: The required Delivery Days for all five schedules (Schedule 1 through Schedule 5) are **90 days** [46], [47], [48], [49], [50].

instruction: What are the key technical components required for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software?
output: The software should be equipped with modules for: **Geometry and Material Definition**, **Environmental Condition**, **CFD & Thermal Analysis**, **Atmospheric Transmission & IR Propagation**, **Ship & Marine**, **Validation & Calibration**, and **Data Management & Output** [51], [52].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the structure weight targets specified during the D1 phase for the DBMRH project?
output: The **structure weight targets of parts and assemblies specified during the D1 phase must be met**. The bidder is encouraged to submit proposals for further reduction in weight using best optimization practices [53].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the GeM bid GEM/2025/B/6817036 (Sealant Mixing Machine)?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **2** [54].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the GeM bid GEM/2025/B/6822972 (Electric Fork Lift)?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **3** [55].

instruction: What must the bidder confirm regarding proprietary information that is already known to them when submitting the NDA for NSTL?
output: If the Proprietary Information is already known to the Receiving Party (bidder), they must bring such fact **to the attention of the Disclosing Party immediately upon disclosure** [56].

instruction: What are the specific consequences HAL can impose if a vendor makes a false declaration regarding engagement of agents or payment of agency commission?
output: The Seller will be liable to refund the amount paid plus interest at **2% per annum above SOFR** (for foreign vendors) or **MCLR of SBI plus 2%** (for Indian vendors), and will be **debarred from participating in any RFQ/Tender for new projects for a minimum period of five years** [1-3].

instruction: What documents must be submitted to HAL in original hard copy, and what risk does the vendor bear regarding these submissions?
output: The bidder must submit the **Integrity Pact (IP)** in original, duly signed [3, 11.a]. HAL will **not be responsible for any transit/postal delay** or delay due to any other reasons in receipt of the hard copy of the original signed IP [24.2, 13].

instruction: What are the two mandatory actions the Engineering Service Provider must take regarding the confidentiality of the work at HAL premises?
output: The vendor must execute a **Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)** with HAL for data security [4, 5], and must **not make any attempt to keep a copy** of the Design work or transfer/transmit/copy/print/hand sketch any file/document onto any type of storage device [6, 7].

instruction: What specific electronic devices are strictly prohibited from being brought into the HAL work premises by vendor engineers?
output: Engineers are **not permitted to bring in any data storage or data transmitting devices**, including: **mobile phones, laptops/PCs**, WIFI devices, cameras, smart watches, pen drives, external storage devices, SSD devices, microphones, card readers, micro cameras, Go-pro cameras, or listeners [35, 37, 18.c].

instruction: What happens if a bidder is found to have indulged in corrupt or fraudulent practices during the URSC IMPP EOI process?
output: Companies/Firms found to have indulged in any corrupt or fraudulent practices will be **debarred from taking part in the Tendering process** and their EOI document will **not be taken up for consideration** [8].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the salary and statutory liabilities of the personnel deployed for the HAL work packages?
output: The Service provider should pay salary to its employees as per government norms and contribute towards **PF, ESI, insurance policy and any other statutory requirement**. HAL shall not in any manner be liable for these statutory liabilities [9, 10].

instruction: What is the consequence if the bidder fails to mention the applicable taxes (like GST) explicitly in their quote?
output: The applicability of Taxes should be explicitly indicated by the bidder in their response. In the **absence of this input, the offer would be considered all inclusive** [18.3, 11, 103, 110].

instruction: What is the primary evaluation criteria for both the IMRH and DBMRH work packages?
output: The tender will be evaluated on a **package basis** (Sr. No. 1 to 4 as one package, and Sr. No. 5 to 8 as the other package). The bid with the **lowest price conforming to the specification/scope of work for the individual package** will be considered for placement of order [18.1, 10].

instruction: What happens if the Bidder makes an incorrect statement regarding previous transgressions on the Integrity Pact?
output: The Bidder(s)/Seller(s) can be **disqualified from the tender process** or the contract, if already awarded, can be **terminated for such reason without any liability whatsoever on the Buyer** [6.2, 44, 57].

instruction: What specific action can HAL take if the vendor fails to submit an unsatisfactory resolution within 15 days of receiving a Risk Purchase Notice?
output: HAL will initiate action to **Short-Close or Terminate the Order** and go ahead with making alternative arrangements. The vendor shall be liable to pay HAL the **difference between the price of the alternate arrangement and the original contract price** [11, 12].

instruction: What are the three categories of losses exempted from the Vendor's aggregate liability cap of 100% of the Contract Price?
output: The aggregate liability cap does not apply to: 1) cases of **criminal negligence or wilful misconduct**; 2) the **cost of repairing or replacing defective equipment**; or 3) any obligation of the Vendor to indemnify HAL concerning **IPR infringement** [13, 14].

instruction: What is the policy regarding the refund of Agency Commission if a vendor's declaration is found to be incorrect after contract award?
output: The Seller will be liable to refund **all Agency Commission payments** made by the Seller along with interest at the rate of **2% per annum above SOFR** (for foreign vendors) or **MCLR of SBI plus 2%** (for Indian vendors) [2, 3, 15].

instruction: What documents must accompany the supply of Raw materials (bar, sheet, wires etc.) to HAL?
output: **Release note/ OEM certificate of conformity with physical and chemical test report** is required along with the supply [13.i, 113].

instruction: What is the mandatory required period for which prices quoted must be valid for HAL's acceptance?
output: Price quoted should remain valid for acceptance for a minimum of **120 days** from the closing date of enquiry [6, 105, 15.b, 384, 412, 429]. For Single Part tenders in LPSC, the validity is **90 days** [15.a, 384, 412, 429].

instruction: What are the two specific documents that must be uploaded by the bidder during the tender process to prove their eligibility for the HAL IMRH/DBMRH RFQ?
output: The Vendor has to submit the **Vendor Qualification form (Enclosure VII)** and the **Engineering service provider detail form (Enclosue VIII)** [2.3, 7].

instruction: Under what circumstance does HAL reserve the right to purchase the balance quantity from L-2 or L-3 bidders at the L-1 price?
output: If the lowest bidder has not offered full quantity, for the balance quantity HAL reserves the right to source from other bidders **on L1 price** [10.f, 109]. To have a parallel source, the order may be split to 2 or 3 sources subject to other bidders agreeing for L-1 price [10.g, 109].

instruction: What are the penalties imposed by HAL on defaulted bidders who make false declarations regarding local content?
output: The bidder will be **debarred from purchase preference for further tenders** for the next two years. Additionally, a penalty of up to **2% value of each order** will be deducted on such defaulted bidders after order placement [13.l, 350].

instruction: What is the required payment term for Indigenous supplies to LPSC (VD-05 Radiators/Gaganyaan)?
output: **100% payment shall be made through RTGS within 30 days of receipt and acceptance** of the item at the LPSC site against submission of PBG [16-20].

instruction: What is the mandatory requirement for foreign bidders concerning Customs Duty exemption certificates?
output: Foreign bidders must quote rates both **with and without Custom duty exemption**. HAL reserves the right to avail the exemption and will provide the certificate (if applicable), but the bidder must submit the foreign supplier's invoice prior to release of the certificate [1.c, 101].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure when submitting their quote regarding the ordered quantity?
output: Unless otherwise mentioned, it would be assumed that the rates hold good even when **lesser quantities** than those enquired of are ordered [9, 21]. Any increase in prices at a later date for ordering lesser quantities will **not be agreed to** [9, 21].

instruction: What two mandatory documents must be uploaded for the BEL RFx 7000569182 if the bid value exceeds Rs. 3 Crores?
output: The **4 digit HSN code** for each material must be provided and an **excel file must be attached separately** in the Collaboration folder [22]. The **Integrity Pact** has to be signed if the bid value is **Rs. Three Crores (INR Thirty Million) or above** [22, 23].

instruction: What is the penalty rate for delayed delivery in BEL GeM bids, and what is the maximum ceiling?
output: If the supplier fails to deliver, a sum equivalent to **0.5% of the value of materials not supplied in time for every week of delay** or part thereof, subject to a maximum of **10%**, will be deducted [24].

instruction: In the GeM Reverse Auction process, list the five cases where the technically qualified Highest Quoting bidder (H-1) is still allowed to participate.
output: H-1 is allowed if: i. If number of technically qualified bidders are only **2 or 3**; ii. If Buyer has chosen to split the bid amongst N sellers, and H1 bid is coming within N; iii. In case Primary product of only one OEM is left in contention for participation in RA on elimination of H-1; iv. If L-1 is non-MSE and H-1 is eligible MSE and H-1 price is coming within price band of **15%** of Non-MSE L-1; v. If L-1 is non-MII and H-1 is eligible MII and H-1 price is coming within price band of **20%** of Non-MII L-1 [25-37].

instruction: What is the mandatory requirement for the bidder regarding the Invoice in all GeM contracts?
output: Supplier shall ensure that the Invoice is raised in the name of **Consignee with GSTIN of Consignee only** [38-47].

instruction: What specific action must sellers take when RCM (Reverse Charge Mechanism) is applicable in GeM bids?
output: Sellers will be forced to put **Zero GST and GST cess** in their bids. The Buyer will then have the liability of paying the GST and GST cess to the government on the specified rate mentioned by them in the Bid [48, 49].

instruction: What are the two consequences if the IP addresses of bidders in a GeM bid are found to be the same?
output: If IP address of bidders are found to be the same, then offers of such bidders are **liable for disqualification**. The Buyer's decision in this regard shall be final, and **no communication from the seller will be entertained** [50-53].

instruction: What is the consequence if the bidder fails to meet the compliance deadline for the Integrity Pact (IP)?
output: Entering into an integrity pact without deviation from the specified format is a preliminary qualification, without which the bid is **liable to be rejected without evaluation** [24.3, 13, 115].

instruction: Under the HAL Risk Purchase Clause, what is the mandatory notice HAL must issue before proceeding with alternate arrangements?
output: Prior to invoking this clause, HAL will issue a **Notice stating its intention to go ahead with alternative arrangements and the obligations of the vendor** [11, 12].

instruction: What is the duration of the Integrity Pact (IP) for successful bidders and for unsuccessful bidders?
output: For the **successful Bidder(s)/Seller(s)**, the IP expires **12 months after the last payment** under the contract. For **all other unsuccessful Bidder(s)/Seller(s)**, it expires within **6 months from the date of placement of order/finalization of contract** [13.1, 49, 64].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the technical data sheet when proposing an alternative part number?
output: All offers for alternative specifications or components should be accompanied by a **technical datasheet proving the fit and function**, and such offers will only be considered subject to **acceptance by HALs technical team** [54].

instruction: Under what condition is EMD exempted, and what is required for EMD submission via SWIFT/Wire Transfer?
output: EMD exemption is generally applicable (if the estimated order value exceeds Rs 5 Crs) [55, 56]. If EMD is sent by SWIFT / Wire Transfer, the **Transaction Code should be indicated along with the technical bid** [8.f, 106].

instruction: What are the mandatory documents the bidder must submit for Vendor Code Creation in HAL GeM bids?
output: The bidder must submit: a. Copy of **PAN Card**; b. Copy of **GSTIN**; c. Copy of **Cancelled Cheque**; d. Copy of **EFT Mandate** duly certified by Bank [57-60].

instruction: What is the consequence if a bidder fails to return drawings or documents supplied by HAL?
output: If the bidder is unable to quote, they should **return all the documents and data supplied by HAL** (if any) in reference to this RFQ [4.ii, 4], and all drawings (photos/sketches) sent by HAL should be returned along with the quotations or immediately with a regret letter [13.g, 114].

instruction: What explicit condition regarding price adjustments will lead to commercial rejection of a bid?
output: No price adjustments are allowed in the price bid; lines indicating prices which are **subject to price adjustments based on any references will be commercially rejected** [61, 62].

instruction: What three options does LPSC have if a Contractor fails to deliver stores as stipulated?
output: LPSC is entitled to: (i) recover LD (0.5% per week up to 5%, or 10% for inordinate delays) [6.b, 372, 417]; (ii) **purchase from elsewhere at the risk of the Contractor without notice** [6.b.ii, 373, 418]; or (iii) **cancel the contract or a portion thereof and re-purchase at the risk and cost of the Contractor** [6.b.iii, 374, 419].

instruction: What two types of certifications are exempted from the local content calculation in LPSC tenders?
output: The local content calculation **excludes** imported items sourced locally from resellers/distributors and **license fees/royalties/technical charges paid out of India** [63]. Furthermore, services such as **transportation, insurance, installation, commissioning, training and after sales service support** like AMC/value addition are also excluded [64, 65].

instruction: What are the two circumstances under which the contract may be terminated with 3 months' advance notice, without financial implication to HAL?
output: The contract may be terminated if: a) there is **unsatisfactory performance** by the vendor, or if information provided is found to be untrue, or if the supplier attempts to influence persons through unethical means [22.a, 22]; or b) if there is a **change in the Customer requirement** [22.b, 22].

instruction: What is the minimum required man-hour rate that the vendor may be asked to submit to HAL?
output: If required, the vendor will be asked to submit **average man hour rate separately** or any other relevant information [66].

instruction: What specific rule must LPSC contractors follow regarding the warranty period and replacement stores?
output: The Contractor shall remedy defects discovered within **12 months** of acceptance [11.b, 378]. Furthermore, **all replacement stores shall also be guaranteed for a period of 12 months** from the date of arrival of the replacement stores at the purchaser's site [11.f, 426, 381].

instruction: What is the consequence if the rejected items are not lifted by the firm within 48 hours for the LRDE (Ration Item) bid?
output: Demurrage charges at the rate of **0.5% of total contract value will be charged per day**. If the items are not lifted within a month, the same will be **destroyed by the station board of officers, and no claim will be admitted** [67, 68].

instruction: What is the mandatory warranty period for the services supplied under the DRDO DEAL tender (GeM/2025/B/7706580)?
output: The required warranty period for the services is **6 Months** [69].

instruction: What must the bidder declare in the Non-Disclosure Declaration Certificate (NDDC) for the LRDE bid?
output: The bidder must declare that they **shall not disclose the contract or any provision, specification, plan, design, pattern, sample or information thereof to any third party during and after expiry of Contract** [55, 70].

instruction: What is HAL's policy on granting MSE/Startup exemptions for Experience and Turnover criteria for the HILS Test Facility bid?
output: The bidder shall be **exempted from the requirement of 'Bidder Turnover' criteria and 'Experience Criteria'** subject to meeting quality and technical specifications, if they are an MSE or a Startup [38, 71-73].

instruction: What documents must be provided with the supply of Raw materials (bar, sheet, wires etc.) to HAL?
output: For Raw materials (in forms of bar, sheet, wires etc.), the supplier must provide **Release note/ OEM certificate of conformity with physical and chemical test report** along with the supply [1, 2].

instruction: What is the consequence if the bidder makes an incomplete statement regarding previous transgressions of anti-corruption approach?
output: If the Bidder(s)/Seller(s) makes an incorrect statement on this subject (Previous Transgression), the Bidder(s)/Seller(s) can be **disqualified from the tender process** or the contract, if already awarded, can be **terminated** for such reason without any liability whatsoever on the Buyer [3].

instruction: What is the mandatory period for the validity of the Integrity Pact (IP) for successful bidders and for unsuccessful bidders?
output: For the **successful Bidder**, the IP shall survive up to **12 months from making the last payment** [4]. For all other **unsuccessful Bidders**, the validity of the IP shall remain up to **six months from the declaration of the unsuccessful Bidder** [4].

instruction: What specific security information must be returned or destroyed by the vendor upon termination of the contract?
output: The vendor must return **All the materials supplied by HAL** (except completed deliveries), **All other assets supplied by HAL or completed by the vendor using HAL funds**, **All documents (soft and hard copies) supplied by HAL**, and ensure that **All spare copies of documents, soft copies in vendor IT system are permanently erased/destroyed** [5].

instruction: What are the restrictions on the Receiving Party (vendor) regarding copying Proprietary Information disclosed under the NDA?
output: The Proprietary Information shall **neither be copied nor otherwise reproduced nor duplicated, in whole or in part**, other than for the purpose of the Agreement, where such copying has been specifically authorized in writing by the Disclosing Party [6].

instruction: What is the procedure for a bidder who already holds a valid Omnibus Integrity Pact with a different HAL Division?
output: In case the Bidder has already signed Omnibus IP with any Division of HAL and the same is still valid, then a **copy of the same can be submitted** instead of signing a fresh Integrity Pact [7].

instruction: What mandatory information regarding the firm's legal status must be provided in the EOI response forms?
output: The EOI response must include the **Company/Organization Status** (PSU / Proprietary/MSME/ Partnership / Private Ltd., etc.) with **Name and Address of Proprietor, Partners, Board of Directors** etc. [8].

instruction: What is the mandatory action a vendor must take if they decide not to submit a bid for the IMRH/DBMRH RFQ?
output: The Vendor should **return all the documents and data supplied by HAL** (if any) in reference to this RFQ [9-11].

instruction: What is the rule regarding the use of Mirrored parts in 3D CAD modeling practices?
output: The use of the **Assembly mirror option for mirror part** or **mirror body option is not acceptable** [12-14]. Models must be made for both Left Hand (LH) and Right Hand (RH) parts separately with parameters, ensuring no connectivity between them [14-16].

instruction: What is the consequence if a bidder fails to adhere to the explicit Bid Offer Validity period mandated in the GeM bid document?
output: The **BID OFFER VALIDITY PERIOD INDICATED IN BID DOCUMENT** must be adhered to, as the validity period mentioned in the bidder's respective quote **will not be considered** [17].

instruction: What is the strict mandatory procedure for handling pricing information within the technical bid submission for GeM tenders?
output: Bidders must ensure that **no pricing aspect is indicated in the technical bid even in the form of PDF**, else the offer will get **summarily rejected** [18-21].

instruction: What is the mandatory IPR requirement regarding computer software generated during the IMRH/DBMRH project?
output: Intellectual Property includes **computer software**, specifically: **source code, object code, source code listings and object code listings that would enable the software to be reproduced or recreated** [22].

instruction: How long after the contract signing date must the contractor be able to guarantee the availability of spare parts?
output: The Contractor shall guarantee the **availability of spare parts for at least 7 years** from the date of acceptance of the stores [23].

instruction: What is the minimum lead time criteria used if multiple bidders quote the same consolidated cost for the BEL RFx?
output: If more than one bid is found with the same price, **least lead-time** shall be taken as the criteria for arriving at the successful L1 bidder [24].

instruction: What assurance must the Service Provider give regarding the statutory liabilities of deployed personnel?
output: The Service provider must pay salary to its employees as per government norms and contribute towards **PF, ESI, insurance policy and any other statutory requirement** [25]. HAL shall **not in any manner be liable** for these statutory liabilities [25].

instruction: What specific consequence follows if any employee positioned at the HAL site is found unsatisfactory in performance or compliance?
output: HAL reserves the right to **send back the Employee** with suitable replacement by the Engineering Service Provider [26-28].

instruction: What happens if a bidder, initially compliant with the Integrity Pact, later deviates from the specified format?
output: Bidders who submit IP with deviation might at HALs discretion be given an opportunity to **submit original signed IP without deviation within a stipulated time limit** as decided by HAL [29].

instruction: What is the strict rule regarding the editing of master surfaces and adjoining system equipment in CAD files?
output: **Master geometry surfaces are not to be edited** [30-33]. Adjoining system equipment and its parts like cables, tubes etc. are also **not to be edited**; any updates will be communicated by HAL [30-32, 34].

instruction: What must the bidder submit if the evaluation method for the tender is Total Value Wise Evaluation?
output: If the evaluation method is 'Total value wise evaluation', the bidder must submit the **Price Bid Format** [35].

instruction: What is the minimum required shelf life confirmation for rubber items such as seals, against the date of manufacture?
output: In respect of rubber items such as seals etc., having a care date, the item should **not have been manufactured earlier than 6 months of dispatch** [2].

instruction: What are the two major contractual rights HAL reserves without providing any reason?
output: HAL reserves the right to **reject any or all the bids received from vendor(s) without assigning any reason whatsoever** [36]. HAL also reserves the right to **foreclose or terminate the contract/purchase order finalized based on this RFQ for reasons attributable to non-compliance of any of its terms** [36].

instruction: What mandatory information is required on the tax invoice submitted by the supplier in GeM contracts?
output: Supplier shall ensure that the **Invoice is raised in the name of Consignee with GSTIN of Consignee only** [37-43].

instruction: What is the mandatory action a bidder must take if they have any objection or grievance against the Buyer Added ATC clauses?
output: The seller must raise their representation against the same by using the **Representation window** provided in the Seller dashboard after logging in as a seller **within 4 days of bid publication on GeM** [44-58].

instruction: What is the penalty rate for delayed delivery in BEL GeM bids, and what is the maximum ceiling?
output: A sum equivalent to **0.5% of the value of materials not supplied in time for every week of delay** or part thereof, subject to a maximum of **10%**, will be deducted [59].

instruction: What specific deliverables of the D5 phase are related to ground test reports?
output: The D5 phase includes the **Preparation of ground test synthesis reports for structural components** (refer ANNEXURE -II) and the **synthesis of ground test reports** [60-62].

instruction: What are the target completion timelines for the IMRH/DBMRH design activities regarding the Drawing Applicability List (DAL) and the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP)?
output: Submission of the DAL for concurrent manufacturing of GTV is required in **22 months**. Submission of the SOP for the prototype is required in **30 months** [63].

instruction: What is the maximum liability cap placed on the Vendor, and what percentage of the Contract Price does it represent?
output: The aggregate liability of the Vendor to HAL shall **not exceed the total or 100% of the Contract Price** [64].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure when using reference sets for components and assemblies in NX CAD?
output: For each 3D CAD geometry of a component, **'Model' and 'Solid' reference sets** must contain only **required bodies**. For each assembly CAD file, **'Assembly', 'Model', and 'Solid' reference sets** must contain **required components and Parasolid bodies** [14-16].

instruction: What specific technical check, if showing unexplained mismatch, can lead to the rejection of a GeM bid?
output: Data Sheet of the product(s) offered must be uploaded, and buyers can match and verify the Data Sheet with the product specifications offered. In case of any **unexplained mismatch of technical parameters, the bid is liable for rejection** [65-67].

instruction: What two circumstances, if resulting from an act by the contractor, subject the contractor to cancellation of the contract and payment of losses under the Indemnity clause?
output: The Vendor shall indemnify HAL against all claims which may be made in respect of stores/services for **infringement of any right protected by patent, registration of design or trade mark**, and shall take risk of **accidents or damage which causes a failure of the supply/services** [68].

instruction: What is the primary evaluation criteria for the BHEL Oil Cooling Unit GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6015505)?
output: The Evaluation Method is **Item wise evaluation** [69].

instruction: What is the mandatory action required by the contractor if they receive a request for supply or repair of deliverables directly from a third party (including HALs customers)?
output: If the supplier receives a requirement/request for supply or repair of deliverables of this contract directly from any third party including HALs customers, such request **shall be forwarded to HAL** [22].

instruction: What is the purpose of the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) between HAL-RWR&DC and the prospective vendor?
output: The purpose is to pursue **exploratory discussions concerning a possible collaboration** relating to the supply of goods/services for **ALH (ADVANCED LIGHT HELICOPTER)** [70].

instruction: What mandatory steps must the bidder take regarding the GST cost in the price quote?
output: The bidder must **check applicable GST on their own before quoting** [65, 71, 72]. GST reimbursement will be as per actuals or as per applicable rates (whichever is lower), subject to the **maximum of quoted GST %** [65, 71, 72].

instruction: What two conditions must be met for a verbal disclosure to be treated as Proprietary Information under the NDA?
output: When disclosed orally, the information must be **identified as proprietary at the time of disclosure**, and must be **promptly (thirty (30) days at the latest) confirmed and designated in writing as Proprietary Information** [73, 74].

instruction: What is the policy regarding the subcontracting of the IMRH/DBMRH work package?
output: The Engineering service provider **shall not subcontract this work package in part or full**. However, the Engineering service provider can engage the third-party services of consultants or consultancy firms, but must take **prior approval** for such engagements from HAL [26].

instruction: What mandatory information must the bidder provide regarding the total quantity being ordered in the tender?
output: Tenderers should clearly mention whether the prices hold good when the full quantity of enquiry is not ordered but only a part of it. If this is not mentioned, it is assumed that **rates hold good even when lesser quantities** are ordered [75].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the material density selected during CAD modeling?
output: The bidder must **Check for the correct material/Density** selected for modeling  as per the Material specification [13, 76].

instruction: What is the mandatory deadline for vendors to submit clarification requests and participation details for the URSC IMPP Pre-EOI Meeting?
output: The last date of submission of clarification/queries & participation details for the Pre-EOI-Meeting is **31st December 2024; 16:00 Hrs. IST** [1].

instruction: What are the two specific dates and times for the submission and opening of the URSC IMPP EOI response?
output: The Last date for submission of response to EoI is **30th January 2025 16:00 Hrs. IST**. The Opening date of EoI is **31st January 2025 10:00 Hrs IST** [2].

instruction: What must the vendor ensure regarding mass and dimensions during the Configuration Phase (Phase 1) of the URSC IMPP development?
output: During the Configuration phase, the vendor needs to carry out initial assessments of package, card level dimensions, PCB design, and Mechanical housing design to ensure that the **mass and dimensions are met** [3].

instruction: What mandatory clearance is required after the Design and Analysis phase (Phase 2) is completed?
output: A joint Detailed Design Review (DDR) is mandatory to hold after the analysis is complete, as **DDR clearance is a mandatory requirement to continue for further activities** [4].

instruction: List four mandatory circuit- level analyses required for reliability prediction of the IMPP system.
output: The required circuit-level analyses include: **Failure Mode Effect and Criticality Analysis (FMECA)**, **Worst Case Circuit Analysis (WCCA)**, **Monte-carlo analysis**, and **De-rating analysis (DA)** [5, 6].

instruction: List three specific documents the vendor must deliver in hard and soft copy format during the Realization/Testing phase (Phase 3).
output: The vendor must deliver: **Fabrication / assembly folders for cards/ packages and inspection reports** (both hard and soft form), **Card Level Test Results**, and **Initial bench test results** [7].

instruction: What three ISRO-PAS standards are referenced for workmanship, storage/handling, and failure reporting for the IMPP project?
output: The applicable documents/standards include: **ISRO-PAX-300** (Workmanship Standards for Fabrication), **ISRO-PAS-207** (Storage, Handling and Transportation requirements), and **ISRO-PAS-201** (Failure Reporting, Analysis and Corrective Action system) [8].

instruction: What is the consequence if a vendor fails to sign the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) for the HAL Airframe Design RFQ?
output: The vendors who will **not sign the NDA would not be considered for tender evaluation** [9].

instruction: What are the four desired First Time Right (FTR) quality targets set for D2, D3, and D4 deliverables in the Airframe Design RFQ?
output: The desirable FTR quality targets are: **3D Design Layouts (D2): > 85%**; **FE Modeling and Analysis (D3): > 98%**; **Technical content of stress and dynamics reports (D3): > 98%**; and **Part and assembly models and drawings (D4): > 95%** [10, 11].

instruction: What are the four major delivery milestones (D1 through D5) for the IMRH/DBMRH Airframe Work Package?
output: The milestones are: **D1 (Requirement Capture and Methodology)**, **D2 & D3 (Detail Layout and Analysis)**, **D4 (Detailed CAD Models + MBD + DWG)**, and **D5 (Engineering Change Management)** [12-14].

instruction: What is the mandatory acceptance authority for all deliverables, and how is payment linked?
output: The Project Technical Monitoring Committee (**PTMC**) reviews and accepts the deliverables [15-18]. The deliverable is deemed complete only after **PTMC accepts the same**, and **Payment shall be linked to successful completion of delivery milestones** [15, 16, 18].

instruction: What is the timeframe for the completion of the D1 milestone for all five IMRH Airframe modules?
output: Milestone 1 (D1: Requirement Capture and Methodology) is scheduled for **T0 + 2 months** for all five modules (Front Fuselage, Centre Fuselage, Tail Boom & Empennage, Weapon Stub Wing, and Cowlings & Firewalls) [13].

instruction: What is the complexity distribution envisaged for CAD Layouts (D2) classified as Simple, Medium, and Complex?
output: The complexity level of CAD Layouts (D2) is envisaged in the order of **20% (Simple), 60% (Medium) and 20% (Complex)** [19].

instruction: What type of document is required for the Deliverable 'Drawing Release Notice (DRN)'?
output: The required delivery format for the Drawing Release Notice (DRN) is **NX (.prt) / Teamcenter** [20, 21].

instruction: What file format is required for the Deliverable 'Part Attributes and Applicability info'?
output: The required delivery format for Part Attributes and Applicability info is **Excel (.xlsx) /NX(.prt) / 3D PDF (.pdf)** [21].

instruction: What is the expected delivery timeframe for the CASDIC Dummy LRUs, starting from the placement of the Supply Order (SO)?
output: The job should be completed within **05 months from the placement of supply order (SO)** [22, 23]. Specifically, Delivery of SOF Tested 1st Set post SOF Testing is due at **T0 + 5 months** [23].

instruction: What specific materials are mandated for the fabrication of the Dummy LRU mockups and their hard points?
output: The mockups should be manufactured using **Aluminium Alloy 6061 T6 Condition**. All hard points of the mock up must be manufactured using **SS421 martensitic stainless steel** [22].

instruction: What is the inspection authority for the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: The Qualification/Inspection authority is **Center Head, CASDIC or his representative / DGAQA** [23].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum average annual turnover required for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software EOI?
output: The average annual turnover during the last 3 years, ending 31st March of the previous financial year, should be at least **Rs 15 Crores** [24, 25].

instruction: What is the ownership definition for a company to be considered 'owned by resident Indian citizen' in the NSTL EOI?
output: A company shall be considered as owned by resident Indian citizen, if **more than 50% of capital is directly owned or beneficially owned by resident Indian** [26, 27].

instruction: What two circumstances, if demonstrated by the Receiving Party, exclude an obligation regarding confidential information under the NSTL NDA?
output: No obligation is imposed if the information: (a) is or becomes thereafter available to the public through **no breach of this Agreement**; or (b) is disclosed pursuant to **governmental or judicial order requirement** [28, 29].

instruction: What specific components of the LFBMS prototype system is the Industry Partner responsible for developing?
output: The Industry Partner is responsible for development of the **Underwater Junction Box**, **Array Structure**, **Display Console & Processing System**, **Workstation Console & Processing System**, and **Portable Control Console** [30, 31].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum average annual turnover and experience required for the HILS Test Facility Custom Bid for Services (GEM/2025/B/6013766)?
output: The Minimum Average Annual Turnover is **169 Lakh(s)** and **3 Years** of Past Experience is Required for the same/similar service [32].

instruction: What is the required Bid Offer Validity period for the BHEL Cable Assembly GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6263867)?
output: The Bid Offer Validity is **180 Days** [33].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date and Bid Opening Date for the BEL Cold Plate RFx 7000518395?
output: The Submission period ends on **01.04.2025 23:00:00**. The Opening date is **02.04.2025 08:00:00** [34].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the GeM Electric Fork Lift tender (GEM/2025/B/6822972)?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **3** [35].

instruction: What is the specific material and test condition required for the protective treatment of the external surfaces of the Dummy LRUs?
output: External surfaces are to be painted as per **Poly urethane paint  DTD 5580 or MIL-C-85285** [22].

instruction: What is the purpose of the PTMC (Project Technical Monitoring Committee) in the IMRH/DBMRH project?
output: The PTMC reviews the deliverables, ensures their correctness and completeness, and their acceptance is mandatory for deeming the deliverable complete and linking payment [15, 16, 18, 36].

instruction: What must the Receiving Party ensure if Confidential Information is disclosed orally under the NSTL NDA?
output: The information must be **slated to be confidential at the time of disclosure** and the Receiving Party must treat it with **reasonable care** [28, 29, 37, 38].

instruction: What four types of documents concerning the legal status of the firm must be uploaded for the HAL Civil Works tender NCP/44/25-26?
output: The documents required are: **Constitution and legal status** along with Deeds / Articles and Memorandum of Association; **Power of Attorney** (if applicable); **Registration with HAL / Other organization** (if any); and **Copy of PAN card** issued by Income tax authority [39].

instruction: What is the policy regarding EMD exemption for MSME/NSIC agencies participating in the HAL Civil Works tenders (NCP/58/25-26 and NCP/74/25-26)?
output: Agencies registered with **MSME / NSIC / MSEs ARE NOT EXEMPTED** from the payment of EMD and shall have to pay EMD [40, 41].

instruction: What are the total quantities requested for Schedule 14 (NAS 1921 C04-S03) and Schedule 2 (NAS 1919 C04-S03) in the NAS Blind Rivets GeM bid?
output: The quantity for Schedule 14 (NAS 1921 C04-S03) is **40000** [42]. The quantity for Schedule 2 (NAS 1919 C04-S03) is **20000** [43].

instruction: What is the required delivery time for all schedules in the NAS Blind Rivets GeM bid?
output: The required Delivery Days for all item/consignee combinations listed in the schedules is **270 days** [44-61].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date and Bid Opening Date for the BEL Cable Looms GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6263867)?
output: The Bid End Date/Time is **03-06-2025 09:00:00**. The Bid Opening Date/Time is **03-06-2025 09:30:00** [33].

instruction: What must the Receiving Party do immediately if Proprietary Information disclosed under the NDA is already known to them?
output: The Receiving Party will **bring such fact to the attention of the Disclosing Party immediately upon the disclosure** [62].

instruction: What is the required payment percentage for Milestone 1 and Milestone 2 combined for the CABS IEWS and MIMAS software development contracts?
output: Milestone 1 accounts for **50% of the Total Cost** and Milestone 2 accounts for **50% of the Total Cost**, resulting in a **100% cumulative cost** after Milestone 2 [63, 64].

instruction: What is the specific requirement for the technical bid submission for the Supply and Commissioning Hand Held Portable Self-positioning Non-contact 3D Scanner System (GEM/2025/B/6885395)?
output: The seller must upload the 'LIST OF OEM RECOMMENDED SPARES FOR TROUBLEFREE MAINTENANCE - SHOULD BE UPLOADED AS PART OF PRICE BID' in Excel format [65].

instruction: What is the penalty rule applied for delayed output (deliverables) in the IMRH/DBMRH work packages?
output: Delay in output (deliverables) beyond the reasons mentioned in the document would be **subject to penalty clause as per the commercial contract** [66, 67].

instruction: What specific item category is listed for the GeM bid GEM/2025/B/6823074?
output: The Item Category is **Digital Harness Assembly Board** [68].

instruction: What is the mandatory requirement for the technical bid documentation in the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: The bidder must submit the **Stress analysis of the dummy LRUs** for the loading conditions specified in the SOF test requirements and the **Material Test Report** [69].

instruction: What are the submission and opening dates for the BEL RFx 7000569182?
What are the three essential components (D1, D2 & D3, D4) of the technical specification for the Airframe Design RFQ listed under the Technical section?
output: The essential technical components are: **RC/DBMRH/STR/TS/001A M1-1 REQUIREMENT CAPTURING D1**, **RC/DBMRH/STR/TS/001A M2-1 LAYOUT AND ANALYSIS D2 & D3**, and **RC/DBMRH/STR/TS/001A M3-1 DETAIL DESIGN AND DWG D4** [12].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the structure weight targets specified during the D1 phase for the DBMRH project?
output: The **structure weight targets of parts and assemblies specified during D1 phase to be met**. Proposals for further reduction in weight using best optimisation practices are encouraged [71].

instruction: What must HAL do regarding inputs that are delayed beyond one week?
output: Any delay in providing inputs by HAL because of technical/non-technical reasons **beyond a week time and causing the halt of design process is to be recorded and duly coordinated by both agencies** to review the matter for meeting the time schedules [16, 18].

instruction: What is the estimated percentage of design iterations expected during the D4 phase relative to D2 and D3 deliverables?
output: Design iterations / new inputs envisaged during the D4 phase are estimated to be in an order of approximately **up to 50% with respect to D2 and D3 deliverables** [72].

instruction: What specific activity related to design verification must be completed before the Critical Design Review (CDR) to enable the release of part drawings?
output: Review of the **Interface Clearance arrangement Layout** is mandatory and must be completed before **CDR** to facilitate the release of part drawings after CDR [73].

instruction: What is the mandatory deadline relative to the Pre-bid meeting for vendors to sign the NDA for the HAL Airframe Design RFQ?
output: Vendors are encouraged to sign the NDA at the earliest, but **01 week** would be given from the date of the Pre-bid meeting to sign the NDA [1]. Detailed technical specifications will only be provided after the NDA is signed [1].

instruction: What is the consequence if a vendor fails to sign the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) for the HAL Airframe Design RFQ?
output: The vendors who **will not sign the NDA would not be considered for tender evaluation** [1].

instruction: What is the total approximate number of drawings expected to be released under the duration of the IMRH/DBMRH work package?
output: Approximately **14000 drawings** are expected to be released in the total duration of **52 months** under **each package** [2].

instruction: How will the final order placement be determined regarding the expected number of drawings?
output: The order would be placed based on the **work package (D1 to D5)**, not on the actual release of the drawing count, although the final figure of drawings may vary [2].

instruction: What is the purpose and required format for the 'Light Weight representation of CAD Model' deliverable?
output: The Light Weight representation of the CAD Model must be created in **NX (.jt) format** and must include **Bounding Box information** stored under the same dataset [3-6].

instruction: What mandatory components must 2D drawings cover, in addition to dimensions and tolerances?
output: The 2D drawings must cover **sealant requirements**, **suitable notes** (including material process and finish), **part markings**, **weight**, **EBOM** (Engineering Bill of Material), and **curing cycle** [3, 7].

instruction: What are the specific FTR (First Time Right) quality targets for the D3 phase deliverables?
output: The desirable FTR quality targets for D3 are **> 98%** for **FE Modeling and Analysis** and **> 98%** for **Technical content of stress and dynamics reports** [8-10].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the part and assembly numbering system?
output: The Assembly and part Numbering must be assigned in the assembly hierarchy **as per the ATA numbering system provided by HAL** [11, 12].

instruction: What three types of checks must be performed on fasteners within an assembly?
output: All fasteners called in the assembly are to be verified for **inter-rivet pitch**, **edge distances**, **head clearance**, **head placement** (outer or inner), **type, material, and grip length** as per the compendium provided by HAL [11].

instruction: What is the mandatory requirement for composite skins modeling?
output: All composite skins are to be created using the **Modeling module of NX** for **ply wise modelling** and **creation of ply-book** [11, 12].

instruction: What are the mandatory formats for the Bill of Material (Material Schedule) deliverable?
output: The Bill of Material / material schedule must be provided in **Excel (.xlsx) format** and can also be delivered in **NX (.prt) / 3D PDF (.pdf)** format [4-6].

instruction: What is the consequence if any delay in providing inputs by HAL causes a halt in the design process?
output: The delay is to be **recorded and duly coordinated by both agencies** to review the matter for meeting the time schedules [13]. Delays affecting time schedule, cost, and grey areas will be referred to the **Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)** [13].

instruction: What is the maximum delay duration for which HAL input delay is acceptable without requiring formal recording?
output: Any delay in providing inputs by HAL... **beyond a week time** and causing the halt of the design process is to be recorded and duly coordinated [13].

instruction: What is the required format for the Deliverable 'Weight & CG report with station wise weight distribution'?
output: The Weight & CG report must be created in **Word Document (.docx) / NX(.prt)** format [4, 14, 15].

instruction: How must the Engineering Service Provider address the 50% estimate of design iterations expected during the D2 & D3 phases?
output: The Engineering service provider should **cater for amending the deliverables as part of D2 & D3** in response to the estimated 50% changes/new inputs envisaged during this phase [14-16].

instruction: What is the duration of the Integrity Pact (IP) for an unsuccessful bidder?
output: The Integrity Pact expires for all unsuccessful Bidder(s)/Seller(s) **within 6 months from date of placement of order / finalization of contract** [17, 18].

instruction: What is the duration of the Integrity Pact (IP) for a successful bidder?
output: The Integrity Pact expires for the successful Bidder(s)/Seller(s) **12 months after the last payment** under the contract [17, 18].

instruction: What mechanism ensures the validity of the Integrity Pact if the underlying contract is extended or renewed?
output: If the Contract/Agreement covered under this Omnibus IP is **extended/renewed for any period, then this Omnibus IP shall also be deemed extended/renewed** for such period of extension/renewal [18].

instruction: What are the required deliverables for the D5 milestone that account for the final 40% payment?
output: The final 40% of D5 payment (14th Payment) is for the **Completion of SOP (Standard Of Preparation) and other deliverables as mentioned in technical requirement (Enclosure V and VI) at the end of 52 months** [19].

instruction: What mandatory documentation related to bank details must be provided by the vendor?
output: The vendor must provide the **Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) Mandate Form** (Annexure-1) details, including the Bank's 9-Digit code number [20], and details of ECS viz., Name of Bank, MICR No, Branch, Account No. where payments are to be credited along with the **scan copy of Blank Cheque leaf** [21-23].

instruction: What is the default term of the NDA agreement for the NSTL EOI, and what sections survive this period?
output: The Term of the NSTL NDA agreement is **Five (5) years from the Effective Date** [24], however, Sections 5, 6, 8 and 11 thereof shall survive even after expiration or termination [24].

instruction: What type of information is excluded from the definition of Confidential Information in the NSTL NDA?
output: Information is not considered Confidential Information if its nature makes it **obvious that it is confidential** [25]. The definition of Confidential Information includes design, fabrication, assembly drawings, know-how, processes, product specifications, raw materials, product samples, inventions, concepts, and computer programs [25, 26].

instruction: What is the mandatory dispute resolution method for disagreements arising from the execution of the NSTL NDA?
output: Difference of opinion concerning the execution of responsibilities will be settled by mutual consultation. If unresolved, the dispute shall be referred for **Arbitration** [24].

instruction: What is the mandatory dispute resolution method for disagreements arising from the execution of the HAL Airframe Design NDA?
output: Any dispute concerning the interpretation or execution of the HAL NDA, unresolved within three months of the scheduled mandatory meeting, shall be finally settled by arbitration in accordance with the **Rules of Arbitration of the Indian Council of Arbitration** [27].

instruction: What is the mandatory IPR statement in the NSTL EOI regarding the prediction software?
output: The Intellectual Property (IP) Rights of the Infrared Signature Prediction Software will be **jointly with Industry partner and NSTL, DRDO** [28, 29]. Moreover, the Industry partner cannot use the software without the concurrence of DRDO [28, 29].

instruction: What specific components of the LFBMS prototype system is the Industry Partner responsible for developing?
output: The Industry Partner is responsible for developing the **Underwater Junction Box**, **Array Structure**, **Display Console & Processing System**, **Workstation Console & Processing System**, and **Portable Control Console** [30, 31].

instruction: What key activities must the LSI perform during the development phase, including installation and maintenance, for the LFBMS prototype?
output: The LSI is responsible for **complete system integration** (including NPOL subsystems), **installation on naval platform**, and its **life-cycle maintenance till completion of Sea Trials** for the prototype system [32].

instruction: What is the minimum required man-hour rate that the vendor may be asked to submit for the IMRH/DBMRH RFQ?
output: If required, the vendor will be asked to submit **average man hour rate separately** or any other relevant information [33].

instruction: What mandatory quality check must be performed on the 3D CAD models using the NX softwares 'Edit-FeaturePlayback Option'?
output: The bidder must run the 'Edit-FeaturePlayback Option' to know the **update failure of features of the part file** [3].

instruction: What must the bidder submit if they are seeking exemption from Experience or Turnover Criteria in GeM bids?
output: The supporting documents to prove his eligibility for exemption must be **uploaded for evaluation by the buyer** [34-45].

instruction: What is the primary evaluation method for the HILS Test Facility bid (GEM/2025/B/6013766)?
output: The Evaluation Method is **Total value wise evaluation** [46].

instruction: What is the minimum required quantity of Cold Plate - S HPA (Material No. 118900005832) for BEL RFx 7000518395?
output: The required quantity is **9 NO** [47].

instruction: What are the EMD Amount and ePBG Percentage for the DEAL Software Development GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6104408)?
output: The EMD Amount is **750000 INR**. The ePBG Percentage is **5.00%** [48].

instruction: What is the mandatory period for the warranty and post-warranty AMC for the Digital Harness Assembly Board (GEM/2025/B/6823074)?
output: The Warranty of the required product is **1 Year**. The Annual Maintenance Charges Duration (Post Warranty) is **5 Year**, with a Quarterly frequency [49].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date and Bid Opening Date for the HAL Tractor GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6815340)?
output: The Bid End Date/Time is **13-11-2025 13:00:00**. The Bid Opening Date/Time is **13-11-2025 13:30:00** [50].

instruction: What are the two mandatory categories the NSTL Industry Partner qualification criteria are based upon?
output: The qualification criteria are categorized into four areas: **Financial, Technical, Manufacturing, and Management** [51, 52].

instruction: What is the required average annual turnover for the HILS Test Facility bid (GEM/2025/B/6013766)?
output: The Minimum Average Annual Turnover of the bidder (For 3 Years) must be **169 Lakh(s)** [53].

instruction: What is the required delivery time for the HAL Sealant Mixing Machine (GEM/2025/B/6817036)?
output: The required Delivery Days for the 2 units in BANGALORE CITY are **84 days** [54].

instruction: What is the minimum number of bids required to disable the automatic extension of the bid end date for the HAL Sealant Mixing Machine tender?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **2** [55].

instruction: Under the NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement), list four circumstances where the Receiving Party has no obligation or restriction regarding Proprietary Information.
output: No obligation exists if the Proprietary Information: a) Has come into the **public domain** prior to or after the disclosure thereof, and **through no wrongful act of the Receiving Party** [1]; b) Is **already known** to the Receiving Party, provided there is **written documentation** and **immediate notification** to the Disclosing Party [2]; c) Has been **lawfully received from a third party** without restrictions [2]; or d) Has been **independently developed** in good faith by employees who did not have access to the information [2].

instruction: What documents must be returned or destroyed by the Receiving Party upon request by the Disclosing Party, as per the NDA terms?
output: The Receiving Party shall return to the Disclosing Party, or certify the destruction of, **all copies** of the First Party's confidential information upon written request of the First Party [1, 3].

instruction: What are the four specific categories of FTR (First Time Right) quality targets set for IMRH/DBMRH deliverables?
output: The desirable FTR quality targets are: **3D Design Layouts (D2): > 85%**; **FE Modeling and Analysis (D3): > 98%**; **Technical content of stress and dynamics reports (D3): > 98%**; and **Part and assembly models and drawings (D4): > 95%** [4, 5].

instruction: What is the acronym for the committee that reviews the deliverables and accepts the completion of work, and what is its role in payment?
output: The committee is the **Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)** [6, 7]. The deliverable is deemed to be complete only after **PTMC accepts the same**, and **payment shall be linked to successful completion of delivery milestones** [8-10].

instruction: List five mandatory documents or deliverables that must be provided in NX (.prt) file format.
output: The deliverables mandated in NX (.prt) format include: **Drawing Release Notice (DRN)** [11, 12]; **Deviation slip/Project Slip (PS) / Deviation notes** [11]; **2D Development of Sheet Metal parts** [12]; **Tolerance Stack up Analysis reports** [12]; and **Weight and CG report with station wise weight distribution** [12].

instruction: What are the required delivery formats for the Deliverables 'Part Attributes and Applicability info' and 'Light Weight representation of CAD Model'?
output: Part Attributes and Applicability info can be delivered in **Excel (.xlsx) / NX(.prt) / 3D PDF (.pdf)** format [12]. The Light Weight representation of CAD Model is to be delivered in **NX (.jt) format** [12].

instruction: What is the mandatory action required by the vendor to obtain detailed technical specifications for the HAL Airframe Design RFQ?
output: Detailed technical specification to the interested vendors will be provided **after signing of NDA only** [13]. Vendors are encouraged to sign the NDA at the earliest, with **01 week** given from the date of the Pre-bid meeting to sign the NDA [13].

instruction: What specific methodologies are required in the D1 deliverable (Preliminary Analysis and Methodology Documents) for the IMRH airframe?
output: D1 must include the **Methodology of FE modelling for stress analysis** of full airframe and detailed airframe modules, the **Estimation methodology for structural component loads** from FEM analysis, **Methodology for F&DT analysis**, and **Methodology of Drawing and Model Making** [14].

instruction: What are the four categories of issues managed during the Engineering Change Management (D5) phase?
output: The D5 phase is defined as supporting execution knowledge and updating documents for issues classified as resolution for: (i) **Design Change Requests (DCR)**; (ii) **Production Queries (PQ) & Shop Queries (SQ)**; (iii) **Snags**; and (iv) **Material Substitution Requests (MSR)** [15, 16].

instruction: What is the consequence if a delay in providing inputs by HAL exceeds one week and causes a halt in the design process?
output: The delay must be **recorded and duly coordinated by both agencies** to review the matter for meeting the time schedules [9, 17]. Delays affecting time schedule, cost, and grey areas will be referred to the **Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)** [17, 18].

instruction: What are the required protective treatments for the external surfaces and mounting surfaces of the CASDIC Dummy LRU mockups?
output: Protective treatment includes **Chromate conversion as per MIL-STD-5541** [19]. External surfaces are to be painted as per **Poly urethane paint  DTD 5580 or MIL-C-85285** [19]. Mounting surfaces must be **electro less nickel plated as per MIL-STD-26074** [19].

instruction: What is the exact delivery schedule for the CASDIC Dummy LRU deliverables based on the Placement of SO (T0)?
output: The schedule is: Completion of Stress analysis and Readiness of test Documents at **T0 + 1 months**; Readiness of Dummy LRUs at **T0 + 3 months**; and Delivery of SOF Tested 1st Set post SOF Testing at **T0 + 5 months** [20].

instruction: What specific documents are required under Qualification test plan (QTP) and Acceptance Test Plan (ATP) for the CASDIC Dummy LRUs?
output: The documents required are the **SOF Test Plan** and the **SOF Test to be prepared and test to be carried out as per the requirements specified in Annexure-1** [21, 22].

instruction: What two mandatory documents must the Industry Partner submit to NSTL to prove their financial capabilities for the EOI?
output: To prove financial capabilities, the firm must submit **Income tax return copy of past three years which indicates annual turnover of the firm** or **Balance sheet as evidence** [23, 24].

instruction: What documents must the Industry Partner submit to NSTL for the formal issue of the RFP (Request for Proposal)?
output: The documents required are: **Authorization letter from CEO/MD/Director of the firm**; **Duly Signed Industry Partner Information Proforma**; **NDA as per format provided at Appendix C**; and **Duly signed compliance statement** against all evaluation categories with all proof of documents [25].

instruction: What is the mandatory delivery schedule for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software and its accompanying documentation?
output: The deliverables (IR Signature prediction Software along with User Guides, Tutorials, and Software Manuals) must be provided within a delivery schedule of **30 months** [26, 27].

instruction: What is the consequence if the work for the CABS IEWS/MIMAS software development is found unsatisfactory at any milestone?
output: CABS has the right to **terminate the contract** if the work is found unsatisfactory and not meeting the requirements for each milestone. Payment will be made only after submission of a satisfactory completion certificate by the user for each milestone [28, 29].

instruction: What is the payment structure linked to the milestones for the CABS IEWS and MIMAS software development contracts?
output: Payment schedule is on a milestone basis after achieving each milestone of **both work packages (IEWS software and MIMAS software) together**. Milestone 1 accounts for **50% of the Total Cost**, and Milestone 2 accounts for the remaining **50% of the Total Cost** [29, 30].

instruction: What specific responsibility does the LSI bear concerning system integration and installation for the LFBMS prototype?
output: During the development phase, the Industry Partner is responsible for **complete system integration** (including subsystems developed by NPOL), **installation on naval platform**, and its **life-cycle maintenance till completion of Sea Trials** for the prototype system [31, 32].

instruction: What are the specific dates and contact information for the NPOL LFBMS Pre-EOI Meeting?
output: The Pre-EOI meeting is scheduled for **26/09/2025 at 1100 hours** [33]. For permission to attend, vendors may contact Eldho Jacob, Scientist - F (9961714363) or Sudha B Menon, Scientist -G (9847639205) [34].

instruction: What are the two items and their quantities requested in BEL RFx 7000569182?
output: The items requested are **COLD PLATE 1 BRAZED ASSY** (Qty 1 NO) [35] and **COLD PLATE 2 BRAZED ASSY** (Qty 1 NO) [36].

instruction: What is the Bid End Date and Bid Opening Date for BEL RFx 7000518395 (Cold Plate - S HPA)?
output: The Submission period ends on **01.04.2025 23:00:00**. The Opening date is **02.04.2025 08:00:00** [37].

instruction: What is the EOI Reference Number and Date for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software tender?
output: The EOI Ref No is **NSTL/NST-240/IRG/LP-1/2025-26/EOI/05**, dated **17. Sep 2025** [38, 39].

instruction: What is the mandatory duration (in days) allowed for technical clarifications during the evaluation of the BEL Cable Assembly GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6263867)?
output: The time allowed for Technical Clarifications during technical evaluation is **3 Days** [40].

instruction: What specific item categories constitute Schedules 2 through 5 of the BEL Cable Assembly GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6263867)?
output: Schedule 2 is **RF Cable Assy Bnc Male-sma Male L- 1.5m** [41]. Schedule 3 is **Rf Cable Assy Bnc Male-sma Male L- 1m** [41]. Schedule 4 is **Rf Cable Assy Bnc Male-sma Male L- 2m** [41]. Schedule 5 is **Rf Cable Assy Bnc Male-sma Male L- 3 Mtr** [41].

instruction: What specific instruction must the bidder follow when downloading and uploading the Technical/Price Sheet on the HAL e-Procurement Portal?
output: The bidder must click 'Click here to Download Empty Document' to download the sheet, fill it, and **save on the computer without changing the file name**, before clicking 'OK' to upload the filled sheet [42-44].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the HAL Tractor GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6815340)?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **3** [45].

instruction: What are the opening and submission dates for the HAL Nasik Tender NK/FW/CAP-1631/2025-26, following the amendment?
output: The Last date of online submission of Tender is **07.11.2025 up to 13.00 Hrs**, and the Date of opening of tender is **07.11.2025 At 13.30 Hrs** [46].

instruction: What are the required input and output voltages for the Hall Effect Sensor in the BHEL Accumulator?
output: The Hall Effect Sensor requires an **Input Voltage of 5 V DC** and provides an **Output of 0 to 5 V Analog Step output** [47].

instruction: What is the mandatory warranty period for replacement stores supplied under the LPSC contract?
output: All **replacement stores shall also be guaranteed for a period of 12 months** from the date of arrival of the replacement stores at the purchaser's site [321, 322 (Context from previous knowledge on LPSC warranty)].

instruction: What are the two mandatory conditions for a company to be considered 'owned by resident Indian citizen' in the NSTL EOI?
output: A company shall be considered as owned by resident Indian citizen if **more than 50% of capital is directly owned or beneficially owned by resident Indian** [25, 48].

instruction: What is the specific requirement concerning the maintenance of LRU mockups during the SOF testing period?
output: All fasteners needed for the **SOF & ESS testing need to be fabricated by the Industry Partner** [19, 49]. All LRU mockups should be provided with **suitable handles** as provided in the drawing [19, 49].

instruction: What is the strict IPR policy regarding the Infrared Signature Prediction Software (NSTL)?
output: The Intellectual Property (IP) Rights of the software will be **jointly with Industry partner and NSTL, DRDO**. Moreover, the Industry partner **can't use the software without the concurrence of DRDO**. DRDO retains the right to use the IP for its own use in the interest of the Govt. of India [50].

instruction: What document serves as reference for Fabrication Workmanship Standards for the URSC IMPP contract?
output: **ISRO-PAX-300** serves as the reference for Workmanship Standards for the Fabrication of Electronics Packages [51].

instruction: What is the deadline for submission and opening of the URSC IMPP EOI response?
output: The Last date for submission of response to EoI is **30th January 2025 16:00 Hrs. IST** [52]. The Opening date of EoI is **31st January 2025 10:00 Hrs IST** [52].

instruction: What is the final payment (14th Payment) of the Engineering Change Management (D5) phase linked to?
output: The 14th Payment (40% of D5) is linked to the **Completion of SOP (Standard Of Preparation) and other deliverables as mentioned in technical requirement (Enclosure V and VI) at the end of 52 months** [53].

instruction: What are the specific delivery formats required for the Deliverables: Drawing Release Notice (DRN) and Deviation slip/Project Slip (PS) / Deviation notes?
output: The Drawing Release Notice (DRN) [1] and Deviation slip/ Project Slip (PS) / Deviation notes [2] are required in **NX (.prt) / Teamcenter** format [1, 2].

instruction: What are the required delivery formats for the Deliverables: 2D Development of Sheet Metal parts and Tolerance Stack up Analysis reports?
output: Both 2D Development of Sheet Metal parts and Tolerance Stack up Analysis reports are required in **NX (.prt)** format [1, 2].

instruction: What is the acronym for the committee that reviews the deliverables and accepts the completion of work in the Airframe Design RFQ, and where is the definition found?
output: The committee is the **Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC)** [3, 4]. The definition is found in the Technical Requirements document (RC/IMRH/STR/TS/001) [3] and (RC/DBMRH/STR/TS/001) [4].

instruction: What is the consequence if the Engineering Service Provider fails to incorporate the recommendations of the PTMC in the final deliverables?
output: The recommendations of the PTMC must be incorporated in the final version of the deliverables [5, 6]. The deliverable is deemed to be complete **only after PTMC accepts the same** [5, 6].

instruction: What document details the methodology for FE modelling for stress analysis of full airframe and detailed airframe modules (D1)?
output: The 'Methodology of FE modelling for stress analysis of full airframe and detailed airframe modules' is part of the Primary Analysis and Methodology documents (D1), which must be delivered in **Word Document in RWRDC template (.docx)** [7].

instruction: What is the strict rule regarding the NDA, and what technical information is only provided after it is signed?
output: The vendors who **will not sign the NDA would not be considered for tender evaluation** [8]. **Detailed technical specification** to the interested vendors will be provided **after signing of NDA only** [8].

instruction: How are the quality targets for deliverables described in the IMRH/DBMRH RFQ?
output: In order to reduce iterations and improve the quality of deliverables, it is desirable to meet the quality targets for **First Time Right (FTR)** [9, 10].

instruction: What percentage FTR is desired for 3D Design Layouts (D2), and what percentage is desired for Part and assembly models and drawings (D4)?
output: The desirable FTR quality target for **3D Design Layouts (D2)** is **> 85%** [9, 10]. The desirable FTR quality target for **Part and assembly models and drawings (D4)** is **> 95%** [9, 10].

instruction: What specific documents are required under the Qualification Test Plan (QTP) for the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: The documents required are the **SOF Test Plan** [11, 12] and the requirement for the **SOF Test to be prepared and tested** as per the requirements enclosed in Annexure-1 [11, 12].

instruction: What are the protective treatment requirements for the mounting surfaces and external surfaces of the Dummy LRU mockups?
output: The mounting surface must be **electro less nickel plated as per MIL-STD-26074**, and all mounting trays should be **hard anodized as per MIL-STD-8625** [13, 14]. External surfaces are to be painted as per **Poly urethane paint  DTD 5580 or MIL-C-85285** [13, 14].

instruction: What is the basis of acceptance for the items procured in the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: The Basis of acceptance/Acceptance criteria of the item being procured are the **SOF Test Report and Delivery of Items** [15, 16].

instruction: What is the final delivery milestone for the CASDIC Dummy LRUs, and when is it scheduled relative to the Placement of SO (T0)?
output: The final milestone is the **Delivery of SOF Tested 1st Set post SOF Testing**, scheduled for **T0 + 5 months** [15, 16].

instruction: What are the four categories used to evaluate the Industry Partner qualification criteria for the NSTL EOI?
output: The qualification criteria are categorized into four criteria, namely **Financial, Technical, Manufacturing and Management** [17, 18].

instruction: What is the technical knowledge and experience requirement for System Engineering in the NSTL EOI?
output: The firm must be capable to **demonstrate its competence and know-how in development of coding modules, testing, integration into a complete software package, qualification, and technical documentation** [19, 20].

instruction: What is the minimum required annual turnover for the NSTL EOI?
output: The average annual turnover during the last 3 years, ending 31st March of the previous financial year, should be at least **Rs 15 Crores** [19, 20].

instruction: What is the IPR policy for the Infrared Signature Prediction Software (NSTL)?
output: The Intellectual Property (IP) Rights of the software will be **jointly with Industry partner and NSTL, DRDO** [21, 22]. Moreover, the Industry partner **can't use the software without the concurrence of DRDO** [21, 22].

instruction: What modules must the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software be equipped with?
output: The software should be equipped with modules for: **Geometry and Material Definition, Environmental Condition, CFD & Thermal Analysis, Atmospheric Transmission & IR Propagation, Ship & Marine, Validation & Calibration, and Data Management & Output** [23, 24].

instruction: What is the stated term of the NSTL NDA agreement, and what sections survive this period?
output: The term of the NSTL NDA agreement is **Five (5) years from the Effective Date** [25], however, Sections **5 (Confidentiality Period), 6 (Exceptions), 8 (No License) and 11 (Dispute Resolution)** shall survive even after expiration or termination [25].

instruction: What must the Industry Partner do to clarify doubts or the detailed scope of work for the NPOL LFBMS EOI?
output: NPOL will arrange an **EoI Meeting** at NPOL, Kochi on **26/09/2025 at 1100 hours** [26]. The objective is to brief the detailed scope of the work and clarify doubts if any on technical matters [26].

instruction: What must the Industry Partner sign if they attend the NPOL LFBMS EOI Meeting?
output: Industry partner attending the EoI Meeting shall sign a **non-disclosure agreement (NDA)** with NPOL that information pertaining to the proposed work shall not be passed on /shared/ divulged in any form to any other person/agency [27-29].

instruction: What is the IPR status for the NPOL LFBMS project?
output: All **Intellectual Property Rights shall be with NPOL, DRDO** [30].

instruction: What is the delivery commitment for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software?
output: The deliverables, including the IR Signature prediction Software along with User Guides, Tutorials, and Software Manuals, must be provided within a delivery schedule of **30 months** [23, 24].

instruction: What is the purpose of the URSC IMPP EOI, and what is the target output power capability?
output: The purpose is to realize a high power & high voltage power bus capable of handling output power of **10-20 kW** [31, 32]. The EOI invites interest for the development of **Engineering Model (EM) hardware** for the **Integrated Modular Power Packages (IMPP) for 100V BUS** [33, 34].

instruction: What is the core condition for a company to be considered 'owned by resident Indian citizen' for the NSTL EOI?
output: A company shall be considered as owned by resident Indian citizen, if **more than 50% of capital is directly owned or beneficially owned by resident Indian** [17, 18].

instruction: What are the two items and their quantities requested in BEL RFx 7000518395?
output: The item requested is **COLD PLATE - S HPA**, with a quantity of **9 NO** [35].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date and Bid Opening Date for BEL RFx 7000518395?
output: The Submission period ends on **01.04.2025 23:00:00**. The Opening date is **02.04.2025 08:00:00** [36].

instruction: What must the bidder submit information about regarding blacklisting for the NSTL EOI?
output: Industry Partner must submit information pertaining to **blacklisting by any government agency** including blacklisting of **domestic/foreign technology partner** (if any) [17, 18].

instruction: What are the start and end times for the URSC IMPP Pre-EOI meeting?
output: The Pre-EOI meeting is scheduled for **2nd January 2025** from **10:00 to 17:00 Hrs. IST** [37, 38].

instruction: What are the specific delivery timelines for the three milestones of the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: Milestone 1 (Placement of SO) is **T0**; Milestone 2 (Completion of Stress analysis and Readiness of test Documents) is **T0 + 1 months**; and Milestone 3 (Readiness of Dummy LRUs) is **T0 + 3 months** [15, 16].

instruction: What must the Industry Partner submit to prove their knowledge and experience in System Engineering for the NSTL EOI?
output: The compliance must be documented by providing **Previous supply orders copy and/or delivery certificates** pertaining to similar softwares developed which exhibits system engineering experience of the industry [19, 20].

instruction: What specific documents are required to be uploaded in Excel format for the HAL Tractor GeM bid?
output: The bidder must upload the **TECHNICAL COMPLIANCE MATRIX - 1761193293.xlsx** in Excel format [39].

instruction: What are the submission and opening dates for the LRDE Integration & Testing of Processing Software for Ground Test Platform GeM bid?
output: The Bid End Date/Time is **11-07-2025 19:00:00**. The Bid Opening Date/Time is **11-07-2025 19:30:00** [40].

instruction: What is the required EMD Amount for the DEAL Software Development GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6104408)?
output: The EMD Detail is required, with an amount of **750000 INR** [41].

instruction: What specific documents must the bidder submit to ADA to be issued the formal RFP for the NSTL EOI?
output: The Industry Partner must submit: (a) **Authorization letter from CEO/MD/Director of the firm**; (b) Duly Signed **Industry Partner Information Proforma**; (c) **NDA** as per format provided; and (d) Duly signed **compliance statement** against all evaluation categories with proof documents [17, 18].

instruction: What are the three categories of deliverables required for the D4 phase?
output: The D4 phase requires generation of **detailed 3D CAD Models with MBD**, **2D part drawings**, and **DRN, BOM, Loft etc.** [42].

instruction: What specific consequence follows if the Bidder/Seller makes an incorrect statement regarding previous transgressions on the Integrity Pact?
output: If the statement is incorrect, the Bidder(s)/Seller(s) can be **disqualified from the tender process** or the contract, if already awarded, can be **terminated for such reason without any liability whatsoever on the Buyer** [1, 2].

instruction: What is the consequence if the vendor is found to have engaged in corruption or fraudulent practices during the URSC IMPP EOI process?
output: Companies / Firms found to have indulged in any corrupt or fraudulent practices will be **debarred from taking part in the Tendering process** and their EOI document will **not be taken up for consideration** [3].
