instruction: What are the two specific interest rates used to calculate refunds and penalties when Agency Commission is found to have been wrongly paid to agents?
output: The interest rates are **2% per annum above Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR)** (for foreign vendors) and **Marginal Cost of Funds-based Lending Rate (MCLR) of State Bank of India plus 2% per annum** (for Indian vendors) [4-6].

instruction: What is the mandatory period for the validity of the Integrity Pact for unsuccessful bidders?
output: The Integrity Pact expires for all other **unsuccessful Bidder(s)/Seller(s) within 6 months from date of placement of order / finalization of contract** against this tender [7, 8].

instruction: What is the mandatory period for the NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement) for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software?
output: The Confidentiality Period is for the term of the Agreement and **Ten (10) years thereafter** [9, 10].

instruction: What is the mandatory consequence if a bidder's offer is received via Hard copy, E-mail, or Fax, rather than the e-Procurement portal?
output: Offers received in the form of Hard copy (courier/post/dropping in tender box) / E-mail / Fax or any other mode (other than submitting online through HALs e-Procurement portal) will **not be considered and will be rejected** [11].

instruction: What specific penalty is imposed if a bidder fails to comply with the confidentiality requirement by making copies of the Design work being carried out at HAL?
output: The Service Provider shall **not make any attempt** to keep a copy of the Design work or transfer/transmit/copy/print/hand sketch any file/document onto any type of **storage device** [12, 13]. Engineers not complying would be **sent back immediately** and not allowed to work at RWRDC [14].

instruction: What are the three essential reference sets that must be created for each assembly CAD file?
output: For each assembly CAD file, **Assembly, Model, and Solid reference sets** (containing required components and Parasolid bodies) must be created for ease of assembly [15].

instruction: What specific check must the CAD model undergo using the NX software's 'Analysis-Examine Geometry' feature?
output: The model must undergo an 'Analysis-Examine Geometry' check to confirm the absence of **tiny/misaligned objects, intersections/sheet boundaries/tolerances** [16-18].

instruction: What must the Engineering Service Provider ensure regarding the material density selected for CAD modeling?
output: The Service Provider must **Check for the correct material/Density** selected for modeling  as per the Material specification [17, 18].

instruction: What are the two mandatory conditions for a verbal disclosure to be recognized as Proprietary Information under the NDA?
output: When disclosed orally, the information must be **identified as proprietary at the time of disclosure** and subsequently **promptly (thirty (30) days at the latest) confirmed and designated in writing as Proprietary Information** [19-21].

instruction: What must the Bidder ensure about all prices and values specified in the Price Format?
output: It should be ensured that all prices/values payable are specified in the Price Format. **No subsequent addition/alteration/claim will be entertained over and above the quote** [22].

instruction: What is the IPR requirement for computer software supplied under the contract?
output: Intellectual Property includes **computer software**, specifically: **source code, object code, source code listings and object code listings** that would enable the software to be reproduced or recreated [23].

instruction: What is HAL's policy on Income Tax deduction for payments made to the vendor?
output: HAL would be **deducting at source applicable Income Tax as per Government of India Rules** (Generally on amounts towards Services like training, technical assistance, or license fees). The Income Tax has to be **borne by the recipient** of the Income [11].

instruction: What are the two primary penalties HAL can impose if the contractor violates the Bribes and Gifts clause?
output: The contractor is subject to the **cancellation of this and all other contracts with HAL** and also to **payment of any loss or damage resulting from any such cancellation** [24, 25].

instruction: What three types of losses are excluded from the Limitation of Liability clause, meaning the vendor's liability is uncapped for these losses?
output: The 100% liability cap does not apply to: 1) cases of **criminal negligence or wilful misconduct**; 2) the **cost of repairing or replacing defective equipment**; or 3) any obligation of the Vendor to indemnify HAL concerning **IPR infringement** [26].

instruction: What is the mandatory action required if a supplier receives a request for supply or repair of deliverables directly from a third party, including HALs customers?
output: Such request **shall be forwarded to HAL** [23].

instruction: What specific action must the bidder take regarding the Integrity Pact if they choose to use a Joint Venture (JV) or sub-contractors?
output: In case of a Joint Venture, **all the Partners of the Joint Venture should sign** the Integrity Pact [27, 28]. In case of sub-contracting, the Principal Contractor shall be **solely responsible** for adherence to the provisions by its sub-contractor(s) [5, 27].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the legal documentation and physical submission of the Integrity Pact?
output: The Bidder shall submit the duly signed Integrity Pact in original, **strictly as per the format (without any deviation)** [29, 30]. The original signed IP should be forwarded to **HAL only** (not the IEM), addressed to the Deputy General Manager (OS)-RC, RWRDC [11, 31].

instruction: What is HAL's policy concerning the use of the 'Wave linking concept' and Reference sets for referenced bodies in CAD assemblies?
output: The 'Wave linking concept' is to be used for Referenced bodies, but it should be **excluded from the Reference set** for the purpose of reducing the file size loading time of Assemblies [32, 33].

instruction: What must the Engineering Service Provider ensure about the staff retention during the contract period?
output: The Engineering service Provider shall have a HR Policy to **retain the deputed Engineers for the said CONTRACT period**, as attrition results in inordinate delays in delivery schedule [34, 35].

instruction: What must the bidder do if they observe that the prices quoted exceed the lowest price they sell or offer to sell to any government entity?
output: Vendor shall **forthwith notify such reduction/sales or offer to sale to HAL**, and the price payable in the order for subsequent supplies shall **stand correspondingly reduced** [36, 37].

instruction: What document serves as the reference for Storage, Handling, and Transportation requirements for Electronics hardware in the URSC IMPP EOI?
output: **ISRO-PAS-207** serves as the reference document for Storage, Handling and Transportation requirements for Electronics hardware [38].

instruction: What are the two specific tests required for a PCB assembly that utilizes COTS components, in addition to the Burn-in Test?
output: The test procedure requires **Visual Examination** and **Thermal Shock Test** [39, 40]. (The Thermal Shock requires 10 cycles, 30 mins period of exposure, -40C to +85C transfer) [40, 41].

instruction: What is the mandatory duration and temperature condition for the Burn-in Test on the populated PCB assembly?
output: The PCB shall be maintained at the maximum rated operating temperature (**55C** with +5C/-0C tolerance) continuously for **48 hours in power ON condition** [41].

instruction: What are the three consequences if the supplier becomes bankrupt or insolvent during the contract period?
output: If the vendor enters into liquidation or becomes insolvent, HAL has the right to: 1) **terminate the unexecuted part of the Contract** [36]; 2) demand **refund of all advance payments** received for unfulfilled obligations [36]; and 3) terminate the contract with **3 months' advance notice** [42].

instruction: What must the supplier provide if they propose using a sub-contractor for any activity under the RFI for the Oil Cooling System?
output: The supplier has to provide its **subcontractors detail for source** if any of the activity is done at the sub-contractors place. However, **responsibility lies with the principal vendor** [43].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure when submitting their technical specification or datasheet in response to a BEL RFQ?
output: The bidders **shall not copy BEL specifications to represent them as the specifications of the product being offered** in the compliance statement/datasheet. Such documents will **not be considered as valid** [44].

instruction: What is the mandatory action required from the bidder regarding the technical specification excel file for the HAL Tractor GeM bid?
output: An Excel Upload is Required for the **TECHNICAL COMPLIANCE MATRIX - 1761193293.xlsx** [45].

instruction: What is the mandatory period for the willingness certificate for AMC support for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software?
output: The Industry Partner will give a willingness certificate to provide AMC support for the software for **24 months** [Source context from previous conversation, confirmed as non-repeated context here].

instruction: What is the consequence if the successful L-1 bidder fails to submit the original qualification documents for verification?
output: If the successful bidder makes **misleading or false representations** in the required documents, statements and attachments, they are subject to be **disqualified**, even though they initially met the Pre-qualifying criteria [46].

instruction: What specific action can HAL take against a bidder who files a complaint for local content verification that is found to be incorrect?
output: In case the complaint is found to be incorrect, the **complaint fee shall be forfeited** [47].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum experience required for a Senior level Designer/Analyst for the Airframe Design RFQ?
output: Senior level Designers/Analyst shall have minimum **10 years of experience** [Source context from previous conversation, confirmed as non-repeated context here].

instruction: What specific action must the contractor take regarding the rejection of stores if rejected by the Inspecting Officer?
output: The seller shall, on demand, pay to the buyer the **costs incurred in the inspection and/or test** [48]. Also, the quantity of the stores or materials expended in test will be **borne by the seller** [49].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the HAL Sealant Mixing Machine GeM bid?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **2** [50, 51].

instruction: What must the bidder submit to HAL regarding the registration status of an agent from a country sharing a land border with India?
output: Vendors or Agents of a Vendor from a country sharing border with India shall submit copy of **valid registration made with Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Government of India** along with the tender mandatorily [52].

instruction: What is the mandatory IPR requirement regarding computer software generated during the IMRH/DBMRH project?
output: Intellectual Property includes **computer software** (including, without limitation, source code, object code, source code listings and object code listings that would enable the software to be reproduced or recreated) [23].

instruction: What is the warranty period for replacement stores supplied under the LPSC contract, starting from the date of arrival at the purchaser's site?
output: All the replacement stores shall also be guaranteed for a period of **12 months** from the date of arrival of the stores at purchaser's site [53, 54].

instruction: What is the mandatory period for which the bid proposal for the NPOL LFBMS EOI must remain valid?
output: The proposal shall be kept valid for a period of **180 days** from the last date of submission [55].

instruction: What are the specific components that constitute the primary deliverables for the D1 milestone (Preliminary Analysis and Methodology Documents)?
output: The D1 deliverables include: **Methodology of FE modelling for stress analysis of full airframe** and detailed airframe modules; **Estimation methodology for structural component loads** from FEM analysis; and Methodology for **F&DT analysis** [1].

instruction: What is the consequence if the Engineering Service Provider fails to sign the NDA for the HAL Airframe Design RFQ?
output: The vendors who **will not sign the NDA would not be considered for tender evaluation** [2].

instruction: What is the mandatory FTR (First Time Right) quality target for FE Modeling and Analysis (D3) deliverables?
output: The desirable FTR quality target for **FE Modeling and Analysis (D3)** is **> 98%** [3].

instruction: What is the mandatory FTR (First Time Right) quality target for Part and assembly models and drawings (D4) deliverables?
output: The desirable FTR quality target for **Part and assembly models and drawings (D4)** is **> 95%** [3].

instruction: What is the purpose of the Project Technical Monitoring Committee (PTMC) regarding the deliverables?
output: The PTMC set up against the Work Package will **review the deliverables**. The deliverable is deemed to be complete **only after PTMC accepts the same**, and **Payment shall be linked to successful completion of delivery milestones** [4, 5].

instruction: What are the two items and their quantities requested in BEL RFx 7000569182?
output: The items requested are **COLD PLATE 1 BRAZED ASSY** (Qty 1 NO) and **COLD PLATE 2 BRAZED ASSY** (Qty 1 NO) [6, 7].

instruction: What is the EOI Reference Number and Date for the NPOL Low Frequency Bow Mounted Sonar (LFBMS) tender?
output: The RFI No. is **NPOL/MM/EOI/01/25-26**, dated **15 Sept 2025** [8-11].

instruction: What are the two items and their quantity requested in BEL RFx 7000518395?
output: The item requested is **COLD PLATE - S HPA**, with a quantity of **9 NO** [12].

instruction: What is the role of the LSI (Industry Partner) during the development phase of the LFBMS prototype system?
output: The Industry Partner is responsible for **complete system integration (including subsystems developed by NPOL)**, **installation on naval platform**, and its **life-cycle maintenance till completion of Sea Trials** for the prototype system [13].

instruction: What specific components of the LFBMS prototype system is the Industry Partner responsible for developing?
output: The Industry Partner is responsible for development of the **Underwater Junction Box**, **Array Structure**, **Display Console & Processing System**, **Workstation Console & Processing System**, and **Portable Control Console** [14].

instruction: What is the timeframe for the completion of Milestone 1 for IEWS software development (Work Package 1)?
output: Milestone 1 is scheduled at **T0 + 04 Months** and requires completion of **1  28 points from Table 1** (Demonstration of functionalities) [15, 16].

instruction: What are the deliverables for the CABS IEWS software development (Work Package 1)?
output: The deliverables include: **Source code for IEWS software** along with dependent libraries; **Source code for MIMAS software** along with dependent libraries; **Source code for data level simulator**; and **SDLC Documentation to aid in software certification** as per DO 178C Level C [16].

instruction: What are the delivery schedule and associated payment percentages for the Detail Design & DWG (D4) phase?
output: The D4 phase (Detail Design & DWG) is paid in four installments, with each installment being **25% of D4**. The 4th Payment covers the completion of the first 25% of drawings/reports, and the 7th Payment covers the completion of the final 25% of D4 deliverables [17, 18].

instruction: What documents are required to be submitted under the Qualification Test Plan (QTP) for the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: The documents required are the **SOF Test Plan** and the **SOF Test to be prepared and test to be carried out** as per the requirements enclosed in Annexure-1 [19].

instruction: What protective treatments are required for the mounting surface of the Dummy LRU mockups?
output: The mounting surface must be **electro less nickel plated as per MIL-STD-26074**. All mounting trays should be **hard anodized as per MIL-STD-8625** [20, 21].

instruction: What specific technical documentation must be submitted under the Design & Development Documents section for the CASDIC Dummy LRU RFP?
output: The vendor must submit **Stress analysis of the dummy LRUs** for the loading conditions specified in the SOF test requirements and the **Material Test Report** [19].

instruction: What is the purpose of the NSTL EOI for the Infrared Signature Prediction Software for Warships?
output: The purpose of this EOI is to **short list the Industry Partners for issue of RFP** towards 'Development of Infrared Signature Prediction Software for warships' [22, 23].

instruction: What are the mandatory compliance criteria categories that must be addressed by the Industry Partner for the NSTL EOI?
output: The Industry Partner qualification criteria are categorized into four areas: **Financial, Technical, Manufacturing, and Management** [24, 25].

instruction: What specific blacklisting information must the Industry Partner submit for the NSTL EOI?
output: Industry Partner must submit information pertaining to **blacklisting by any government agency**, including blacklisting of **domestic/foreign technology partner** (if any) [24, 25].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date and Bid Opening Date for the GeM bid for the HILS Test Facility (GEM/2025/B/6013766)?
output: The Bid End Date/Time is **17-01-2025 09:00:00**. The Bid Opening Date/Time is **17-01-2025 09:30:00** [26].

instruction: What are the mandatory minimum Average Annual Turnover and Years of Past Experience required for the HILS Test Facility bid?
output: The Minimum Average Annual Turnover of the bidder (For 3 Years) must be **169 Lakh(s)**. **3 Year (s)** of Past Experience is Required for the same/similar service [27].

instruction: What is the mandatory Minimum Average Annual Turnover required for the NSTL EOI?
output: The average annual turnover during the last 3 years, ending 31st March of the previous financial year, should be at least **Rs 15 Crores** [28, 29].

instruction: What are the Bid End Date and Bid Opening Date for the BEL Cable Assembly GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6263867)?
output: The Bid End Date/Time is **03-06-2025 09:00:00**. The Bid Opening Date/Time is **03-06-2025 09:30:00** [30].

instruction: What is the required delivery time for all schedules in the BEL Cable Assembly GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6263867)?
output: The required Delivery Days for all schedules (Schedule 1 through Schedule 5) are **90 days** [31-33].

instruction: What are the EOI Submission End Date and Opening Date for the NSTL Infrared Signature Prediction Software EOI?
output: The EOI Submission End Date is **13.10.2025 (14:00 Hrs.)**. The EOI Opening Date is **14.10.2025 (14:00 Hrs.)** [34, 35].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the HAL Tractor GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6815340)?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **3** [36].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the HAL Sealant Mixing Machine GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6817036)?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **2** [37].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension for the HAL Electric Fork Lift GeM bid (GEM/2025/B/6822972)?
output: The Minimum number of bids required to disable automatic bid extension is **3** [38].

instruction: What specific information must be included in the response to the URSC IMPP EOI (Integrated Modular Power Packages)?
output: The vendor(s) shall submit the response along with: **Registered address of the company**; **Company/Organization Status** (PSU / Proprietary/MSME/ Partnership / Private Ltd., etc.) with **Name and Address of Proprietor, Partners, Board of Directors**; and **Response forms as mentioned in the EOI** [39, 40].

instruction: What is the strict IPR policy regarding the Infrared Signature Prediction Software (NSTL)?
output: The Intellectual Property (IP) Rights of the software will be **jointly with Industry partner and NSTL, DRDO**. Moreover, the Industry partner **can't use the software without the concurrence of DRDO** [34, 35].

instruction: What are the two major financial milestones (M1 and M2) and their corresponding payment percentages for the CABS IEWS/MIMAS software contracts?
output: Milestone 1 and Milestone 2 each account for **50% of the Total Cost** [41, 42]. Payment schedule is on milestone basis after achieving each milestone of **both work packages (IEWS software and MIMAS software) together** [41].

instruction: What document serves as the reference for Workmanship Standards for the Fabrication of Electronics Packages in the URSC IMPP EOI?
output: **ISRO-PAX-300** serves as the reference document for Workmanship Standards for the Fabrication of Electronics Packages [43].

instruction: What mandatory analyses must be performed at the overall PCU level for EMI-EMC and Thermal performance for the IMPP system?
output: The analyses required are **EMI-EMC analysis** at the Module and overall PCU level, and **PCB and package level thermal analysis in conduction and conduction + radiation modes** at the Overall PCU level [44].

instruction: What are the primary objectives of the D2 and D3 phases for the Airframe Design RFQ?
output: D2 and D3 cover **3D CAD Layout for interference and integration Check** and **Detail Analysis, Design and Stress/Dynamic Sizing**. Design issues are to be resolved concurrently as the Engineering Service Provider progresses and completes activities listed in D1, D2 and D3 [45-48].

instruction: What is the rule regarding the confidentiality of information shared during the NPOL EOI Meeting?
output: Industry partner attending the EoI Meeting shall **sign a non-disclosure agreement (NDA)** with NPOL that information pertaining to the proposed work **shall not be passed on /shared/ divulged in any form to any other person/agency** other than those involved in the development process [49, 50].

instruction: What are the specific materials required for the fabrication of the CASDIC Dummy LRU mockups and their hard points?
output: The mockups should be manufactured using **Aluminium Alloy 6061 T6 Condition**. All hard points (such as J hook, mounting buses, guide pins etc.) must be manufactured using **SS421 martensitic stainless steel** [20, 21].

instruction: What is the estimated complexity distribution for FEM and FEA (D3) in terms of Basic, Intermediate, and Advanced Analysis?
output: The complexity level of FEM and FEA (D3) is envisaged in the order of **20% (Basic), 60% (Intermediate) and 20% (Advanced)** [47, 51].

instruction: What must the bidder ensure regarding the structure weight targets specified during the D1 phase for the DBMRH project?
output: The **structure weight targets of parts and assemblies specified during D1 phase must be met**. Proposals for further reduction in weight using best optimisation practices are encouraged [52].

instruction: What is the mandatory IPR requirement regarding computer software generated during the IMRH/DBMRH project?
output: Intellectual Property includes **computer software**, specifically: **source code, object code, source code listings and object code listings** that would enable the software to be reproduced or recreated [1.h].

instruction: What is the mandatory delivery format for the Drawing Release Notice (DRN) and Deviation slip?
output: The Drawing Release Notice (DRN) [53] and Deviation slip/Project Slip (PS) / Deviation notes [53, 54] are required in **NX (.prt) / Teamcenter** format.

instruction: What is the maximum LD (Liquidated Damages) percentage applicable for inordinate delays in LPSC tenders?
output: In case of inordinate delay (delays of more than one-fourth (25%) of the total completion period), LD shall be applicable subject to a maximum of **10%** of the order value [55].

instruction: What must the bidder do immediately upon disclosure of Proprietary Information that is already known to them, as per the NDA terms?
output: The Receiving Party will **bring such fact to the attention of the Disclosing Party immediately upon the disclosure** [56].

instruction: What are the delivery formats required for the Deliverables 'Part Attributes and Applicability info' and 'Weight & CG report'?
output: Part Attributes and Applicability info is required in **Excel (.xlsx) /NX(.prt) / 3D PDF (.pdf)** format [54]. Weight & CG report is required in **Word Document (.docx) / NX(.prt)** format [54].

instruction: What are the two items and their quantities for BEL RFx 7000518395?
output: The item is **COLD PLATE - S HPA** (Material No. 118900005832) with a quantity of **9 NO** [12].

instruction: What are the submission and opening dates for BEL RFx 7000518395?
output: The Submission period ends on **01.04.2025 23:00:00**. The Opening date is **02.04.2025 08:00:00** [57].

instruction: What is the technical objective of HAL in seeking private participation for the IMRH/DBMRH airframe design and analysis?
output: HAL seeks response from prospective Engineering Service Providers to undertake activities related to **detail design and analysis of Airframe** [1]. The provider has to take up structural design definitions from the Preliminary Design Phase and carry out **Detailed Sizing, Detailed FEM, Stress Analysis, FE Modeling for Dynamic analysis, Mapping the requirements to functional models, Establishing the trace links to verification and validation requests, System Modeling, and Detailed Part & assembly drawings** by abiding HAL procedures [2, 3].

instruction: What is the primary product category and the total quantity for the BEL GeM bid GEM/2025/B/6263867?
output: The Primary product category is **CABLE ASSY DB9 TO D38999 26WB-35PIN - 3M** [4]. The total quantity of items across all categories in the bid is **45** [5].

instruction: What are the EMD Amount and ePBG Percentage for the LRDE GeM bid (Integration & Testing of Processing Software for Ground Test Platform)?
output: The EMD Amount is **119156** [6]. The ePBG Percentage is **3.00%** [6], and the required duration for the ePBG is **18 Months** [6].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum experience required for External Reviewers of Airframe Design, as specified in the DBMRH requirements?
output: External Reviewers should have a minimum work experience of **20 years in Airframe Design** [7]. They should preferably be Retired personnel from **HAL/NAL/DRDO** or any other private firm which is involved in similar aircraft design activities [7].

instruction: What is the consequence if pricing aspects are included in the technical bid for the HAL Tractor or Electric Fork Lift GeM tenders?
output: Bidders must ensure that **no pricing aspect is indicated in the technical bid even in the form of PDF**, otherwise the offer will get **summarily rejected** [8, 9].

instruction: What are the specific delivery milestones (in months from PO date T0) for the five main IMRH airframe modules (Front Fuselage, Centre Fuselage, Tail Boom & Empennage, Weapon Stub Wing, Cowlings & Firewalls)?
output: For all five listed modules, the schedule is: Milestone 1 (T1) is **T0 + 2 months**; Milestone 2 (T2) is **T1 + 8 months**; Milestone 3 (T3) is **T2 + 12 months**; and Milestone 4 (D5) is **T3 + 30 months** [10]. The total project timeline is **52 months** from the date of acceptance of the PO (T0) [11].

instruction: What are the specific structural hard points on the IMRH airframe that require FEM & FEA for stress analysis?
output: The IMRH Hard Points subject to FEM & FEA include: **Main Landing Gear structural attachment**, **Nose Landing Gear Structural Attachment**, **Transmission deck**, **TGB & IGB Support Structures**, **Engine mounts and Engine deck**, **Tail Boom and attachments**, **Horizontal Stabilizer (HSB) and its Attachments**, **Vertical fin and Attachments**, and **Helicopter lifting points** [12].

instruction: What specific ground test preparation documents (FEM, FEA, Test Orders) are required for the IMRH structural components?
output: The preparation documents are required for tests including: **Break Away Fuselage test**, **Tail boom test (Static + Fatigue)**, **Vertical fin Test (Static + Fatigue)**, **Horizontal Stabilizer Test (Static + Fatigue)**, **Transmission Deck (Static + Fatigue)**, and **Engine mounts (Static + Fatigue)** [13].

instruction: What are the core components of the IMRH Airframe that relate to the design and analysis scope?
output: The IMRH Airframe components include the **Front Fuselage**, **Centre Fuselage** (which provides attachment for MGB, MGB oil cooler, TDS Bearings, and Ramp/ramp door access) [14, 15], **Tail Boom and Empennage** (which supports TGB, IGB, TDS, and the horizontal stabilizer with vertical fin) [16], **Weapon Stub Wing**, and **Cowlings & Firewalls** [10].

instruction: What specific materials and standards are required for the construction of the engine floor and hot section around the engine for IMRH?
output: The hot section around the engine is to be constructed using **Titanium alloy** [17] to meet the fire-resistant requirements of **DEFSTAN / FAR-29 amdt. 59 /CS-29** and other applicable standards [17].

instruction: What structural provision must the Tail Boom for the DBMRH have, and why?
output: The Tail boom for DBMRH should have a **folding mechanism (either manual of automatic)** for meeting the **stowage requirements from Indian Navy** [18]. Additionally, the Horizontal Stabilizer will be positioned only on one side of the Tail boom for ease of folding and stowage [18].

instruction: What is the total maximum troop capacity and internal cargo capacity for the IMRH Cabin?
output: The IMRH Cabin volume should be able to accommodate a maximum of **36 troops** and should be able to carry an internal cargo of **4000 kg** [17].

instruction: What mandatory dimensional criteria must be applied to all fastener holes/axes in the 3D CAD modeling?
output: Each fastener hole/axis has to be **normal to surface and co-axially aligned with the adjacent parts/assembly** as per design standard practice [19].

instruction: What are the specific parameters that must be verified for all fasteners called in the assembly?
output: All fasteners must be verified for **inter-rivet pitch, edge distances, head clearance, head placement (outer or inner), type, material, and grip length** as per the compendium provided by HAL [19].

instruction: What mandatory process and quality targets must be achieved for composite skins in 3D CAD modeling?
output: All composite skins are to be created using the **Modeling module of NX for ply wise modelling** and **creation of ply-book** [20]. Test Data Sheets for composite components of Duty Class I and II are also required [20].

instruction: What document serves as the reference for Workmanship Standards for the Fabrication of Electronics Packages in the URSC IMPP EOI?
output: **ISRO-PAX-300** is one of the applicable documents/standards listed in Annexure C [216 (contextual knowledge)].

instruction: What is the mandatory minimum experience required for the Engineering Service Provider (bidder) in Airframe Design and Analysis?
output: The Engineering Service Provider should have minimum **Seven years of experience** in Airframe Design and Analysis of Fixed wing or Rotary wing Aircraft with proven examples of capability and projects in Aero-structure  Design, Drafting, MBD, Analysis and Simulations (Stress, Dynamics, F&DT, Thermal, CFD, Loads, and Dynamics etc.) [21].

instruction: What are the specific deliverables required in NX (.prt) format?
output: Deliverables required in NX (.prt) format include: **Deviation slip/ Project Slip (PS) / Deviation notes** [22], **2D Development of Sheet Metal parts** [23], **Tolerance Stack up Analysis reports** [23], and the **Bill of Material / material schedule** [24].

instruction: What is the classification and percentage distribution for the complexity level of detailed CAD models (D4)?
output: The complexity level of detailed CAD models (D4) is classified based on equivalent drawing sheet size: **A4  20%**, **A3-30%**, **A2- 20%**, **A1- 15%**, and **A0- 15%**. This distribution is indicative and subject to **mutual agreement** between HAL and the Engineering service Provider [25].

instruction: What mandatory certification must the Engineering Service Provider have for the DBMRH design analysis?
output: The Engineering Service Provider must possess **Accreditation to EN9100 / AS9100D** [7].

instruction: What key documents, besides the technical compliance statements, must be submitted along with the RFQ response?
output: Key documents listed in the enclosures that must be submitted include: **Vendor Qualification Form (Enclosure VII)**, **Service provider detail form (Enclosure VIII)**, **Format of Omnibus and standalone IP format (Enclosure IX)**, **NDA Format (Enclosure- X)**, **PBG Format (Enclosure-XI)**, **Payment Plan (Enclosure- XII)**, and the **Check List (Enclosure-XIII)** [26].

instruction: What specific analyses related to reliability must be performed at the circuit level for all IMPP circuits/modules?
output: The required circuit-level analyses are: **Failure Mode Effect and Criticality Analysis (FMECA)** [27], **Worst Case Circuit Analysis (WCCA), Monte-carlo analysis, and Sensitivity analysis (SA)** [27], and **De-rating analysis (DA)** [27].

instruction: What are the power handling and dissipation limits for the Power Module (PM) in the URSC IMPP system?
output: The Power Module handles **1250W of battery power** and **2000W of solar array power** [28]. The module should able to handle maximum power dissipation of **45W** [28].

instruction: How many Power Modules (PMs) are required for the planned 3 EM models of PCU handling 10KW of output power?
output: **Eight power modules** are required (with one module as redundant) to process the battery power for the planned 3 EM models of PCU for handling 10KW of output power [29].

instruction: What are the input voltage ranges for the Battery Live & Return and the Solar Array Live & Return Inputs to the Power Module?
output: The input voltage ranges are: **66V  96V** for the Battery Live & Return Input, and **0V  105V** for the Solar Array Live & Return Input [29].

instruction: What is the grounding scheme required for the MVL card, specifically concerning the BDR MVL and SAR MVL circuits?
output: The MVL card requires **two grounding planes** to have isolation between BDR MVL and SAR MVL [30]. The BDR MVL circuit is connected to a ground plane that has provision to be referred to **signal ground in the PCB or to power ground** through the interfacing connector. The grounding follows the **DSPG scheme** [30].

instruction: What is the total power handling and dissipation for the Boost Shunt Regulator (BSR)?
output: The BSR handles **100V @ 12A**, totaling **1200W power**, with a dissipation of **30W** [31].

instruction: What communication protocol is mandated for external communication from the Core Power Electronics (CPE) packages?
output: For external communication, the **1553B protocol** shall be used [32].

instruction: What are the mandatory input signals and their voltage levels for the Power Module (PM)?
output: The inputs are: Battery Live & Return Input (**66V  96V**), Solar Array Live & Return Input (**0V  105V**), Bias Supply (**14.7V, 5.5V, 12.7V**), MVL Signal (**11V**), and Tele-command (**28V & 5V 64ms pulse, 5V level**) [29].

instruction: What are the mechanical and functional specifications for the Random Vibration test of the CASDIC Dummy LRUs?
output: The Random Vibration test (MIL-STD-810 F SEC 514.5) requires a **Frequency sweep during resonance search at 0.5g from 5 Hz to 2000 Hz** [33]. The Random vibration level is from **20 Hz to 2000 Hz** in all three axes as per the specified profile [33, 34], and the test duration is **15 min per axis** [33].

instruction: What is the total number of LRUs (Line Replaceable Units) comprising the Dummy Units that require fabrication and testing for the CASDIC RFP?
output: The dummy units (based on Table 2 Part Numbers of Dummy LRUs) consist of: ATRU Unit Dummy (02 Qty), ATRU Tray (02 Qty), Antenna Array Unit Dummy (04 Qty), Core EW Unit Dummy (01 Qty), Core EW Unit Tray (01 Qty), Dual Antenna with Radome- Port Dummy (01 Qty), Dual Antenna with Radome- STBD Dummy (01 Qty), Dual FEA Dummy (03 Qty), and Rx Antenna Dummy (02 Qty) [35].

instruction: What are the mandatory protective treatments for the external and mounting surfaces of the Dummy LRUs?
output: Protective treatment includes **Chromate conversion as per MIL-STD-5541** [36]. External surfaces must be painted as per **Poly urethane paint  DTD 5580 or MIL-C-85285** [36]. Mounting surfaces must be **electro less nickel plated as per MIL-STD-26074** [36], and all mounting trays should be **hard anodized as per MIL-STD-8625** [36].

instruction: What is the purpose of the NSTL EOI for the Infrared Signature Prediction Software?
output: The purpose of this EOI is to **short list the Industry Partners for issue of RFP** towards 'Development of Infrared Signature Prediction Software for warships' [37, 38].

instruction: What are the specific requirements concerning the security and handling of vendor engineers' personal belongings and IT access at HAL premises?
output: Vendor engineers selected for deputation must undergo **Police verification** [39]. They are **not permitted to bring in any data storage or data transmitting devices**, including: mobile phones, laptops/PCs, WIFI devices, cameras, smart watches, pen drives, external storage devices, SSD devices, microphones, card readers, micro cameras, Go-pro cameras, or listeners [20 (implied by IT security annexure)].

instruction: List the three Independent External Monitors (IEMs) appointed by the Central Vigilance Commission for the Integrity Pact (IP).
output: The present IEMs are: **Shri Ashok Kumar Tripathy, IAS (Retd.)** (E-Mail ID: tripathyak@yahoo.com); **Shri Sunil Kumar Bansal, IPS (Retd.)** (E-mail: sunilku555@gmail.com); and **Shri Chaitanya Kumar Varma, CE&MES (Retd.)** (E-Mail ID: ck_varma@yahoo.co.in) [40].

instruction: How must the bidder submit their request for clarification related to the Integrity Pact (IP)?
output: Query related to IP can be sent **to the IEM** [41]. However, all other clarifications/query/status related to the tender should be forwarded **to HAL only and not to the IEM** [41].

instruction: What are the full details and required quantity for the item in BEL RFx 7000518395?
output: The item is **COLD PLATE - S HPA**, Material No. **118900005832**, with a quantity of **9 NO** [42].

instruction: What are the two items and their material numbers for BEL RFx 7000569182?
output: Item 1 is **COLD PLATE 1 BRAZED ASSY**, Material No. **118099943527** (Qty 1 NO). Item 2 is **COLD PLATE 2 BRAZED ASSY**, Material No. **118099943624** (Qty 1 NO) [43, 44].

instruction: What two mandatory documents must the bidder submit to NSTL for the formal issue of the RFP after shortlisting?
output: The RFP will be issued only to short-listed Industry Partners who meet all the qualification criteria/requirements after submitting duly signed **NDA documents** [45, 46] and a duly signed compliance statement against all evaluation categories with all proof of documents [47, 48].

instruction: What must be included in the 'Light Weight representation of CAD Model' deliverable?
output: The Light Weight representation of the CAD Model must be delivered in **NX (.jt) format** [23, 24] and include **Bounding Box information** [24].

instruction: What are the required input and output specifications for the Hall Effect Sensor in the Accumulator?
output: The Input Voltage is **5 V DC** [49]. The output is **0 to 5 V Analog Step output** [49], where the Analog output for the **Highest** position is **4.68 0.4 Volts** and the **Lowest** position is **0.3125 0.1 Volts** [50].

instruction: What analysis methodology documents must be part of the D1 deliverables for the IMRH/DBMRH project?
output: The methodology documents must cover: **Methodology of Drawing and Model making** [51]; **Methodology of FE modelling for stress analysis** of full airframe and detailed airframe modules [51]; **Estimation methodology for structural component loads** from FEM analysis [52]; **Static, Fatigue, Crash and Damage analysis methodology documentations** [52, 53]; and **Methodology of FE modelling for Dynamic analysis** of full airframe and detailed airframe modules [53].

instruction: What structural modification activities are required on the LCA Front Fuselage for the SDR modification?
output: Front Fuselage modifications include: **Removal of old NLG Door and Installation of New Door** [54]; **Replacement of Door Assy-Bot (Sta#16-#17) with new Door** [54]; and **Layout, marking, drilling and installation of Bracket** for the SDR Splitter, V/UHF Antenna (BOT), and SDR GPS Antenna [54, 55].

instruction: What are the mandatory software requirements for the overall system software of the Automated Test System (ATE) for IMPP?
output: The overall system software must be **compatible with the existing software present with URSC, Bangalore** [56]. The system must also have the ability to scale to a **Real Time OS based ATE** in the future, which can also be programmed using **Lab-VIEW** [56].

instruction: What is the mandatory security requirement regarding the IP addresses of bidders in GeM bids?
output: GeM is capturing and displaying the IP address used by the buyer and the seller(s). If **IP address of bidders are found to be the same, then offers of such bidders are liable for disqualification** [8, 9].
